story:
Her name is Starlady, and she's a comic book heroine unlike any other.

Elegant, black, wise, and beautiful, Starlady handles villains a little differently: instead of simply beating her opponents, with love she uses her crystal to show them their past, which creates a crisis of conscience, giving them startling new perspective on their actions and new choices to make.

This is the dream heroine of veteran artist Victor "Vic" Carrabotta.

Born in 1929, Carrabotta's career includes service in the Marine Corps, working as an Art Director, and of course, working for Jack Kirby at Atlas Comics, the predecessor for what is now Marvel. One of the original artists for Spider-Man, Vic's name has appeared alongside Stan Lee.

Carrabotta's next career move is to see his dream character come to life, as Starlady is indistinguishable from his alter ego.

At 87, Vic still has stories left to tell. He has drawn, written, and longs to publish the first edition of Starlady. His work is debuted at GalaxyFest in Colorado Springs, CO.

Vic is also a confirmed guest for Denver Comic Con 2017! Don't miss the opportunity to check him out Friday, June 30th through Sunday, July 2nd!

Starlady is written by Vic's creative partner Ren Bertrand and colored by Luna Douglass. An article in the Colorado Springs Independent features the collaboration between Vic's old-school style with Luna's digital colorization skillset.

With your kindness, Victor Carrabotta will fulfill his legacy!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Goal: $12,000

To complete the first edition of Starlady, we have to cover the expenses for art & inking, coloring, printing, distribution & shipping costs, travel fees for the team, and, of course, your perks!

All contributions are valuable. For those who make perk-eligible donations, they will receive their perks whether we reach our goal or not.


The Impact

This character's story is more than Vic Carrabotta's dream—it's his legacy.

After a lifetime in comic book art and other art-based businesses, Vic deeply desires to leave a legacy to the comic book world: Starlady.  Elegant, black, wise, and beautiful, Starlady's superpower is love, a love that gives wrong-doers the opportunity to do right.

When you give to this project, you make an 87-year-old comic artist and Marine veteran's dream come true. You bring the world of comic book storytelling something brand new in the "old school" style.

This campaign will jumpstart an entire series. Two additional issues are already in the works!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest hurdle is having the funds necessary to fulfill Vic's creation of the comic, donor perks, and support for the incredible talent and energy of the team creating this fundraising campaign.

Every penny of your support will go to the legitimate expenses as listed above to give Star Lady—and Victor Carrabotta—life in the comic fan world.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, we still need your help!

  • Please help us spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends and family!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter for updates!

Help Vic bring his finest work to life!

 

Meet the Team!

Cherish Tisdale, "Starlady" Actress

Cherish is the actress and model who portrays Starlady at cons. An avid comic book fan, Cherish is excited to play her part in a comic series that will bring a positive message to the world and serve as a role model for diverse people of all ages.

Luna Douglass, Colorist

After much formal education and training, Lura "Luna" Douglass took her incredible skills in graphic design and drawing to the next level with her business, Lunarts Design. She is responsible for colorizing Starlady and is honored to work alongside a veteran from the Golden Age of Comics.

Ren Bertrand, Writer

A very close friend of Vic, Ren is the person who renewed Vic's faith in Starlady. From the very beginning, Ren selflessly devoted his talents to Vic every time he needed them. Raising a family of his own, Ren is happy to write about a superhero who will inspire his children with love and goodness. He is a lifetime comic book reader and extremely proud to work with an icon like "Quick Vic."

Jeremiah Acosta, Business/Budget

A business student, Jeremiah also currently serves in the United States Marine Corps—just like Vic did long ago. Eager to help a fellow Marine, Jeremiah is responsible for developing the initial budget and giving his brother, Joseph, his superhuman business talents. Oorah!

Joseph Acosta, Campaign Manager

Joseph Acosta is a writer and filmmaker for Gentle Acorn Productions. Lending his skills in social media, writing, and videography, Joseph joined this project following his graduation from Carroll College, where he studied Communication and TV Production.

Jacqueline Haag, Publisher

Mother’s House Publishing Inc.

Jacqueline Haag is a 30-year Colorado resident and locally-renowned publisher. She met Vic about ten years ago when he illustrated a book she published, titled Angels Earn Their Wings. As Vic went on to produce additional book covers for Jackie, the two became fast friends. Jackie is committed to giving Vic everything she can to fulfill his legacy with Starlady.

story:
From creating superheroes on paper, to saving orangutans in real life.

Our international network of creators across the globe captured the lives and struggles of orangutans in the medium we know best – COMICS. We used our social media support network to expose and add focus to the plight of orangutans currently on the brink of extinction in the wild. 

Our mission is to raise funds for The Orangutan Project (TOP), the world's foremost not-for-profit organisation, supporting orangutan conservation, rain-forest protection, local community partnerships and the rehabilitation and reintroduction of displaced orangutans back into the wild.

We have spent months coordinating the creators’ efforts and creating a voice online, and from here, we need your help!


Headed by Neville Howard and Alana Bruyn of Melbourne Comics in Australia, we’ve invited collaborators from across the globe including United States, Canada, Australia, South Africa and the United Kingdom to submit work to our cause.  To date, we have 60 creators' work submitted and counting! (All contributors credited at the bottom of this thread)

We’ll be publishing a 32 page ‘floppy’ comic, alongside a more comprehensive 60+ page comic featuring pin-ups and short stories starring our honoured guests, the orangutans.



We’d love to change the world. We’d love to build perfect shelters and reintroduce each and every orangutan to a safe habitat, but we understand that it all costs money. As result, we have set ourselves a modest target: To nurture, educate and support a single orangutan through the transition back into the wild - $4,000 (after offsetting reward print costs) We did make the project 'flexible funding' as every bit counts and although our ultimate goal is to hit our target, we'd like to ensure every cent goes toward the charity even if we don't get there.

100% of the funds raised will go toward our target. Do we want to do more? YES, but we can’t do it alone! 




Reaching our goal will enable the release of one orangutan, including monitoring, transportation and caring during the transition. The sites nominated for release are Sungai Pengian Station and Camp Buluh Orangutan Release Site.

What makes our campaign unique is the blend of original art, prints and stories which makeup the contributions. Some artists whom work in traditional medium were nice enough to contribute their original work.

All perks due for delivery Mid to Late July.

Please note Shipping cost: Add 'gift/donation' of $6 Shipping for shipping within Australia, Add 'gift/donation' of $10 Shipping for outside of Australia upon check out.











Q: How can I help?

A: Donate and/or spread the word of #ProjectOrangutan and #TangoWithOrangos through social media like Facebook and Twitter.

Q: Can I donate offline?

A: We’re all about visibility, but if that’s the only way you can donate, we will happily accept it, and add your donation to the kitty (with the associated credit and reward as required)

Q: What happens if we don’t raise all the money?

A: We’ll keep our goal open ended, so if we don’t meet our target, whatever is raised will still be collected and donated!

Q: When will I get my perks?

A: We are currently targeting mid-July to complete all pre-order distributions, but you will be notified of any delays.

Q: Will any perks go out before the campaign is completed?

A: Unfortunately, no.

Q: What if I want more than one perk?

A: You can make multiple gifts on Indiegogo using a single account. Just make sure you use the same email address and login, so we’ll know that all of your perks are meant to go to the same person.

Q: How much is shipping? What if I'm an international donor?

A: Shipping is included in the perk price, regardless of your location. If you would like to offset the cost of international shipping, we welcome additional gifts of any amount. To do this, simply add an additional gift amount during your perk purchase/check out.

Q: How will I get my digital download perk?

A: By email.

Q: What if I want one of the perks and it is sold out?

A: We’ll leave no stone un-turned to help you out, but in some cased items may be limited due to their uniqueness!

Team: 

Neville Howard (Australia): Melbourne Comics, Velocity                           
Alana Bruyn (Australia): Melbourne Comics 
Moray Rhoda (South Africa): Velocity, SAComics and many more
Darren Close (Australia): Killeroo
Rupert Greyling (United Kingdom): Velocity
Galo Ramiro Gutierrez (United States): Project-Nerd 

Contributions submitted by: 
Caitlin Tolsma, Cameron Hodkinson, Coral Briglia, Corey Wyer, Craig Bruyn, Cristian Roux, Darren Close, Darren Koziol, Dave Azte, Dave Dye, Drew Bird, Evan Jones, Erin Hunting, Frank Candiloro, Gee Hale, Ian C. Thomas, Ken Best, Kobus Deysel, Louie Joyce, Luke Andrew, Mark Lauthier, Nathanael Hopkins-Smith, Luisa Russo, Paul Caggegi, Rob O Connor, Rupert Greyling, Shane W Smith, Simon Wright, Thomas Thung, Matt Nicholls, Thuyen Nguyen, Daniel o Callaghan, Jessica Gibson, Andrez Bergen, Bron Mitchell, Deon De Lange, Fiona N Michael Doyle, Kenny Chan, MC Drawn, Maarten Bouw, Richard Chin, Paul Rebec, Mike Speakman, Martin Lizarraga, James Casson, Vandal Hype, Matthew Aslin, Sonja Aslin, Paul Mason, Erin Hunting, Dan Watts, Paul Bradford, Matt Kyme, Leticia and Molera Vasquez

story:
Short Summary

At WASHED Entertainment, we're building a world of stories. As life-long fans of myths, monsters, and epic stories, we aim to take a new approach at fantasy and sci-fi. We're a generation of story tellers raised on the best movies and comic books and looking to take some of those elements to a new generation. We cater to kids of all ages, and this year, we're publishing four novels and a comic book.

While this campaign is really for the first issue of our comic -- a truly grand retelling of the King Arthur legend inspired by modern stories like Harry Potter and Game of Thrones -- we're also using it to showcase some of WASHED's other offerings in novel format. A great story is a great story, regardless of the media, and if you're here for incredible art, dynamic characters, and a story you won't soon forget, you'll get those in our other books, as well.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The book is already funded and well into development, with items scheduled to ship this summer (barring any other delays out of our control).  The comic book is drawn and designed by artist Grace Holsten. She has given me rough thumbnails of every page of the book and is halfway through the final inks on issue 1. 

We're looking for a little extra to pay the colorist. The goal is to give all backers (including the ones from Kickstarter who have already funded the project) to get the best quality product we can make.

Backer rewards range from the comic itself to The Dark Communion novel, written by the same author and taking place in the same world.

 

Risks & Challenges

The potential risks facing us here are ones beyond our control. As of this writing, our dragon patches are sitting at the manufacturer in Taiwan, unable to ship to the U.S. due to Covid19 restrictions. Our comic printer is in China, and while we've been told that there are no delays at this time, delays could come up.

However, rest assured, you will get your products. Everything will ship to you as soon as we have them on-hand, and the digital rewards will go out as soon as they're available.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you dig the project but just can't contribute at this point, that's okay. We know the world is in a weird state right now and many are hurting financially. But you can still help!

Please consider getting word out! Share with your friends on social media and send them back here to take a look.  Then, once the project is complete, stop by www.WASHEDentertainment.com where the book will be available after the campaign closes.

story:
Do you like horror? Comics? Gritty, thoughtfully written storylines with deep characters, and beautifully dark illustrations? If so Sharpe Knives will be right up your alley! My name is Anthony Cotter (also known in the music world as AcidBrain) and my friend, underground horror art extraordinaire Martin Trafford, has done an incredible job of illustrating my writing debut! This comic was born from a concept I've been developing for over a decade, and with your help its inception will finally be realized!

We have set an ambitious goal of $2000 for this campaign! What we hope to accomplish for you here is a limited first press of issue #1 in the form of a high quality, glossy cover, graphic novel style art book that will represent the start of the series! There will also be a digital PDF version of the comic for all contributors! We also have some other cool perks including red on black Sharpe Knives logo t-shirts, signed art post-cards, and for our most generous contributors there will be a few spots for cameos in issue #2 and even the original character sketch Martin did for our main character! A big part of the reason we chose Indiegogo to help raise funds, is even if we don't reach our goal, we'll still be able to use whatever we do raise, to ensure that everyone who contributes gets what they expect!  

We truly hope for this comic to make a splash in the underground horror world! Provoking enough interest in issue #1 could allow us to continue the franchise throughout more issues,  and to see it through to its bloody conclusion! We feel the story we're telling here has a great deal of potential to serve as an edgy, true grit, breath of fresh air into the genre! Martin Trafford's artwork, along with his astounding repertoire of both previous, and current works of horrific art spanning countless indie films and other projects should certainly help us hit the ground running! Our ultimate long term goal for Sharpe Knives is to one day see it brought to life in the form of a full length feature film!

Even if you can't afford to contribute at this time, please give our campaign a share! Any exposure we can get is helpful and hugely appreciated!

story:
The Who

Ay there- I'm Curtis, code name 'Cujo'.  I suppose I play the role of new media, podcaster, reporter, and on this collaboration as artist, writer and network profiler.  But the shortest answer is someone who seeks to help independent artists/network alike level up and get paid.

You may find my voice in the following networks-

  • International toy podcast 'G.I. Joburg'
  • Sci-fi conspiracy podcast '30 minutes of Diabolical'
  • Long Beach cannabis conversation podcast '#green15'
  • cameos on various other podcasts available upon request.
  • Bearded Dragon fans

twitter @86cujo  

The 'BL^CK BOOK'

As media evolves everyday you find yourself at the intersection of how an independent network can build a signal.  That intersection is the 'BL^CK BOOK'.  

This blueprint is a team-up of artists on a book leading to a flashpoint...JOE FEST in Augusta GA, June 21/22.  The book will be a limited print run of 1k leading up to 5.15.19 with the possibility of a bonus run if it catches fire. All artists/podcasters/network involved will get paid every additional printing.

  • 1 /$20 2/$50 if two books are purchased- a personal perk tbd.   
  • Your team up w/ the BL^CK BOOK will get each collaborator a minimum of 2 paydays.
  • This is a flex campaign, if 5 books are sold, those 5 savvy minds will get them.
  • Limited run, think Eastman w/ early TMNT books, not saying its that good...not saying its not.

Wanna Team-up?

Are you G.I. JOE? Do you root for underdogs? The BL^CK BOOK is your dark horse.

Your team up of $20/$50 will bring you into an squad of independent creators assembled to create a culture in one book.  Conversation. An album. All designed to go viral.  But possibly most important is the example of how all fans of the smartest fandom in pop culture, G.I. JOE, can come together to create a signal to support its indie scene.

Personally for me- Its a concept I hope can become a rough blueprint for other creators to improve upon and empower other indies to team-up. In an age where the comics, nay, publication medium is in flux, creatives need to find intuitive partners and a model for all to get compensated.

A percentage of your purchase will go to charity at JOE FEST. 

Experience in the field?

I do have a successful 'gofundme' campaign under my belt- last year the South African toy podcast 'G.I. Joburg' and I teamed up w/ the JOE community to bring them to JOE CON 2018.  This is a logical next step as it will pay creators in South Africa, UK, Sweden and the good ole U.S. as well.

Not a fan of comics? Get 1. You dig comics? Get 2 - cause you're gonna want to give one to an independent creator.

MISSION SPECS:

Details on the BL^CK BOOK are fluid but this campaign is now live- stay tuned to updates for talent in or talking about the book to be revealed during the countdown.

Attendees of JOE FEST in Augusta June 21/22 will def want to team-up as it will enhance the weekend for all involved. details tba

  • 40+ pages of surreal colors and military intrigue
  • regular updates/livestreams on progress leading to the 5.15.19 deadline

AFTERMATH

Your trust and team-up with myself and the BL^CK BOOK would be both humbling and an investment that will not be taken lightly.  I am thankful for all those who have collaborated and will as the pages continue to take shape. 

Those attending JOE FEST will pick up their books at a table tbd, while those books being shipped will be sent shortly after / early July. 

There really is no downside- I'm invested, there are over 2 years of my line art on these pages, the style ebbs and flows but if you choose to team up on this book, you are in for a hellova ride and also very classy for supporting new creators. cheers.

Silent but deadly...

If you take a flyer - no stress. but please feel free to boost the signal, link to a comic reader in your life, or just someone that needs a glimpse of the BL^CK BOOK :)

International toy podcast 'G.I. Joburg'
Sci-fi conspiracy podcast '30 minutes of Diabolical'

cameos on various other podcasts available upon request.
Bearded Dragon fans

story:
My first book, The Supers #1, was an anthology comic book with many brilliant artists involved in realizing the vision. The Supers #2 will be no different. While all the stories will be written by me, Chris Morris, a host of amazing artistic talents will be collaborating with me in making my character's adventures a reality.

  • The Supers main story artist: Ricky Gunawan
  • Membership Drive artist: Daniel Schneider; colourist/letterer: Chase Kantor
  • The Ameezing Road Trip artist: MJ Barros
  • The Flight Home artist: Chelsea Crutchley
  • Ace's Night Out artist: Cindy Gauthier
  • Eddy Remembers artist: Carl Morgans
  • The Bullpen artist: Cam Hayden
  • plus pinups and one-pager comics by artists Jeff Martin, Elaine Will, Max Henrique, Rob van Overmeeren, Michelle Lysohirka, Edgar Vazquez and others!

Keep reading! I'll share my vision with you.

The Local news did a story about my comic book adventures HERE

What is This About?

I'm Chris Morris, an independent comic book creator, and my goal is to make great, diverse, and inclusive comics. That pretty much sums up the goal!

I've been reading comics my whole life and have already self-published one book, The Supers: 3rd Best Super-Team in the World #1. Continuing the stories of The Supers in this next comic is very important to me and I hope it becomes important to you as well! I truly think diversity and representation in comic books are of vital importance in 2019 and making this book a reality will help prove that point and make a contribution to diversity in the industry.

Why Do This Campaign?

Truthfully, publishing a comic is neither easy nor affordable. From paying the amazing artists to actually publishing the book, things cost money to do it right and I need your help. The exciting part for you is that you get to participate in the making of a comic book! You get your name in a comic book! You can actually be drawn in as a character in the comic book!

The Impact

The world has made some great strides in the last few years, but we can always do better.

  • This comic book contains characters with different body types, of different races, characters who openly identify as LGBTQ, who have differing religious beliefs, who are disabled, who have alopecia, or peanut allergies. I want as many people as possible to find themselves or someone they identify with in the pages of The Supers because comics really are for everyone.
  • The first comic book I self-published, The Supers: 3rd Best Super-team in the World #1, took six years to finish so I'm hoping with your help #2 won't take quite as long! Less time means the stories, art, and messages can get into your hands as soon as possible.
  • In my first Indiegogo campaign I had one artist, Ricky Gunawan, who was brave enough to go on the journey with me. Ricky is still involved today and along the way I have added other incredible artists to the team. By contributing to this campaign you can help talented artists continue to make their art and pay their bills.

Risks & Challenges

Why should you trust me with your money and how do you know this isn't something I came up with on a whim? This will be my second crowdfunding campaign. I have learned a lot since that first campaign: all about publishing a comic book, how to work and collaborate with artists, how to talk their language, what a "bleed" is, how to get an ISBN number, etc. I'm well-versed in how to make the best use of these funds and deliver on my promises.

Funding is always the annoying obstacle to great dreams. Nothing comes for free, but many great things are worth fighting for and investing in. Funding in this case will ensure I pay my artists (artists must always be paid for their talent and time), that I will get to work with a graphic designer on proper formatting, and that I'll have a print company that can carry this out (relatively) affordably and with high quality standards. Your contribution to the campaign will help make this happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't send me money, I understand. But you can still lend a hand!

  • Are you on Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram? Please send out the signal early and often.
  • How do you do this? Scroll up and click Indiegogo's social media buttons . . . it's that simple to spread the word and make an impact.

I realize this is about me asking you for your hard-earned money and I don't take that lightly. Thank you for taking the time to look at this campaign for The Supers #2.  I really appreciate it!

And now, take a peek at more wondrous illustrations!

story:
STORY:

 

Apex Prime, one of the GREATEST heroes on Earth, had a wife and a family...and then he fell in love with someone else.

- This 36pg, full color one-shot is the first chapter of "The Affinity Gauntlet" Saga

Years after his affair tore their family apart, Apex Prime, Earth's greatest superhero attempts a troubled reconciliation with his embittered, super-powered son.

"There are great depictions of joy, conflicting with guilt, anguish, and righteousness."
                                                        - Brian Vo (Crisp Comics)

 

 

The Comic:


 

Newstand: 36 pages; full color one-shot

Variant Cover: Virgin Cover, 36 pages; full color one-shot

Graphic Novel: 60 pages; full color one-shot; featuring comic script.



The Secret History:

The Trouble w/Love was originally published in July of 2012, as a stand alone one-shot by Vantage:Inhouse Productions.  Since its release, TTwL has been shown to fit within a larger narrative, that dares to traverse the bounds of space and time, forcing the characters to confront their worst choices in pursuit of love and happiness.  

The Roster of the FIRST Trilogy...

- The Trouble w/Love
- Never Too Late
- No Win

 

The Team:

story:
Sticker & Button Designs 

 

 

Overview 

 The Black Car is a brand new Pulp Horror anthology series brought to you by New Jersey local Michael (Kaz) Kasyjanski. Joining him on this collection of fright filled stories are up & coming, and established artist such as; Josh Maikis (Kubert School Graduate), Anthony Gambino (Marvel comics Graphic Designer), Gregory Ramos (Kubert School Graduate), & last but not least Eric Rossi (Kubert School Graduate). The four of us have been working diligently on this project for quite some time, & look forward to bringing this dream into a reality.  

In what will soon become a fast favorite among horror enthusiast everywhere. The Black Car series is a love letter to the classic Pulp comics of the 50's with a dash of Men in Black. It is a modern twist on a classic Horror, Sci-Fi mix. If you enjoy things along the likes of The Twilight zone, X-Files,  or Hous of Mystries this is for you! 

The Black Car Vol.1 collects the first three stories, accumulating to over 35 pages of terrifying, and bone chilling mysteries. Through out these edge sitting adventures we follow our  "heroes" Agent Black & Golde of the O.S.S.  A long thought disbanded branch of the U.S. military which has been operating in secret for decades now. Taking care of the dangerous, & sometime otherworldly  threats that we believe can only exist in our dreams.   

 

But it's a comic so it would probably be better to shown rather than tell.

 

The Following pages have been drawn by Josh Maikis & colored by Eric Rossi

These Next few Pages have also been drawn by Josh Maikis but colored by Gregory Ramos

Pencils & Inks by Gregory Ramos

 

 

 

 

 

The following piece is done completely by Anthony Gambino

 

So what’s the plan?

The goal for this campaign is set to 5,000$. The money is to be used to finish up the art on the project as well as pay for the lettering. It is also to be used for the initial print run of the comic, marketing, and to fund the fabulous perks we have planned for you generous backers.  From  an Indiegogo exclusive button & stickers pack designed by the astounding Anthony Gambino! A one of a kind limited to contripbuters of the Indiegogo only print by Mark James owner of Circle of Fire Tattoo's. To script readings by Me (Kaz), & my personal favorite is the one of a kind 4"x6" commission being offered by the main man Josh Maikis himself!  

 

How This Project Will Impact Me and You

By backing this project you will be funding the creation of a fantastic universe not unlike a God! We plan to fill this universe with even more mind bending, teeth chattering adventures for years to come. Spanning from the noxious fume filled turnpike of New Jersey to the frigid mountains of eastern European & one day space itself! But we cant do it without your help every dollar & post helps us immensely  & is much appreciated! 

 

Risks & Challenges

Though this is our first fundraising campaign we are 100% committed to this project.  We are just about 70% of the way done with the project & do not see any delays  in the future. However,  with the virus going around we are unsure of the printers situation. We are hoping this will blow over before the start of June, but if not a delay may be caused for the physical copies due to printing being unavailable. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can still help us by sharing this page online and getting the word out to friends and family members who are fans of horror, mysteries & other stories of this type. Every little bit helps and is much appreciated.  Word of mouth goes a long way these days. We thank you for all the help!

story:
Turning 5 Comics into One Volume

I'm looking to raise funds so I can combine the 5 issues of my on going comic book series Night Rain into an over 130 page graphic novel. I will also be adding new things like Bonus Art and a new section called The Archaea Files as extras only found in the graphic novel.

Reviews of all my comics can be found on the bottom of the page at: jw-stores.com


The Story

An ordinary man named James is living a lackluster life, simply goes through the motions of each day with a frown on his face. This all changes one night when he is attacked on his way home from work, waking up the next morning to find that he has a strange creature bonded to his abdomen.

Soon realizing that this odd being gives him the power to alter his body (among other things), James’ life begins to change from one of monotony to one of excitement, intrigue, and danger as otherworldly creatures start to take an interest in him and his newfound friend.

 

The Main Characters

James Ash: The person who the story centers around. After a fateful encounter he finds himself bonded to a strange creature that speaks to him in his mind and gives him strange abilities.

Ted: The strange creature.

He bonds with James to save his life after he is attacked.

Hooded Man: The mysterious figure.

He attacks James without warning, looking down at him silently before he turns around and walks away with out a word.

Emma Wells: The boss's daughter.

She meets James after he saves her from being controlled by a strange creature of her own.

Anthony Peters: The new friend.

He first runs into James when he is asked to train him for his new job at NightLife. The two of them become fast friends.

Deimos: The nemesis.

He hates James and Ted with a passion and does everything he can to make their lives difficult, both in person and behind the scenes.

 

Things You'll Find in This Story

There are a lot of cool action scenes!


But I also like to mix in some humor as well.


And heartfelt scenes too.

 

Here Are Some Pins You Can Get As a Perk

 

The Team

This is a 2 man team consisting of Myself and Camilo Zepeda. I am the creator/writer, editor, and publisher of the series. Camilo is the artist, letterer, and colorist on the series.

Even though he is based in Chile and I'm in the United States we complete new pages of work every week, and have done so for going on 3 years now. I find his artwork to quite good, if I may be so bold.

 

Back it Vs. Selecting a Perk

When you decide to contribute to the funding of this project (thank you very much for believing in my work!) please be sure to select a perk on the right hand side. If you only click the "Back it" button and don't choose a perk then that will be registered by Indiegogo as a donation that doesn't want/expect any perk in return. You can read more details about this in the "Updates" section at the top of the page just under the opening video.

 

Risks & Challenges

I would say the risks are rather minimal. I also keep my word so if you select a perk I can promise you it will get to you. The only thing I will say is that if orders turn out to be really large, and since I would have to do all the shipping myself (or higher some help if enough funds are raised), there might be some delays but I will do my best to limit any long term delays of your orders.


Other Ways You Can Help

I know in these tough times not everyone can pitch in financially, and that's okay. If you can't I ask that you share this campaign everywhere that you can. That kind of support is just as important as monetary support and goes a long way :)
 

International Shipping

For those outside the USA who choose physical items that need to be shipped please be aware that I'll be using a flat rate international shipping box that will add $38 in shipping costs to any of the $20 and up perks you select (sorry.)
 

Stretch Goals

- At $7000 I'll create variant cover for the graphic novel and a new Perk to go along with it.

- At $10,000 new chibi pins will be created & sent to people who selected the $50 and up Perks.

- At $15,000 new T-shirts will be created & sent to people who selected the $200 and up Perks.

- At $20,000 a concept art book will be created & sent to people who selected the $500 and up Perks.

- Over $20,000 and I'll think of some more cool stuff to create for you!


Here are some full pages for you to enjoy!

He first runs into James when he is asked to train him for his new job at NightLife. The two of them become fast friends.
Deimos: The nemesis.
He hates James and Ted with a passion and does everything he can to make their lives difficult, both in person and behind the scenes.

 
Things You'll Find in This Story
There are a lot of cool action scenes!




But I also like to mix in some humor as well.



And heartfelt scenes too.

 
Here Are Some Pins You Can Get As a Perk

 
The Team
This is a 2 man team consisting of Myself and Camilo Zepeda. I am the creator/writer, editor, and publisher of the series. Camilo is the artist, letterer, and colorist on the series.
Even though he is based in Chile and I'm in the United States we complete new pages of work every week, and have done so for going on 3 years now. I find his artwork to quite good, if I may be so bold.
 
Back it Vs. Selecting a Perk
When you decide to contribute to the funding of this project (thank you very much for believing in my work!) please be sure to select a perk on the right hand side. If you only click the "Back it" button and don't choose a perk then that will be registered by Indiegogo as a donation that doesn't want/expect any perk in return. You can read more details about this in the "Updates" section at the top of the page just under the opening video.
 
Risks & Challenges
I would say the risks are rather minimal. I also keep my word so if you select a perk I can promise you it will get to you. The only thing I will say is that if orders turn out to be really large, and since I would have to do all the shipping myself (or higher some help if enough funds are raised), there might be some delays but I will do my best to limit any long term delays of your orders.

Other Ways You Can Help
I know in these tough times not everyone can pitch in financially, and that's okay. If you can't I ask that you share this campaign everywhere that you can. That kind of support is just as important as monetary support and goes a long way :) 
International Shipping
For those outside the USA who choose physical items that need to be shipped please be aware that I'll be using a flat rate international shipping box that will add $38 in shipping costs to any of the $20 and up perks you select (sorry.) 

Stretch Goals
- At $7000 I'll create variant cover for the graphic novel and a new Perk to go along with it.
- At $10,000 new chibi pins will be created & sent to people who selected the $50 and up Perks.
- At $15,000 new T-shirts will be created & sent to people who selected the $200 and up Perks.
- At $20,000 a concept art book will be created & sent to people who selected the $500 and up Perks.
- Over $20,000 and I'll think of some more cool stuff to create for you!
Here are some full pages for you to enjoy!

story:
Hello!

My name is Rachel and I am a freelance artist. My partner and I are raising funds to create/publish a series of graphic novels based of the tale of Medusa. This graphic novel is written in modern times from a high school juniors perspective. This comic means a lot to us as it brings to light how awful rape culture and sexual assault is.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $2,000 

The use of the money will go towards these:

  • Being able to cut back from my job to spend 100% of my time on the creation of this comic
  • Supplies to create the comic
  • The funds to publish several copies of the end result

What you will get in return:

  • $2 donation perk: thank you illustration card ( delivered October 2020)
  • $5 donation perk: signed 8x10 Medusa coming soon cover ( delivered October 2020)
  • $10 donation perk: sneak peaks into the comic (i.e how it is made, comic panels, story arc) (delivered until the release of the comic)
  • $25 donation perk: signed early release comic (April 2021)
  • $35 donation perk: everything from previous teirs 

The Impact

The light that it brings to sexual assault/rape culture and how toxic it is. We also will be donating 20% of what these graphic novels make to RAINN and their support with sexual assault survivors. 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is not being able to come up with enough funding to support this project thus having to push back the release date. I will have to work even harder to come up with the remaining funds to publish this comic. Though it would be hard I am very dedicated to getting this comic out into the world and will make it happen no matter what. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out about our project by sharing and telling your friends!

story:
The Art of Carbon Grey. A beautiful art book collection.

As we get closer to the campaign final stretch, I wanted to offer you some FREE books for your great support. Below are three volumes of Carbon Grey Graphic novels, over 300 pages of awesome story and art.

As an incentive to pledge at the $50 tier, I'm going to add three volumes of Carbon Grey to your order. A $40 value! Plus, I'll even signed the books at no extra charge.

This is what you'll be getting below for the $50 Perk. Limited Signed Edition Print, Art book and the 3 Volumes of CG. Makes for a great Christmas gift this holidays season.

Also if you pledge at the $25 Perk, you'll get the first volume for FREE!

All those in the $75 Tier and up will also received the three volumes.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hi, my name is Hoang Nguyen, I've been a professional artist for a very long time. I've worked for Marvel, DC, Dark Horse, Image Comics and many independent companies in the past. I'm currently working in the game industry, but my first love is still comics. 

A few years ago, I put out the "Art of Carbon Grey Artbook" base on the comic published by Image Comics. The art book did really well, Unfortunately, there are still a batch of them left in the warehouse. Please help me to find a home for these books. They're languishing away in the warehouse and required a great deal of upkeep, costing me a fortune in coffee money to keep them there :)

I've decided to rescue them and do something special with the book. I'm going to offer them to you with a special book plate, signed by yours truly at no additional cost. 

The book is "9 x 12" Hardcover collection, with over 128 pages of awesomeness! If you enjoy the "Metal Militia HC book, this one will blow you away. 

Here are some interior pages. It goes into further details about the book and how "Carbon Grey" comic came about. Learn how three artists united to create a uniquely beautiful and kinetic visual style. Follow their working processes and trace the evolution of the characters and worlds that made Carbon Grey the most explosive comic of the year!

 

The hardcover artbook is ready to ship as soon as the campaign end. I just need the fund to rescue the book from a life of boredom.  And with your support, I'll be able to get the book into your hands shortly.  

Thanks in advance for your support!

Hoang Nguyen

 

 

Here are some Perks for your consideration.

$25 Perks - 9"x 12" HC The Art of Carbon Grey with a Signed Book Plate and a free CG book.

 

$50 Perks - Art of Carbon Grey HC with a Special Signed Book Plate & Regular Edition Plate. Also included three volumes of Carbon Grey graphic novels for FREE!

 

$75 Perks - Metal Militia HC - Art of Carbon Grey with a Signed Book plate. This one is for those that miss out on my first campaign for Metal Militia Graphic Novel. 1st printing & only a few left. Also included three volumes of Carbon Grey graphic novels for FREE!

 

$100 Perks - This one included the sold out first issue comic of Metal Militia (2nd printing & only a few left) Also included three volumes of Carbon Grey graphic novels for FREE!

 

 

Risks & Challenges

I've run many campaigns on Kickstarter and have always delivered. This is my second on Indiegogo and I hope that you'll join and support me on this endeavor. I planned many great perks and "Stretch Goals".

The book is finished and will be ready to ship as soon as the campaign end. I don't foresee any problem or delay, but with any project, there is always something. I'll make sure to keep you up to date with any issue that arises.

Other Ways You Can Help.

If you're unable to contribute, you can still help by sharing our campaign through social media. Please help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Thanks in advance for your support!

If you're unable to contribute, you can still help by sharing our campaign through social media. Please help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Thanks in advance for your support!

story:
ISEULT

Does that sound like an unusual name? It's from an old legend- "Tristan and Iseult"; (I also thought it sounded pretty.) Hi there! My name is Peter and I am really new to creating comics- I'm not a pro at all., although I have been collecting them and reading them forever.

Anyhow, I got very interested in drawing and creating a comic last year around August, and thought "this is the perfect time" It's a fun story about a teenage girl who discovered she carries the lineage of a powerful clan of werewolves, And further, she even has the ability to learn magic.. but she has to learn to control it. She meets another werewolf called Silverclaw and a hamadryad named Daphne,.. and she begins her adventure, struggling to learn her powers, before an inhuman horde called the Scourge destroys her village. As the story progresses, she finds out just how responsible she is as the most powerful person in her village, and eventually she makes a great sacrifice. 

All this in 43-pages of black and white comic form!

What We Need & What You Get

You might be concerned about projects that don't fund and first-time creators, but the good news is my book is finished!


Yes, I actually completed my entire book before I even started this campaign! So even if we don't fund, I'll figure a way out to get you a book if you really want one. What I'm hoping for here is to generate some goodwill, some name recognition for my next project, and to teach myself how crowd-funding works.  I originally created this comic from a series of 12-page minicomics that I started making back in November. I did 3 "issues", while teaching myself how to put together a comic, and I learned a lot along the way. This is just my first work- I am already working on a new series, and there will be more. That said: Here's what you get: 

  • You can choose the print version. The digital version, or both. The book is 43 pages, black and white, trade paperback spine. I did the art, writing, layout, etc.. by myself! It ships in a Gemini Mailer, because I am #Comicsgate, and I want you to get my comic in perfect condition. 

 

Risks & Challenges

  • One thing to be aware of is this is my first comic and it shows! However, I am getting pretty good by the end. Everyone has to start somewhere. If you are just curious, pay for the digital version and have a look at some of the art I have posted- thats my style. Its kinda like the Archies. 
     

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • In the words of Jon Malin.. Please GRAB AN OAR AND START ROWING. Iseult is my first Oar, but it will not be my last.  I would love it if you linked my campaign, invited me to your youtube shows, and shared a link to this campaign. Do it for the comics!

story:
Short Summary

Hi there!

So, who likes monsters?

I LOVE MONSTERS.

 I have loved monsters all my life. As a kid growing up, I would draw monsters and write fun stories about them.  Some would be friendly, others not so much. One thing they had in common, be they good or bad, is that I would try to situate them in a scenario that is more "human-friendly" than monster-friendly.

Another childhood love was comic books. I could open one up and become anyone, transported anywhere.  The splash pages, where both pages combined to form one magnificent image, were my favorite.

My childhood doodles and my fond memories of comics is the inspiration for this project.

This is going to be a combination of both monster and comic; a monster comic pin-up.  One page (the left side) will relate a story, while the other page (the right) encapsulates the story in one magnificent image.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi there!
So, who likes monsters?
I LOVE MONSTERS.
 I have loved monsters all my life. As a kid growing up, I would draw monsters and write fun stories about them.  Some would be friendly, others not so much. One thing they had in common, be they good or bad, is that I would try to situate them in a scenario that is more "human-friendly" than monster-friendly.
Another childhood love was comic books. I could open one up and become anyone, transported anywhere.  The splash pages, where both pages combined to form one magnificent image, were my favorite.
My childhood doodles and my fond memories of comics is the inspiration for this project.
This is going to be a combination of both monster and comic; a monster comic pin-up.  One page (the left side) will relate a story, while the other page (the right) encapsulates the story in one magnificent image.

story:
Everette Hartsoe's BAYONET #1 is a 3 issue mini series art by Marcelo Salaza colors by Nasir Ahmed

A feature film is being developed and casting has begun. YOU can be a part of all aspects of the production from books to the live action adaptation.

BAYONET, the comic book mini series created by indie comics’ maverick, Everette Hartsoe tells the story of Sasha Ravenwood, a retired assassin turned mentor to a homeless girl named Nix. Both share telekinetic and psychokinetic gifts that make them a far dangerous threat to the secret society that enlisted them.

created and written by Everette Hartsoe art by Marcelo Salaza colors by Nasir Ahmed

Hartsoe’s Bayonet will be the 1st title from the newly formed cinematic universe ‘RAZORVERSE’ and will launch a universe of all new properties set up for TV and film. 

“ My goal is to have the new comic stories match the films or tv projects in development so there is no confusion about the characters and storylines that are being told. This comic book and entertainment merger is unlike the offerings from MARVEL and DC COMICS, where the movies/TV don’t match what is going on in the comics. This can be annoying as well as confusing, so we are removing it from the equation.” stated Hartsoe

What can you expect  from RAZORVERSE storylines will have an all out attack of your senses in a non-stop adrenaline thrill-ride featuring female lead protagonist. Special edition covers, trading cards, post cards original art and prints. We are also adding producer tiers that can get you film credits on IMDB, invites to screenings, on-set access during the filming, even a chance to be in the movies as well.

WHY CROWDFUND?

Over the past few years, crowdfunding is the most effective way to get our stories and art books into the hands of fans. We seek funding to pay our artists, colorists and printers to build the company and promote the product to a wider audience. 

We are seeking funding for our next line of sketch  and reference books for fans and aspiring artists, worldwide. Printing,  color and graphics will be paid with the funds raised.

story:
About this project

Hello there potential helper to the hero's of Belrose City, My name is Ben and I have been sent to Kickstarter in a sole mission to have people fund this comic, listen i know what you must be thinking really this is a one man comic you would be wrong.

The first book is about a school student called Zack Dodson who doesn't have many friends the only one he does have is Kerri Rose Wyatt a childhood friend who Zack has been in love with for a while. This first book is the story of how Zack gets his powers and also gives us a glimpse of one of his soon to be archenemies Brainsnare.

The money will only be used on creation, printing and distribution of the comics nothing else.

Risks and challenges

There are risks towards this I'm not going to lie like if the comics don't sell and I can't afford to continue the project or if finding a publisher becomes almost impossible, I'm hoping these won't happen but if a problem does arise I will try and do my best to tackle it.

story:
Hello everyone

My name is JD Calderon a long time self publisher and current web comicer, please allow me to introduce you to The Oswald Chronicles a story about a daring mouse who’s looking for the meaning of life and why he’s the only one of his kind who can speak. Living on Park Avenue in New York City Oswald finds himself the center of controversy amongst fae, trolls, goblins, redcaps, pixies, Kalsions, and Grogs and the many other races that live alongside of man. How is a humble scribe and gentlemouse supposed to survive?

Here we're offering volumes 1 & 2 of The Oswald Chronicles.

In the first volume My First Day and other stories, we're introduced to a young Oswald and we discover where it is he came from. In the same volume we have On the Wings of Diadra t he story of a woman pursued by her past, while trying to keep her grandchildren safe.

The Light That Attracts (Illustrated by Jade Gonzalez)  where Oswald seeks out a friend and finds an old acquaintance whose been changed by time and circumstance. Also included in this volume is Adventure Time Unbidden (Illustrated by Luigito Teruel) where we find that not all teddy bear's dreams come true, or do they?  Plus a prose story "How Tender Souls Mourn" illustrated by Daphne Lage.  

or visit www.theoswaldchronicles.com to see more.

Below I have posted a number of pages for your viewing pleasure :D

story:
Xmoor Studios was started in 2004, when it was just me, Creating what I hoped to be an entertaining Action ComicBook called GALTOW. I had tried on numerous occasions to enter the creative arena, lugging my ideals over to the Big Publishers, but had never broken that creative wall. I wanted to creative Characters with real diversity. I never took defeat as an option, so I made my own team, garnered my first artist and created Xmoor Studios. With a Live Action Short Based on the Comic book INHERITORS; and a Two time GLYPHs Award winning For Best Female Character: AJALA A SERIES OF ADVENTURES, Co-Created with N STEVEN HARRIS, Xmoor Studios is starting to take wings.


Xmoor Studios now publishes science fiction, Fantasy, Novellas, and All age I.P. Concepts, working with star artists and creators from all over the world.  I am hoping with the success of this campaign, I will be able to  continue to create and build my audience, create worlds of fantastic characters that stand out for their innovative uniqueness and of course maintain a level of quality that will always keep readers coming back for more. 

Now I need your help...


 

PROJECT:

Xmoor Studios is my independent Publication Studio; it is not however funded with a lot of money. I do this and still work a 9-5... Hard Labor to create my labors of love. But I have many more stories to tell So I want to do something revolutionary and we can only do it with your support! Five Issues together in one book. 

By using INDIEGOGO, we intend to push the envelope, not just in terms of content but also in terms of the artistry and originality. This comic will be distinctive and Standout in the Independent comic book industry. With your support. 

TheXMOOR EFFECT ANTHOLOGY:  

A Crowd Funding event 5 Creator Owned Properties, Over 100 pages of New Material collected into a trade book... with the Talents of Walt Msonza Barna, Rey Alicea, Julian Aguilera, Peter Cacho, Dino Agor... And a host of other great Talents. The Tittles will be:


HERO BORN:

Created By: Robert Garrett    Art By Peter Cacho & Dino Agor

The Final battle between the Worlds Greatest Heroes has been Waged… And they have Lost… The World titters on the edge of domination from a society of paranormal beings who have seized their time… Caught in the catastrophic Events fighting a war for their survival the Scions of legends must find a way to come together, in order to seek their own Justice and fight in an epic battle that could save their world.

TOOL-BOI:

Created By: Robert Garrett  Art by Walt Msonza Barna

Ameir was trained since he was a child to be a killer existing in a world of death. He was chosen to follow the path of the world’s greatest assassins… On this plane of existence, those who embraced the shadows were in charge and breaking your contract with them could mean the termination of your life. Framed against an alternate reality Earth in the streets of New York, Washington and across the globe we are plunged into Ameir’s world And the men who aspired to make a monster 

MASQURADER:

There has never been a history for him, no family, no friends; he has always built up that wall that seemed to be torn down by all the wrong people. That was until an invitation arrives at the doorstep of a broken man, opening a door that promises to take him to reality that he never knew existed. The revelation of a single event in human history, twists what we have come to accept as our past, present and our future. The fabrication of information orchestrated by beings that do not want the truth revealed.
Challenged by shadowy agencies, rebel militias and fantastical beings of legend, he must survive hanging onto his own precarious ledge of madness that comes with his inheritance.
Welcome to Life’s Dance...There are many who wear costumes... But there can only be one... MASQUERADER. 

Created By: Robert Garrett Art by Dino Agor

SMOKE:

Created By: Robert Garrett Art By Peter Cacho


DEAD HOOD:

Created by Robert Garrett  Co-Created Art by REY ALICEA

For all of his Eighteen years, Keda Winters has known nothing but a life of upheaval, a child who has experienced too much trauma for one so young. And things have just gotten worse; Alice Winters died screaming caught on fire…a freak accident. and now Keda is forced to return to where he was born, a massive housing project called Angel Towers in Harlem New York, and a family that he never knew existed... But Keda's real dilemma is that he has just died.


Why we need you.

I want to produce the highest quality product we can, with top notch inking, coloring and lettering. The money raised thru this campaign will be used  for Printing,  the art teams, as well as the actual shipping of the book. This is an ambitious project so we will have to go hard and promote 

I'm all about 100% transparency and honesty and I believe you deserve to know where your money is going to. 

All of the money raised by INDIEGOGO will be used towards four things: Production, Printing, Shipping and Fees. 

Here’s a breakdown of our costs: 

Production-$10,000 

Printing - $2,000

Shipping - $1,800.00 (rough estimate)

Fees    

Total - $15,000 (Estimated)

I want you to be happy with your experience backing this campaign so I can continue writing them and entertaining you.  We all know that the best way to reach a passionate audience is with people that not only care for the project but kinda like me as a creator.

As always, the risks are there, no way around it, especially when we are trying something different. I'm putting out a 100+ page book.

Running a Indiegogo and crowdfunding campaign, of course we will run into our share of problems, but I will always overcome them by working with you and being in constant communication. You have any problems, questions or inquiries?

Shoot me a message and I will get right back to you. My e-mail is xmoor2@yahoo.com and I work for you.

Thank you! 
Rob

What you get.


THE XMOOR HEROES GUIDE:


You can get the The Xmoor Anthology comic in both printed and digital editions, pin-ups from the book. And of course your name printed on a special 'Thank You' section of the book. 

And of course stay tuned for more Perks and updates.....


Other Ways You Can Help

Some of us just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:So please even if you cannot make a pledge get the word out and make some noise about our campaign, just remember that Indiegogo has a share tool!

Thanks for reading this far and if you decide to pledge thanks so much I really appreciate you!
story_txt:
Xmoor Studios was started in 2004, when it was just me, Creating what I hoped to be an entertaining Action ComicBook called GALTOW. I had tried on numerous occasions to enter the creative arena, lugging my ideals over to the Big Publishers, but had never broken that creative wall. I wanted to creative Characters with real diversity. I never took defeat as an option, so I made my own team, garnered my first artist and created Xmoor Studios. With a Live Action Short Based on the Comic book INHERITORS; and a Two time GLYPHs Award winning For Best Female Character: AJALA A SERIES OF ADVENTURES, Co-Created with N STEVEN HARRIS, Xmoor Studios is starting to take wings.

Xmoor Studios now publishes science fiction, Fantasy, Novellas, and All age I.P. Concepts, working with star artists and creators from all over the world.  I am hoping with the success of this campaign, I will be able to  continue to create and build my audience, create worlds of fantastic characters that stand out for their innovative uniqueness and of course maintain a level of quality that will always keep readers coming back for more. Now I need your help...

 
PROJECT:

Xmoor Studios is my independent Publication Studio; it is not however funded with a lot of money. I do this and still work a 9-5... Hard Labor to create my labors of love. But I have many more stories to tell So I want to do something revolutionary and we can only do it with your support! Five Issues together in one book. 
By using INDIEGOGO, we intend to push the envelope, not just in terms of content but also in terms of the artistry and originality. This comic will be distinctive and Standout in the Independent comic book industry. With your support.

story:
Scimok is currently a collection of Students, Hobbyists and individuals with a passion for creativity. We hope to publish regular art books containing illustrations, sketches & comics from all involved artists, this being the first of those. In the future we will look to publish animations and increase the number of artists involved to enable new collaborations and projects to take place.


All backers will receive a PDF copy of SCIMOK Volume 1 as well as our thanks (to be expressed upon reaching our goal) regardless of the total amount raised (Even if its less that the 500 goal). Backers also receive news-letters that will cover progress on this fundraiser and recent activity at SCIMOK, including photos of development and concept sketches for upcoming projects. The first newsletter will be sent out Friday 24th June.

We aim to gain publicity and begin growing our community of artists from this fundraiser. This will allow us to begin uploading and publishing on a regular basis and give us the opportunity to grow into a recognized organisation with the ability to financially support involved creators.


We understand that not everyone has the financial means to donate to our cause, but anyone can help by sharing this fundraiser with their friends and family!
Also if you want to get involved and have your work featured on our site and possibly published in future endeavours be sure to contact us on Facebook or at info@scimok.com!
Also check out our website and be sure to like us on Facebook!

story:
Do you want to get your hands on some yaoi goodies without having to spend a dime? Then, our referral contest is perfect for you!

Take a look at we're giving away:

Referral rewards:

  • If your friends' contributions reach $200, receive a FREE yaoi bracelet.
  • If your friends' contributions reach $500​, receive a FREE yaoi bracelet and a FREE FUJOBOX.
  • If your friends' contributions reach $1,000​, receive a FREE yaoi bracelet and 4 FREE FUJOBOX.
  • If your friends' contributions reach $2,500​, receive a FREE yaoi bracelet and 16 FREE monthly FUJOBOX.

How to participate:

It's easy! Just copy the link to our campaign and share it with friends, family or other yaoi fans. We will automatically tally all contributions made by people who clicked on your link and send you your reward.

Important:

  • Before copying and sharing our link, make sure that you are logged into Indiegogo. If you don't have one already, creating a new account is free and only takes a few minutes. Once you are logged in, you should notice a few extra letters at the end of our campaign's URL. This is the referral code that will allow the system to track your progress.
  • For more information about taking part in referral contests on Indiegogo and how to track your progress, click here.
  • All referrals sent from the beginning to the end of our campaign will be taken into consideration.

Hi, my name is Nicolas and I'm a yaoi and shounen-ai fan from Europe. Some of you may actually know me as /u/gayfarang from /r/yaoi on Reddit (if not, hi there, glad to meet you!).

I've been living in Asia for the past 9 years and one of the complaints I've heard the most from fudanshis or fujoshis living in Europe or in America is how hard it is for them to get their hands on yaoi or shounen-ai merchandise. Many anime shops in the West stock no or very little yaoi merchandise, making it hard for fans to buy the cool products we have in Asia.

Being in my thirties and having experience in e-commerce, I thought it would be interesting to set up a service that would allow people in the West to get yaoi and shounen-ai merchandise at a reasonable price. This is how the idea of the FUJOBOX (Fujoshi Box, get it?) was born!

I recently met some people who are extremely familiar with anime suppliers in Japan and we are now ready to launch our business.

But, to do so, we need your support!

Your contributions will go towards:

  • Setting up a registered company in Japan.
  • Buying supplies and inventory.
  • Setting up a decent website along with an order processing system.

If you're unable to support us at this time, don't worry about it! Sharing our campaign with fellow yaoi fans is just as important, so don't hesitate to click the social media icons to the right and spread the word.

Thanks!

Our FUJOBOX is a monthly subscription box for yaoi and shounen-ai lovers.

The box contains 4 anime goodies, officially licensed from anime or manga publishers, along with a sweet treat from Japan such as Japanese candy, Japan-only chocolate bars, etc...

Once our service is live, we plan on offering customers a choice between different plans:

  • A one-off box with no recurring charges.
  • A monthly subscription service (1 box per month) that is automatically renewed every 31 or 30 days.
  • A 3-month subscription package (3 boxes sent on a monthly basis).
  • A 6-month subscription package (6 boxes sent on a monthly basis).
  • A 12-month subscription package (12 boxes sent on a monthly basis).

All boxes will be sent by air mail from Japan to any destination in the world. There will be no additional shipping charges regarding of where you live.

ANIME GOODIES

As mentioned above, our merchandise will be fully-licensed original merchandise featuring cute or hot anime boys.

Types of merchandise:

  • pencil cases
  • pillow cases
  • pens
  • stationary
  • bracelets
  • straps
  • plastic mats
  • posters
  • gachapon balls
  • ... and many, many more!

Basically, we plan on offering everything that is on offer in Tokyo's largest comic shops.

Our merchandise will focus on the best and latest anime or manga series, such as:

  • SUPER LOVERS
  • FREE!
  • Junjou Romantica
  • Black Butler
  • Love Stage!!
  • Shounen Maid
  • SerVamp

If a show has fan service or revolves around cute boys, you can be sure we will include it in one of our boxes!

IMPORTANT: To safeguard your privacy, pictures of boys or the words "yaoi" or "shounen-ai" do not appear on the outside of our boxes.

 

  • $5: Our thanks and a $2 discount code for your next order.
  • $10: Our thanks and a $4 discount code for your next order.
  • $20: A limited edition "YAOI IS LIFE" silicon band bracelet.
  • $27: Our first ever FUJOBOX. While anyone will be able to purchase subsequent boxes, this first FUJOBOX is only available to Indiegogo contributors.
  • $35: A limited, signed edition of our first FUJOBOX.
  • $50: A "Seme Edition" of our FUJOBOX. Bigger and with more stuff inside it.
  • $80: 3-month subscription to our service - 3 FUJOBOXs sent to your doorstep.
  • $150: 6-month subscription to our service - 6 FUJOBOXs sent to your doorstep.
  • $290: 12-month subscription to our service - 12 FUJOBOXs sent to your doorstep.
  • $400: 12-month subscription to our service - 12 FUJOBOXs sent to your doorstep, PLUS the ability to choose what you and other customers will receive the next month. That's right, we're handing you the keys to one of our FUJOBOXs!
  • $1,000: 12-month subscription to our service - 12 FUJOBOXs sent to your doorstep, PLUS: an original, hand-drawn one-sheet yaoi manga illustrated by a professional Japanese manga artist, the bracelet and one Seme Edition FUJOBOX.

CURRENT STRETCH GOAL: Funding our venture ($20,000)

NEXT STRETCH GOAL: As an Indiegogo perk, we are offering backers the ability to purchase our one-off Seme Edition FUJOBOX, a larger, more expensive version of our regular box. If we reach this stretch goal, we will permanently offer customers the choice between the regular box (renamed the "Uke Box") or the larger Seme Box. Doing so, however, requires us to keep more inventory, which is why we need additional funding to permanently offer that second option.

Will the FUJOBOX contain NSFW (18+) products?

The FUJOBOX won't include NSFW images or products, for a series of reasons:

  • Yaoi merchandise in Japan typically does not contain NSFW pictures, much like animes themselves (as opposed to manga).
  • We want to allow the younger fudoshis and fudanshis out there to enjoy our boxes.
  • Many fujoshis and fudanshis live in the Middle East, where homosexuality and explicit depictions of it are unfortunately illegal.

Will I receive my perks even if the campaign fails to meet its initial goal?

Absolutely! All perks will be fulfilled regardless of whether we meet our goals. However, if we fall way short of the $20,000 mark, we won't be able to open our service to the general public and provide it as an ongoing service.

Do you ship worldwide?

Yep! We will provide free worldwide shipping!

story:
Short Summary

The TOI Soldier Project is a multi media universe designed to allow Combat Veterans to deal with their PTSD issues while in a safe environment. We create an avatar for our clients and through Graphic Novels, Animations and Video Games we will be able to share our real war stories in a way that everyone can experience together.

  • Hello my name is Heraclio Aguilar and I am the Creator/CEO of The TOI Soldier Project. I grew up in a small town of Porterville, CA which has a rich history involving our local heroes in the military and Vietnam so in the Fall of 2000 I decided to follow in their legacy by joining the Army until 2007. After my military career ended I went to college where I received an AA in Business Administration and a BS in Graphic Design.
  • Why was I inspired to create The TOI Soldier Project?                                       During my military career I served in a combat situation during Operation Iraqi Freedom, Operation Enduring Freedom and most of my service was conducted overseas. When it came time to reintegrate back into civilian life I did so not knowing how much I suffered from PTSD. About 5 years ago I decided that I wanted to be proactive in dealing with my PTSD and through that process The TOI Soldier Project was born. Through the multimedia universe I was able to tell my personal war stories in a way that others can understand but in a manner that still protected my privacy and now I wish to offer the same platform to speak to my fellow Brothers and Sisters in Arms.
  • With your contribution you will help The TOI Soldier Project retain the Artist needed to make my Story Board Comic Book into one that can professionally illustrate our Veterans stories with pride and respect. The first 12+ Part Series will not only set up the universe but will be distributed for free within the Veteran Communities initially in Los Angeles and San Diego areas.
 

What We Need & What You Get

To allow The TOI Soldier Project to grow I am going to have to hire professionals that can focus on their area of expertise so I can continue to adapt my clients stories to fit into The TOI Soldier Project's universe. Let me tell you about where your contributions are going and some of the things you can get for it.

  • I would like to hire an Illustrator, a Colorist, Character and Environment Artist (each one of those occupations are paid an average of $3,200 per month of Full Time employment = $12,800 a month and I would like to retain them for at least two months). I would also like to hire a company that can Publish and then distribute our product (To publish a book the price goes down the more of them that you order, for example to make 3,000 copies it will cost $1.00 a piece but for 2,000 copies will cost $1.60 each. Distribution can be solved by UPS shipments to vendors and USPS for individual customers. For both I am estimating $24,000 budget to not only satisfy the customer demand but to create an overhead of comic copies that will be distributed within the Veteran Communities.

  • You wont have to wait two months to get your perks, I have the Storyboard Comic Book Style available in PDF, Black & White, Color and Signed. You can reserve your copy of the first issue to the entire first series and even help in the design of a reoccuring creature in the TOI Soldier Project Universe.

  • If we don't meet our goal we will still use the funds to produce the first issue, I feel once a professional copy can be within arms reach of people it will be taken seriously. I am very passionate about this project and I promise that I will do whatever for the project I can with whatever funds are raised.

The Impact

With your contributions The TOI Soldier Project will be able to give a voice to Veterans and their fallen Brother and Sisters in Arms. We have a wealth of knowledge, a supply of stories (good and bad) and unexpected life changes that once was taboo to talk about until The TOI Soldier Project universe was introduced. I hope that The TOI Soldier Project can be a place that family members can get to know their Veterans again, so that our friends can understand our struggle and to open up a communication line between all veterans and civilians.


Risks & Challenges

There are a few risks and challenges that I face in making The TOI Soldier Project a valuable platform so Veterans can share their stories; adjusting our methods to accommodate our approach with each PTSD event trigger, difficulties obtaining mainstream marketing team or unknown finaincial costs in hiring other essential company positions. That being said I am willing to take that risk, currently the there is a stat from the National Journal that 22 Veterans Commit Suicide a day and that is a stat I want to change to 0 so for me it is worth taking the risk and to step up to the challenge.

  • I feel that I can and will overcome any obstacle that can come my way because I have successfully lead my team for nearly 18 months in a Combat Situation. Because I am a Veteran I understand our Veteran community and I will hadle our stories with the upmost respect and to honor those that we have served with.

  • I also understand PTSD, I have dealt with my personal issues with the issue for more than a decade and thanks to acceptance and therapy I have come to understand and ease my symptom triggers to live a normal life. I feel that when the time comes to bring in new clients I will have a process that will provide them with a comfortable environment so they can freely share their tales to myself and a few professionals.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understsnd that there are those out there that cannot contribute monitarily but fee that thee are other ways that you can contribute and there is. I have worked for the last 5 years to develop the business infostructure, the therapy process, the storyline, Character Design and much more but I am only one man. If you can help in any way in any of those departments and happen to live in the Los Angeles or California or United States really please contact me. Also if you dont mind you can spread the word about The TOI Soldier Project, the more people that see our mission the better possibility it is for us to make our goal. You can spread the word using IndieGoGo's share links and then you can go from there.
story_txt:
Short Summary The TOI Soldier Project is a multi media universe designed to allow Combat Veterans to deal with their PTSD issues while in a safe environment. We create an avatar for our clients and through Graphic Novels, Animations and Video Games we will be able to share our real war stories in a way that everyone can experience together.  Hello my name is Heraclio Aguilar and I am the Creator/CEO of The TOI Soldier Project. I grew up in a small town of Porterville, CA which has a rich history involving our local heroes in the military and Vietnam so in the Fall of 2000 I decided to follow in their legacy by joining the Army until 2007. After my military career ended I went to college where I received an AA in Business Administration and a BS in Graphic Design. Why was I inspired to create The TOI Soldier Project?                                       During my military career I served in a combat situation during Operation Iraqi Freedom, Operation Enduring Freedom and most of my service was conducted overseas. When it came time to reintegrate back into civilian life I did so not knowing how much I suffered from PTSD. About 5 years ago I decided that I wanted to be proactive in dealing with my PTSD and through that process The TOI Soldier Project was born. Through the multimedia universe I was able to tell my personal war stories in a way that others can understand but in a manner that still protected my privacy and now I wish to offer the same platform to speak to my fellow Brothers and Sisters in Arms. With your contribution you will help The TOI Soldier Project retain the Artist needed to make my Story Board Comic Book into one that can professionally illustrate our Veterans stories with pride and respect. The first 12+ Part Series will not only set up the universe but will be distributed for free within the Veteran Communities initially in Los Angeles and San Diego areas.     What We Need & What You Get 
To allow The TOI Soldier Project to grow I am going to have to hire professionals that can focus on their area of expertise so I can continue to adapt my clients stories to fit into The TOI Soldier Project's universe. Let me tell you about where your contributions are going and some of the things you can get for it.  I would like to hire an Illustrator, a Colorist, Character and Environment Artist (each one of those occupations are paid an average of $3,200 per month of Full Time employment = $12,800 a month and I would like to retain them for at least two months). I would also like to hire a company that can Publish and then distribute our product (To publish a book the price goes down the more of them that you order, for example to make 3,000 copies it will cost $1.00 a piece but for 2,000 copies will cost $1.60 each. Distribution can be solved by UPS shipments to vendors and USPS for individual customers. For both I am estimating $24,000 budget to not only satisfy the customer demand but to create an overhead of comic copies that will be distributed within the Veteran Communities. You wont have to wait two months to get your perks, I have the Storyboard Comic Book Style available in PDF, Black & White, Color and Signed. You can reserve your copy of the first issue to the entire first series and even help in the design of a reoccuring creature in the TOI Soldier Project Universe. If we don't meet our goal we will still use the funds to produce the first issue, I feel once a professional copy can be within arms reach of people it will be taken seriously. I am very passionate about this project and I promise that I will do whatever for the project I can with whatever funds are raised. I feel that when the time comes to bring in new clients I will have a process that will provide them with a comfortable environment so they can freely share their tales to myself and a few professionals. I understsnd that there are those out there that cannot contribute monitarily but fee that thee are other ways that you can contribute and there is.
