story:
****************************************************************************

Update March 11, 2015 : Media Coverage about our ongoing Indiegogo Campaign

Its been hardly a couple of days since we launched our campaign and the media has already begun its coverage on our campaign to save the comics.

Animation Express' coverage on our campaign

Click on the campaign coverage link above to know more.
Read below to know more about us and our campaign.

****************************************************************************

Who we are?

Vimanika Comics is a Golden Cursor Award Winning Comic Book Company. We are the first Indian company to create ground-breaking graphics with 100% Indian content in India & Abroad! Our signature character Karna for The Sixth Series will be showcased for the first time as a crossover with a vast array established of characters from around the world in The War of the Worlds series –published by Red Anvil Comics, U.S. Thus, our comic books and characters transcend geographies and cultures making them truly universal. As a result, we are also the first Indian company to launch a graphic novel in the India and the US.

The founder of the company is Mr. Karan Vir who started this company primarily to uphold and propagate the comic book as an art form since it was dying a slow death due to the advent of other media and art forms. You could check some of the appended links to know more about us as well our stellar reputation in various related events especially Comic Con in India. 

Unveiling of Don: The Origin at Comic Con Express Mumbai '11:


A Special Comic Con India Interview with Karan Vir Arora - Publisher, Vimanika: 


Launch of Shiva: Legends of the Immortal at Comic Con Express Mumbai 2011: 


Why are we raising funds?

Even today, our main intention of raising these funds is to preserve the comic book genre not only in the South Asian region, but also in the UK where we sell our comic books. In addition, we plan to further expand our geographic reach to Europe and subsequently for readers in North America as well.

Our primary aim in publishing these books:

A) To mainly create stories in Comics & Graphic Novel Formats based on characters related to the Indian & Asian mythology. These characters will portray to our readers a large number of virtues that were considered common during that era, but are looked upon with amazement and fear in today’s world.

B) Each story will have a moral in it, thus helping us to teach principles of honor and ethics, for our readers and entertain them as well. Our research is 100% accurate and backed by a professional team of professors, archaeologists and researchers.

C) The stories and the characters created by Vimanika will be brought to life through animated films, live action films, games, merchandising, toys, theme parks and much more.

Vimanika along with its most creative minds will provide the readers with extraordinary work which will be cherished by them and the future generations.

Snapshots from our Comic Books

Please check our Image Gallery for more images on a variety of comic book themes from Vimanika Comics.

Video Previews

Please do sample this video preview section since it will give you a wonderful insight into 'our world.'

Shiva-The Legends Of The Immortal-Book I Promo Comic Motion Trailer :

Shiva-The Legends Of The Immortal-Book II Promo Comic Motion Trailer :

Shiva -The Legends of the Immortal-Book III Promo Comic Motion Trailer:

More about our founder

Our founder is Karan Vir Arora, young and vibrant individual, who has conducted years of research in terms of mythology. And it has been his research which has helped in creating the substance which makes Vimanika, what it is today. With over seven years experience in the training industry, he brings with him the technique needed to impart knowledge to our readers, thus making Vimanika comics a credible source of edutainment (educational & entertainment). With excellent people skills he has helped create a very effective marketing base for Vimanika Comics. Justifiably he wants to be known as the Icon of Indian comics in years to come. Please find enclosed his interview in a leading business channel CNBC.

The  Young Turks India Karan Vir Arora:


Karan Vir is a conceptual writer, of Vimanika Comics, the first Indian comics publisher in the USA. Karan has recruited award winning artists & international editors. Karan is also a dedicated researcher of Indian mythology, working with a team of archeologists, researchers and journalists to endow his comics with historical and cultural authenticity. Karan vir is also won the Star young Excellence in Innovation Entrepreneur Award by the 3rd Indira India International Innovation Summit.

Team Profile

While our CEO and founder is Mr. Karan Vir, we would like to highlight some other team members from our team who have been invaluable to us and have provided immense contribution to our company. Enclosed below are their profiles in their own words.

Writers 

Shashank Avvaru

Shashank is a writer and editor for Vimanika Comics and its sister company Kalapani Comics. In the last 4 years he has worked on various titles the most notable of which is 'I Am Kalki,' whose latest issue won the Best Cover award at Comic Con India 2014. Other titles that he has written include Earthman - a superhero story with an environmental twist and Kaged Muscle - the story of Kris Gethin by day and part man part machine Kaged Muscle by night. Shashank is currently getting his Master's at the University of Arkansas - Little Rock and works as a staff writer for the college newspaper and contributor for college magazines.

Kshitish Padhy

He is an award winning, young and dynamic scriptwriter and novelist. He is one of the leading scriptwriters in team Vimanika, specialising in pure mythological stories. His biggest strength is paying attention to detail backed with a strong mythological research. The various issues of the block buster series “Shiva – The Legend of The Immortals” have been well received by the readers and won multiple awards including the Best Scriptwriter (Mythology) and Best Graphic Novel (Mythology).Kshitish has conceptualised over 30 comic titles and worked with leading players in Indian comics industry in a career spanning over 8 years. He has translated over 70 comic titles in the early part of his writing career. He has worked on various genres ranging from superheroes to children detective stories, magical fantasies and young adult.Kshitish is an avid comics fan who likes reading loads of various indian and international Comics .

Artist

Revin Denisyaputra

He is an exclusive comic artist at Vimanika. His hobbies, since childhood, have been sketching and reading. He improved his ability to draw by visualizing the pictures of the comics which he used to read. His grandfather always supported his drawing skills  by signing him up for a drawing contests. He has learned drawing on his own and has studied graphic design diploma, for one year post his high school graduation. He prefers drawing in realistic style ( especially in American style ), but  can also illustrate in cartoon and manga style. My goal is to work with Vimanika Comics to be the best in this field. I should also mention that I was inspired to get into the world of comics because of Marvel and DC Comics.

Profile Partner

Shailendra Gulhati

He is a Jammu Based Spiritual Author. Shailendra contributes regularly to Sunday newspapers and magazines in spiritual columns. He has written two books , (self publications) The Yogi and the Snake , a spiritual diary of an inner sojourn written as a mystical dialogue between the seeker and the sought. His second book, Naam Roop- A Tribute to the Divine, which was written in 2006 along with Artist Arpana Caur, as an experiment to have a jugalbandi between art and poetry. He is not only a partner in Vimaniak Comics but has contributed in the research for the prestigious best selling Shiva The legend of the immortal series of Vimanika comics. He is currently working on a Trilogy, SHIVA, Flight of the Ultimate Time Traveler. 

Strategic Advisor/Partner

Ashish Patel

Ashish Patel is the Managing Director & Founder Consultant of Euphoria Consulting . He has been instrumental in establishing Euphoria Consulting vision and global presence. He has been the strategic advisor for Vimanika Comics. We believe that his wisdom and experience can lead Vimanika Comics into an era of success and leadership in the comic book industry.
Our Products

The comic books we sell are printed on high quality paper with excellent quality graphics and art works

Although we primarily conceive and publish comic books in English based on mythological and fantasy themes, we also sell products such as T-shirts, Figurines and Print Posters of our varied mythological characters. These products are available directly from the Company as well as from Amazon India(www.amazon.in), Flipkart.

Our Forthcoming Titles and Publications:

1.Shiva Book Volume  4/5/6 – 70 pages per volume

2.Buddha 100 pages

3.Ganesh 100 pages

4.Hanuman 100 pages

5.Rama 100 pages

6.Dashavatar vol 3/4/5/6 -70 pages per volume.

7. New Graphic Novel:  To be launched

Each comic book would be on average 70 to 100 pages fully colored with 2 variant covers size 17 X 26 cms paper quality -Art paper Matt/Gloss. 

I always prefer to print locally rather than in other places to have full control over the printing process, but the graphic novel might take some time. I'm hoping I'll be able to get my copies sooner than that, so that I'll be able to start shipping right away.The rest of the perks on the list would be shipped as soon as possible.

Initiatives

We were part of the ComicCon in India, and have also sponsored the event in New Delhi in 2011. Part of the Comic Con in UK in 2013

Funding

After having successfully launched these titles, we now seek to launch specific graphic novels, particularly in our key markets in the US and UK, as well as India. The funds raised would be used to publish, print and distribute this graphic novel as well as for establishing new affiliates in Europe and North America for distribution of these novels in order to increase the geographical reach of our comic books. These funds will also help us in publishing our other forthcoming titles sequentially.

We would require a funding of approximately $105000 to cover the following aspects of the launch:

1.Pre-Production/Production/Post Production -$17000

2.Printing / Publishing -$17000

3.Distribution -$16500

4.Marketing/Promotion/Business development -$16500

5.Public Relations offline/Online -$16000

6.Events/Exhibitions -$18000

7.Logistics -$10000

8.Admin/Accounts-$10000

Funding Impact

The impact of funding Vimanika would be long lasting and would ensure that we get off on a sound footing in the comic book industry. It would help us sustain ourselves while also ensuring that the comic book industry would see a revival that would ensure a higher level of creativity and art in the comic book space.

story:
Short Summary

Felony Comics #2 is the latest in an ongoing series of crime anthology comics drawing upon the unique perspectives of cartoonists, artists and designers from the art and indie comics world.

Issue #2 features a cover by Rich Tommaso (Dry County, Perverso, Pete and Miriam) and stories by Ignatz Award nominee Pete Toms (Paws, On Hiatus, The Short Con), Harris Smith (editor of Felony Comics, Jeans Comics and Night Burgers) with Thomas Slattery (Moth, Acid Problem, Omnesia), Josh Burggraf (Kid Space Heater, Future Shock) and others!

Felony Comics is the latest book from Negative Pleasure Publications, a Brooklyn-based media initiative run by Harris Smith.  In the past three years we have published seven comics featuring the work of such up and coming artists as Benjamin Marra, Lale Westvind, Alabaster, Alex "AD" Degen, Zach Hazard Vaupen, Victor Kerlow, Ben Urkowitz, Karissa Sakumoto, Leah Wishnia and many others. 

Negative Pleasure comics explore important themes and ideas through the use of genre conventions and innovative narratives.  We are dedicated to publishing comics and art books that are challenging, well-designed and, most importantly, readable.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise money to print the next issue of Felony Comics.  The money raised will go entirely towards printing and shipping costs, with any remainder being distributed among the artists for their hard work and dedication to the project.  Crime pays!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still give us a hand:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.  Post about on tumblr, Facebook, Twitter.  Tell your mom.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Summary

The Big Comedy Gala in aid of Macmillan Cancer Support was set up on 2010 by Barry Church-Woods and Mhari Hetherington and does exactly what it says on the tin.
Over three shows, it's raised over £50,000 for the charity and has attracted Ed Byrne, Roy Walker and The Boy with Tape on his Face as hosts and some of the biggest names in comedy including Sarah Millican, Lee Nelson, Gregg Proops, Sean Hughes, Caroline Rhea, Chris Ramsey, Susan Calman, Frisky and Mannish, East End Cabaret, Vikki Stone, Joe Lycett, Fascinating Aida and many many more.
All donated their time for free to ensure that 100% of the proceeds went to Macmillan.
This year, the event is back and includes an additional daytime gala for children and their families.
Thanks to a very generous partnership with The Edinburgh International Conference Centre, we get the venue for the cost of putting on the lights, but there essential start up costs for this event.
By donating to this fundraising campaign, you'll be helping us raise crucial funds for marketing - an essential element of producing; especially when you have 3500 tickets to shift.
The great thing about this campaign however, is that every donation over £10, gets you a ticket for one of the shows.

What We Need & What You Get

So, we need to raise £2500 in the next 30 days.  

In the grand scheme of things, this means selling 139 tickets for the Big Comedy Gala or 250 for the Big Children's Gala - something that we really hope you'll support.

Money raised will cover registration of the event as part of the biggest arts festival in the world, and advertising in the printed programme with a print run of 410,000 copies and an estimated readership of over 1 million.

Registration fee for inclusion in the Fringe Programme

2 adverts in the printed Fringe Programme

Any additional funds will go into the pot for Macmillan.

This is how your donations break down and what you get for your money:

£5:       A warm fuzzy feeling

£10:  A ticket for the Big Children's Gala in aid of Macmillan Cancer Support

£20: A ticket for either the Big Comedy Gala in aid of Macmillan Cancer     Support or the Big Children's Gala (you decide).

£30: A ticket for your preferred show and a shout out on all of our social media channels

£50: 2 tickets for your preferred show, a shout out on social media channels and a thank you message on the screen before the show

£200: 4 tickets for your preferred show, a shout our on social media channels, a thank you message on the screen before the show, a shout out from the host AND access for 4 to an exclusive VIP drinks reception before the show

£500: 10 tickets for your preferred show, a shout our on social media channels, a thank you message on the screen before the show, a shout out from the host AND access for 10 to an exclusive VIP drinks reception before the show AND a 'supported by' credit on the Edfringe.com show listing

£1000: You really are awesome. So we'll give you 20 tickets for your preferred show, several shout outs on social media channels, a thank you message on the screen before the show, a shout out from the host AND access for 20 to an exclusive VIP drinks reception before the show, a 'supported by' credit on the Edfringe.com show listing AND an exclusive fizz reception at the interval.

£2500:  Using all of the above as options as benchmarks, we'll tailor your experience to suit your needs AND create some additional perks (within reason).

The Impact

Right from the moment you’re diagnosed, through your treatment and beyond, Macmillan are a constant source of support to help you feel more in control of your life.

They can help you find answers to questions about your treatment and its effects. They can advise on work and benefits, and are always there for emotional support when things get tough.

Funds raised for Macmillan go straight to their service provision; in fact the £50,000 raised so far by the Big C funded the running of an information centre for 8 months.  That's real, on-the-ground support for people living with cancer and their families.

Risks & Challenges

The Fringe is a massively competitive marketplace.  In 2014, there were just under 50,000 unique performances of over 3000 shows.  It's not easy to sell tickets when there's so much on offer.  We didn't stage the Big C last year, but in 2011, 2012 and 2013 we sold out our original capacity and had to move up into bigger spaces.

We did this with a dedicated team of volunteers; all pounding the pavements and a lot of great press.

In fact, here's just a few of our accolades:

Top Ten Event in Scotland – The Skinny

Pick of the Week – Scotland on Sunday

Pick of the Day – The Scotsman

Pick of the Fringe – Edinburgh Evening News

Top Ten Shows – The Daily Record

Hit List – The List

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • If you can't donate hard cash, the best way you can help this event is by sharing our Indiegogo campaign
  • Once we're on sale, keep an eye out for our promotional materials; and share them far and wide
  • Volunteer your time and expertise - just email barrychurchwoods@gmail.com for an informal chat

story:
Hello, my name is Alex Nall. I'm a cartoonist and teaching artist living and working in Chicago, IL.  

Since 2013, I have been writing, illustrating, and painting a series of comics titled Teaching Comics that details my experiences working in two Chicago Public Schools as a teaching artist for a variety of youth arts programs.

These comics have found an online home on Chicago Literati (www.chicagoliterati.com) and have been a way to document my life during my time as a teaching artist. 

Ultimately, my goal is to collect these comics in a 130 page full-color book so that they can be read together as a whole series rather than be viewed as individual comics. While I have self-published mini-comics, small collections of my work, and posted comics online in the past, this would be my first full-length graphic novel.

Since I started teaching a comics class at an elementary school, I have printed and sold the comics made by my students to raise money for their after school program. I would also want to publish the students' comics in this book, in order to share their work and stories.

Teaching Comics will collect two years of comics that were published online as well as new material that has not been published anywhere. By supporting this campaign you'll not only help me bring these comics to a wider audience, but you'll also be empowering elementary and high schools students to keep creating art work in their schools.

What I Need & What You Get

  • I need $3000 to print a full-color 130 page book, ship to supporters and to stores across the country, as well as print promotional items such as postcards, buttons, and bookmarks. The money you donate will be going to these costs as well as other steps in the process of publishing 'Teaching Comics'.
  • By donating money to my campaign you will be able to receive fantastic, unique rewards such as original artwork, free comic workshops for yourself/ kids/classroom/friends, as well as comics created by the elementary students featured in the book!
  • If I DO NOT reach my goal, any funds will be used towards the printing cost of the book. Any dollar helps and it would mean a lot to me!

The Impact

  • I believe this project is valuable because you will be helping me publish a book to a wider audience.
  • These comics were originally featured on Chicago Literati, and it would benefit a small start-up website like them to have a published title with their name included.
  • Most importantly, your contributions to this campaign will help students get their work out to a community of artists and readers, benefiting their education and appreciation for art.

Risks & Challenges

  • As a self-publisher, money is always at the forefront of concerns. By donating money to my campaign you'll help take away the biggest worry on my plate-covering the printing cost.
  • I always love to give back to those who support me and I've created a number of perks that benefit me and give backers a sincere, tangible reward.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I will continue to post the current run of 'Teaching Comics' on Chicago Literati. If you can share the work online and help spread the word about the series, that would help just as much!

story:
Hey guys! Listen!

Hi everyone! I'm Stephany, more commonly known as Hana Kiyoha or just Hana. I'm college student in my early 20s studying Business Magnament, and I am raising money to pursue my love of cosplay- designing, creating, and wearing costumes. Making costumes is something I have been doing since 2012, and while I've taken short breaks for school and family reasons, I've never stopped loving the work. 

I got back into convention cosplaying last year and have spent the past year learning new skills, improving my craft, and being active in the Venezuelan convention scene. Cosplay isn't as expensive as some people make it out to be if you make things yourself, but it can still be costly.

Why I'm doing this fundraiser:

The first and most important is that while I love cosplay and don't ever want to give it up, I am the primary financial support for myself, and right now I'm pretty much broke because the unstable economics conditions (read here: http://www.forbes.com/sites/francescoppola/2015...  or just google Venezuelan Economy) . Here in Venezuela the diary salary is less than 1$ dollar and while I work full time I barely make enough to pay the bills. Between groceries and paying for school I have been trouble to keep going to conventions. I don't buy things when I go to cons, most of the time all I do is work in my friends booths in the conventions and showcase my costumes. But paying for hotels and food while there can really add up. My family comes first, and I will never choose to do something for myself over them, but I really don't want to have to give up my passion and talent because of funding.

The second reason is that I have a large project I want to undertake for a competition this fall, and I need supplies. I don't want expensive stuff for the sake of having cool armor, so please don't think that. I have certain supplies and tools I need, such as a heat gun and large amounts of either craft foam and/or thermoplastics, (that are currently almost impossible to adquire given the economics problem that we have here) that I will need to make the armor and costume props. These necessary supplies aren't horribly expensive on their own (thermoplastics are a pretty penny but I'm not planning to use them for the entire armor, just what's necessary and what I can afford) but adding up the cost it will be more expensive than anything I've made before. If you need proof, just Google the price of a heat gun and a large sheet of Worbla. u.u

I love cosplay, making props, and competing with my costumes. I really don't want to have to stop

The feeling of walking out on a stage in a costume you made yourself and hearing that you make people happy because you give life to their favorite characters, regardless of how many, is one of the greatest feelings in the world for me. I'd really appreciate just a little extra cash to help me keep doing this, as well to continue going to school =)

If this fundraiser sucess I am actually looking in to taking costume design and/or prop/makeup classes in the future, so I will be keeping creating more fundraiser even once I've reached goals. You all are what make it possible for me to pursue my dreams, and your support makes me believe that maybe I really can do this sort of thing professionally some day!

So, what am I doing if I won't reach our goal? Yush. Cosplay is fun, cosplay is work, cosplay is social. I'll still try to get everything what I need. Even if it's gonna be very hard.

I really appreciate any help, even if it's just a share on Facebook, Twitter, or Tumblr!

Thank you so much!

story:
My name is Emilio Rodriguez and I am the founder of Tres Calaveras Studios, a studio dedicated to creating worlds that people are going to want to be a part of and share with others.  It is also the aim of the studio to introduce some much-needed diversity to comics and comic concepts.  However, it is not enough to have characters or creators that are diverse - one must endeavor to produce quality while promoting diversity.  After all, diversity without quality is merely a book with a minority character. 

I am an attorney and a college professor who has always possessed an ardent love for comics, and have read and written them since my earliest years.  This campaign is important to me because I wish to create a world that people are going to want to be a part of and share with others.  It is also important to me to help show the genre is capable of depth and character development that can stand against any other. 

The risks are few because the book is done for a debut at the NY Comic Con in October 2016.  Therefore, those who pledge are not going to have to wait long for their rewards.  My studio has put out three issues of a series called Sara Rising, also a sci-fi story; therefore we know what goes into completing a book and getting it out to the public.       

The funding needed is $5000.  This money will cover the costs paid to complete the book.  Additional funds will go to publishing costs, Indiegogo fees, and marketing costs. 

Some of the cool perks offered are commissions of ANY character desired by the pledgor (even characters not part of this campaign) by some of the most noted artists in the field: Mike Lilly (Nightwing, Black Terror, Madness of Wonderland), and Paris Cullins (Blue Beetle).  

Even if you can't contribute, you can help by spreading the word and making some raucous noise about the campaign.  We don't do this to create in a vacuum.  We do it to bring joy, creativity, and a damn good story to the world. Thanks everyone!

story:
Help Red Arcis Entertainment raise money for a reprint as well as advertising and marketing of the sold out Okemus Issue 0! The initial print runs sold out at San Diego Comic Con. Now we need supporters help to take this incredibly unique comic book to the next level and put it in the hands of comic fans across the nation.

BE A PART OF AN INDIE COMICS REVOLUTION!! SUPPORT RED ARCIS ENTERTAINMENT!!! 


OKEMUS: ISSUE 0 is a creator-owned 36-page mini graphic novel by Taylor Sterling & his Red Arcis Entertainment super team! 

Synopsis of Issue 0:

In the far distant future, the planet earth has become a desolate shell of it’s former decadence. Once great nations now lay in ruin. Monstrous subhuman creatures called Mechai roam the Earth terrorizing, feeding, and killing any living thing in their path. With each day the human populous dwindles.

Enter Cale....a time traveling warrior whose body is inhabited by a symbiotic creature, that at a moments notice can transform him into a superpowered fighting machine.

Cale’s quest to determine his heritage and source of his mysterious abilities puts him in direct conflict with the Mechai. After years of warring against them Cale discovers that their origins are interconnected by one thing......a mythical city complex known only as OKEMUS!

Now Cale must journey to OKEMUS in an attempt to discover the secrets of his own beginnings and save humankind or lose both forever.


OKEMUS is a sci-fi action comic that blends nuances of classic japanese anime, sentai, and martial art genres to create a tale that has effectively coalesced Eastern and Western philosophies and ideologies.


Okemus Issue 0 Cover A

Okemus Issue 0 Cover B

Story & Art by Taylor Sterling. Words by Eugene Argent. Inks by Aspen Comics Jaxen De Nobriga. Colors by Image Comics Francisco Perez aka PAC23. Letters by Taylor Esposito of Ghost Glyph Studios (formerly DC & Marvel). 

Interior Pages -Pencils to Inks to Colors:





OKEMUS ISSUE 0 is my very first graphic novel and the first product from Red Arcis Entertainment LLC. 

For me OKEMUS is a culmination of years of extremely hard work, passion, and dedication to bring an incredibly professional and all around cool story to comic fans across the nation and with your help the world! 

I spared no expense and enlisted the creative talents of industry vets that know how to make incredible comics! These gents put their heart and soul into OKEMUS and it shows on every page beginning to end. We know you will love it!!!!!!!!

We also went all out and utilized another industry benchmark for printing Avenue 4 Communications. Marvel, DC, Aspen and many publishers use this incredible printing house to produce their top notch comics on a regular basis. 

So when it comes to printing you are definitely getting the best quality out there! 


With your support, I will produce a high-quality print run of 500 copies of OKEMUS ISSUE #0, if we can hit the $3,000 mark.

I am super new to the comic book community and have only done a hand full of comic conventions but I say this to every person that has ever supported me..."I wouldn't be able to do this without you!!!". 

I am coming to You...yes you the readers and comic fans alike, your support has been the key to the current success of OKEMUS. I want to bring this incredible work of art to far corners of planet so everyone can experience this new and innovative story.

Avenue 4 Communications

It was incredibly important to have a printed product of extremely high quality in order to go outside the realm of what normal low-budget indie books are capable of as well as deliver a quality product to fans. 

As I stated above Avenue 4 Communications is an industry standard for printing tons of professional comics for big wig publishers like Marvel, DC, Aspen Comics and much more!

Everyone that has purchased the first print run of OKEMUS raves not only about the story and art but the print quality being absolutely stellar..especially for an indie book!

The good folks at Avenue 4 Communications (Gabe, Arlene and their amazing staff) printed the incredible first run of OKEMUS and we can't wait to work with them again to fulfill the orders placed here within this campaign.

Breakdown of what we need help with, funding-wise: 


Since the inception of Red Arcis Entertainment the goal has always been to create an ongoing series based around the incredible characters within the OKEMUS storyline. 

Ultimately the vision from day one has been OKEMUS as a 5 issue mini-series with 3 Arcs..so in total 15 issues have been plotted and planned! At this very moment I am in the process of illustrating the next issue of OKEMUS based on the script my writer Eugene Argent has already completed!!

With your help and support not only will we reprint the sold out OKEMUS ISSUE #0 we will also advertise and market OKEMUS across all comic book news sites and platforms. On top of that we will also pitch this incredibly awesome comic property to larger publishers like IMAGE, DARK HORSE, & ONI-PRESS. 

The goal would be to get one out of these three publishers to help us bring to you, fans, friends, and awesome supporters, the next full story arc (Issues #1-5). There is an awesome demand for OKEMUS so far and we hope to supply that demand with your help!

Taylor Sterling is illustrator and designer currently working in New York City. Taylor first broke into the comic book business working in the infamous Bullpen for Marvel Entertainment from 2010-2011. There he cut his teeth doing production and design work on every major Marvel title out. Post his tenure at Marvel he focused his attention on his own comic book company Red Arcis Entertainment which had been in the works prior. He is the artist and visionary behind OKEMUS ISSUE 0. He also creates storyboards and production art for Robot Underdog's massively successful Dragon Ball Z: Light of Hope webisode series. When Taylor is not preparing for the next comic convention and drawing amazing characters he enjoys cooking, exercising, bowling, discovering new films and hanging out with friends.


With any amount you donate you get something for FREE!!! How cool is that!

The SOLD OUT print run:

OKEMUS Issue 0 debuted at San Diego Comic Con 2015 and within 4 days completely sold out of it's 300 issues. Between new fans and comic shop owners hungry for OKEMUS there were no copies left to spare at the end of the show. At that time me, Red Arcis Entertainment and OKEMUS were virtually unknown! 

This incredible turnout was due in part to the stellar art, phenomenal story and high quality printing. But that wasn't the most important factor at all...the fans and loyal comic readers were the real reason the OKEMUS issue 0 has been a success thus far.

We have been extremely fortunate to share this incredible story with so many. We only hope to do so now on an even larger scale and with this campaign we aim to do just that.

This was and still is a grassroots movement at it's very core! 

I am extremely confident that you will enjoy OKEMUS just like the many who have already purchased a copy of this comic. To see what all the fuss is about feel free to download this FREE 8 PAGE PREVIEW HERE! 


Fan Testimonials:


If You Can't Contribute:

Sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Indiegogo has share tools to make it easy
  • Please share on facebook
  • Please share on twitter
  • Please email to friends and family
  • Please embed this campaign on your blog
  • Don't forget a little help goes a long way

And that's all folks! I really would give a HUGE thank you for the support and kindness and time you've already given by reading my page! 


Some FAQ's:

Q. When do the perks ship out?

A. Most perks will ship out during the first quarter of January 2016.


Q. When will the next issue of OKEMUS come out? 

A. The next issue of OKEMUS is currently in production and expected to be completed and ready for print by end of January 2016.


Q. What is OKEMUS?

A. OKEMUS is the title of the comic book and within the story the mythical city complex in which all the characters are created.


Q. Why did you start OKEMUS with an issue 0 and not an Issue 1?

A. OKEMUS issue 0 is special. It's a side story that sets up the main story which occurs in Issue 1 due out in January.


Q. What happens if you don't reach your goal?

A. It's pretty simple, because there's an audience for OKEMUS we will make another print run happen...no worries :-)


Q. What happens if you are unable to get picked up by a major publisher?

A. Well honestly OKEMUS is and always has been a project of passion. It's something resonates with me on a deeper level. In my opinion it's a story that needs to be told. So stopping won't happen because there's always self publishing and many other really cool smaller publishing housing looking for awesome content. 


Q. Why is this campaign so important?

A. As stated in the video there is a huge demand for new content and interesting characters overall. OKEMUS delivers just that and now the most important thing is to share this book with the world giving them an entertaining and awesome piece of work.
story_txt:
Help Red Arcis Entertainment raise money for a reprint as well as advertising and marketing of the sold out Okemus Issue 0! The initial print runs sold out at San Diego Comic Con. Now we need supporters help to take this incredibly unique comic book to the next level and put it in the hands of comic fans across the nation.BE A PART OF AN INDIE COMICS REVOLUTION!! SUPPORT RED ARCIS ENTERTAINMENT!!! OKEMUS: ISSUE 0 is a creator-owned 36-page mini graphic novel by Taylor Sterling & his Red Arcis Entertainment super team! Synopsis of Issue 0:In the far distant future, the planet earth has become a desolate shell of it’s former decadence. Once great nations now lay in ruin. Monstrous subhuman creatures called Mechai roam the Earth terrorizing, feeding, and killing any living thing in their path. With each day the human populous dwindles.Enter Cale....a time traveling warrior whose body is inhabited by a symbiotic creature, that at a moments notice can transform him into a superpowered fighting machine.Cale’s quest to determine his heritage and source of his mysterious abilities puts him in direct conflict with the Mechai. After years of warring against them Cale discovers that their origins are interconnected by one thing......a mythical city complex known only as OKEMUS!Now Cale must journey to OKEMUS in an attempt to discover the secrets of his own beginnings and save humankind or lose both forever.OKEMUS is a sci-fi action comic that blends nuances of classic japanese anime, sentai, and martial art genres to create a tale that has effectively coalesced Eastern and Western philosophies and ideologies.Okemus Issue 0 Cover A




Okemus Issue 0 Cover B

Story & Art by Taylor Sterling. Words by Eugene Argent. Inks by Aspen Comics Jaxen De Nobriga. Colors by Image Comics Francisco Perez aka PAC23. Letters by Taylor Esposito of Ghost Glyph Studios (formerly DC & Marvel). 

Interior Pages -Pencils to Inks to Colors:


















OKEMUS ISSUE 0 is my very first graphic novel and the first product from Red Arcis Entertainment LLC. For me OKEMUS is a culmination of years of extremely hard work, passion, and dedication to bring an incredibly professional and all around cool story to comic fans across the nation and with your help the world! I spared no expense and enlisted the creative talents of industry vets that know how to make incredible comics! These gents put their heart and soul into OKEMUS and it shows on every page beginning to end. We know you will love it!!!!!!!!We also went all out and utilized another industry benchmark for printing Avenue 4 Communications. Marvel, DC, Aspen and many publishers use this incredible printing house to produce their top notch comics on a regular basis. So when it comes to printing you are definitely getting the best quality out there! With your support, I will produce a high-quality print run of 500 copies of OKEMUS ISSUE #0, if we can hit the $3,000 mark.I am super new to the comic book community and have only done a hand full of comic conventions but I say this to every person that has ever supported me..."I wouldn't be able to do this without you!!!". I am coming to You...yes you the readers and comic fans alike, your support has been the key to the current success of OKEMUS. I want to bring this incredible work of art to far corners of planet so everyone can experience this new and innovative story.Avenue 4 CommunicationsIt was incredibly important to have a printed product of extremely high quality in order to go outside the realm of what normal low-budget indie books are capable of as well as deliver a quality product to fans. As I stated above Avenue 4 Communications is an industry standard for printing tons of professional comics for big wig publishers like Marvel, DC, Aspen Comics and much more!Everyone that has purchased the first print run of OKEMUS raves not only about the story and art but the print quality being absolutely stellar..especially for an indie book!The good folks at Avenue 4 Communications (Gabe, Arlene and their amazing staff) printed the incredible first run of OKEMUS and we can't wait to work with them again to fulfill the orders placed here within this campaign.Breakdown of what we need help with, funding-wise: Since the inception of Red Arcis Entertainment the goal has always been to create an ongoing series based around the incredible characters within the OKEMUS storyline. 
Ultimately the vision from day one has been OKEMUS as a 5 issue mini-series with 3 Arcs..so in total 15 issues have been plotted and planned! At this very moment I am in the process of illustrating the next issue of OKEMUS based on the script my writer Eugene Argent has already completed!!

With your help and support not only will we reprint the sold out OKEMUS ISSUE #0 we will also advertise and market OKEMUS across all comic book news sites and platforms. On top of that we will also pitch this incredibly awesome comic property to larger publishers like IMAGE, DARK HORSE, & ONI-PRESS. 


The goal would be to get one out of these three publishers to help us bring to you, fans, friends, and awesome supporters, the next full story arc (Issues #1-5). There is an awesome demand for OKEMUS so far and we hope to supply that demand with your help!



Taylor Sterling is illustrator and designer currently working in New York City. Taylor first broke into the comic book business working in the infamous Bullpen for Marvel Entertainment from 2010-2011. There he cut his teeth doing production and design work on every major Marvel title out. Post his tenure at Marvel he focused his attention on his own comic book company Red Arcis Entertainment which had been in the works prior. He is the artist and visionary behind OKEMUS ISSUE 0. He also creates storyboards and production art for Robot Underdog's massively successful Dragon Ball Z: Light of Hope webisode series. When Taylor is not preparing for the next comic convention and drawing amazing characters he enjoys cooking, exercising, bowling, discovering new films and hanging out with friends.






With any amount you donate you get something for FREE!!! How cool is that!



The SOLD OUT print run:
OKEMUS Issue 0 debuted at San Diego Comic Con 2015 and within 4 days completely sold out of it's 300 issues. Between new fans and comic shop owners hungry for OKEMUS there were no copies left to spare at the end of the show. At that time me, Red Arcis Entertainment and OKEMUS were virtually unknown! 
This incredible turnout was due in part to the stellar art, phenomenal story and high quality printing. But that wasn't the most important factor at all...the fans and loyal comic readers were the real reason the OKEMUS issue 0 has been a success thus far.
We have been extremely fortunate to share this incredible story with so many. We only hope to do so now on an even larger scale and with this campaign we aim to do just that.
This was and still is a grassroots movement at it's very core! 
I am extremely confident that you will enjoy OKEMUS just like the many who have already purchased a copy of this comic. To see what all the fuss is about feel free to download this FREE 8 PAGE PREVIEW HERE!

Don't forget a little help goes a long way

story:
Welcome all and thank you for coming to my crowdfunding page! My name is Kamasi Hill, PhD and I'm a historian, theologian, art curator, filmmaker, and a high school teacher for the past 25 years. I specialize in 20th and 21st century American Religious History and Culture and my work explores various themes in African-American History, religion, and popular culture. 

I've been a fan of comic books all my life! When I was kid, my parents bought me DC and Marvel comics, but they also bought me Golden Legacy Black History Comics. I was hooked and realized that storytelling and cartoon art/animation could be informative and educational. 

  • In college, I decided to major in film and history, I knew that I wanted to be a storyteller. 

  • In ancient West Africa, the keepers of the story earned the title of "Griot." 

  • I've been a modern day griot, teaching students for over 25 years, and have noticed waning interest in reading. Students are often bored (and rightfully so) with traditional text books, so I decided to create a series of non-fiction graphic novels to help reorient students to the power of literacy and imagination.
  • The truth is, the way we think is in images and thoughts. We don't remember things as movies or photographs, we remember them as cartoons.

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to create a series of Graphic Novels that can serve as primary and supplemental learning materials for students and lifelong learners. A Griot's History will be a series of Graphic Novels filled with humor, illustration, and facts about history that you will find no place else!

I will be self-publishing the first run of the graphic novel. I will need funds to produce the comics, compensate the illustrator, pay for the digital coloring, publishing, and shipping. 

  • Most importantly, your gifts go to help inspire people to read and learn about African-American history and culture in a way that isn't boring or uninspiring. The perks that you can receive include your own copies and merchandise associated with the series depending on your gift.
  • The first in the series will focus on the Great Migration in 4 Acts: I will focus on the ideas, cultural/religious contributions, the political/economic impacts, and highlight the role of unsung sheroes/heroes during the early to mid-20th century. 
  • Humor, vivid images, and short and direct passages will be featured on all 120 pages! 

 

  • This project has one primary goal in mind: to tell the stories of the Black experience to a new generation of readers without boring them to death! 
  • Ideally, I would love every student in the classroom to have a copy of this series.
  • I have published articles, written chapters in books, and completed a full length feature documentary film about history! Now it's time to help inspire young adults and lifelong learners through the power of illustration and storytelling.
  • Your contribution is essential to make that happen! 
  • 100% of your gifts will go to producing and publishing the graphic novel!
  • If it is successful, I will be able to continue the series beyond the Great Migration.                      

Please consider making a contribution and/or sharing the link to this project! Thank you so much in advance! 

 - Kamasi Hill, PhD, The Griot

I specialize in 20th and 21st century American Religious History and Culture and my work explores various themes in African-American History, religion, and popular culture. 
I've been a fan of comic books all my life! When I was kid, my parents bought me DC and Marvel comics, but they also bought me Golden Legacy Black History Comics. I was hooked and realized that storytelling and cartoon art/animation could be informative and educational. 


In college, I decided to major in film and history, I knew that I wanted to be a storyteller. 
In ancient West Africa, the keepers of the story earned the title of "Griot." 
I've been a modern day griot, teaching students for over 25 years, and have noticed waning interest in reading. Students are often bored (and rightfully so) with traditional text books, so I decided to create a series of non-fiction graphic novels to help reorient students to the power of literacy and imagination.
The truth is, the way we think is in images and thoughts. We don't remember things as movies or photographs, we remember them as cartoons.


What We Need & What You Get
My goal is to create a series of Graphic Novels that can serve as primary and supplemental learning materials for students and lifelong learners. A Griot's History will be a series of Graphic Novels filled with humor, illustration, and facts about history that you will find no place else!

I will be self-publishing the first run of the graphic novel. I will need funds to produce the comics, compensate the illustrator, pay for the digital coloring, publishing, and shipping. 

Most importantly, your gifts go to help inspire people to read and learn about African-American history and culture in a way that isn't boring or uninspiring. The perks that you can receive include your own copies and merchandise associated with the series depending on your gift.
The first in the series will focus on the Great Migration in 4 Acts: I will focus on the ideas, cultural/religious contributions, the political/economic impacts, and highlight the role of unsung sheroes/heroes during the early to mid-20th century. 
Humor, vivid images, and short and direct passages will be featured on all 120 pages! 

 

This project has one primary goal in mind: to tell the stories of the Black experience to a new generation of readers without boring them to death! 
Ideally, I would love every student in the classroom to have a copy of this series.
I have published articles, written chapters in books, and completed a full length feature documentary film about history! Now it's time to help inspire young adults and lifelong learners through the power of illustration and storytelling.
Your contribution is essential to make that happen! 
100% of your gifts will go to producing and publishing the graphic novel!

Please consider making a contribution and/or sharing the link to this project! Thank you so much in advance!  - Kamasi Hill, PhD, The Griot

story:
Overview

I've been a writer for years, mostly for high school and college. In 2016, a coworker of mine asked for help with her college papers. Her request inspired me to write a short story about my cat, Russell, and I spent a year writing what now has become Russell's first comic book. I owe so much to that friend, but sadly she took her own life. You will see a dedication page for her in Russell's book. The same year I finished Russell's short story, I found my artist UrbanFoxGamer and we have passionately collaborated on this book for almost two years. Alternatively, Russell is not a kid's book, but if you like cats and Deadpool, then this comic book is for you. The characters in Russell like to use colorful language and shoot first and ask questions later. 

THE ART FOR THE BOOK IS 80% FINISHED

This book will ship in February 2020. 

We are starting our goal at $3000 but we want Russell's story to reach everywhere, so we look at the goal as a foundation. Money raised will go to printing. The sky is the limit for Russell, and we want to share our story with everyone who loves cats. Therefore, readers do not have to be only comic book fans, and anyone can admire Russell's story. 

The perks are easy-so you, as the customer, get the most for your money and there's no confusion about where your money is going. 

A hard copy book, a Russell personally pawtographed copy of his comic and trading card, and finally a 2 pack of Russell's comic and a trading card. 

UPDATES

As a newbie in the comic book foray, I want to be as transparent as possible. Please feel free to comment and ask questions in the comments area, and I will also update everyone on the progress for Russell's comic. Russell wants to show the world how to live on the bad side of the litterbox!

TEAM

Written by-Brian Starkey

Illustrated by-UrbanFoxGamer

story:
I want to share knowledge with everyone and this is my way. "To watch the vídeo, turn on the subtitle".

I graduated in business administration from FASP - Faculdades Associadas de São Paulo and holds an MBA in strategic management of information technology from FGV - Fundação Getúlio Vargas. PMP (Project Management Professional) certified by the PMI (Project Management Institute).

How the project started ?

Geplanus Pranada came alive from the idea of depicting experiences, wishes and desires of Project Management professionals.

 Goals ?

Disseminate design concepts, business and entrepreneurship, using HQs

Valuing the profession

Break paradigms

Demystifying best practices and propagate them for any segment Marketplace

Using comics to promote the need for knowing project management concepts, entrepreneurship and business in a playful way.

Making more accessible assimilation, even for non-specialized professionals and any segment, since it is not as popular.

Create a new project management vision, reinforcing the need for expert

Reaching universities, large corporations and training companies in globally, as the material can be produced in several languages.

Using comics, animation, digital and printed material that may be used in regular courses.

Budget distribution ?

Print strips (52 weeks) =        US$ 6066,667

Disclosure (social medias) = US$ 3933,333

story:
***

Don't let the flexible goal scare you away. I chose flexible because we are backing NO MATTER WHAT! We were committed to that from day one, we want these books in peoples hands. And they will be!

***

Knuckle Supper Studios is an indie comics publisher that wants to make comics fun again. Remember the 80's indie boom? That's what we want to bring back. Escapism with no morals or PC BS, etc jammed down your throat. Entertainment is the goal, and that's what's going to keep you coming back. Good stories, good art, good times.

In keeping with our love of 80's comics, we've decided to go with newsprint books. The books will look amazing and modern while having that throw-back, retro feel. Not only that, it allows us to set the books at a much lower cover price giving backers more bang for their buck!

 

Tales From Neroesville: Issues 1 - 3

TFN is a book with no singular star. The city itself serves as the backdrop for our entire universe with different stars and story types in each arc.

Neroesville has the highest population of Heroes of any city in the world. Awesome! It also has the most Villains. Not so awesome. Living here is unlike living anywhere else. Every day is an adventure. Here's hoping you live to tell about it!

Get in on the ground floor with the first 3 issues of Tales From Neroesville! 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TALES FROM NEROESVILLE #1: LIGHTNING BALLS (part 1 of 2)

An object of unparalleled power has been located and the criminal kingpin Lord Sinisterio wants it for himself. If he manages to get the object and translate the ancient text, the world will tremble beneath his rule. Neroesville’s greatest heroes have been gathered to thwart Sinisterio and his army. Unfortunately for AirBall and LightningDoug, they didn’t make the cut, but that doesn’t mean they won’t end up right in the middle of the action!

TALES FROM NEROESVILLE #2: LIGHTNING BALLS (part 2 of 2)

While Neroesville’s greatest heroes are in hot pursuit of the object, our lovable losers, AirBall and LightningDoug, find themselves consistently and accidentally one step ahead of them. Meanwhile, Lord Sinisterio is preparing to recite the ancient text and gain omnipotence. Will AirBall and LightningDoug save the day? Better question: will they survive the day?

 

TALES FROM NEROESVILLE #3 : A DAY AT THE BEACH

The street gangs have taken over the Allister Pointe Pier section of Neroesville. The police have their hands full with the super-powered criminal activity. So who, or what, will step in and take care of the thugs making life Hell on the Pier?

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You help us create awesome comic books, and we'll put them in your hands. It's a win-win!

Tired of big publishers throwing politics at you rather than focusing on quality comics? Yeah, us too. 

So we're taking a cue from the 80's Indie boom, creating comics full of zany action, wacky characters, and general @$$-kickery! 

Comics should be an escape from real life. Ours are. Welcome to Neroesville!

This campaign is the first of many. It's the culmination of a life-long passion and almost 20 years of working toward that dream. This is what we've always wanted to do, ALL we've ever wanted to do. Until now, without you, it hasn't been possible. Support our dream and we'll give you the comics you want and deserve. The type of books the big publishers don't seem to want to publish anymore. But we can't do it without your help and support.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What We Need & What You Get

Here's one thing that differentiates us from other comic books on IGG; these books are DONE and ready for print! The $2500 goal is not to complete the art on the books on THIS campaign, it's to pay for printing this campaign's books, while also funding illustrating the next TFN campaign. This business model keeps us one step ahead of the game and assures our backers get the books that much faster.

The art, coloring, lettering, etc is DONE. Not only for the main stories, but for the Stretch Goal shorts as well. Aside from advertisements to be added post-campaign, these books are ready to go to print. Reliability. That's another thing Knuckle Supper Studios offers it's backers.

With the books already at 64 pages in the first 3 issues, stretch goals could put the books at at least a total of at least 91 pages. WOW, what a bargain!

 

Help us help you

We enjoy making these books, but we're not making them for ourselves. We're making them for you. And we can't do it without your support. Help us follow our passion and we'll deliver quality, entertaining comics. That's our promise to you. Comics are meant to be an escape from real life; not a lesson on morality, political correctness, identity politics, etc. We're not here to tell you how to live your life. We're here to help you forget about it for a little bit.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't afford to contribute? No worries. Please consider sharing this campaign on your social medias. Remember: Sharing is caring! Check out the IndieGoGo share tools to make it easier. Every little bit helps and is appreciated!

Thanks, The KSS Crew

Pages 1 and 2 of issue 1

​Pages 3 and 4 of issue 1

​Pages 1 and 2 of issue 2

​Pages 3 and 4 of issue 2

​Pages 1 and 2 of issue 3

​Pages 3 and 4 of issue 3

 

Dennis Fujitake autographed pencil/ink pinup & autographed Dalgoda #1

Tired of big publishers throwing politics at you rather than focusing on quality comics? Yeah, us too. 
So we're taking a cue from the 80's Indie boom, creating comics full of zany action, wacky characters, and general @$$-kickery! 
Comics should be an escape from real life. Ours are. Welcome to Neroesville!
This campaign is the first of many. It's the culmination of a life-long passion and almost 20 years of working toward that dream. This is what we've always wanted to do, ALL we've ever wanted to do. Until now, without you, it hasn't been possible. Support our dream and we'll give you the comics you want and deserve. The type of books the big publishers don't seem to want to publish anymore. But we can't do it without your help and support.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What We Need & What You Get
Here's one thing that differentiates us from other comic books on IGG; these books are DONE and ready for print! The $2500 goal is not to complete the art on the books on THIS campaign, it's to pay for printing this campaign's books, while also funding illustrating the next TFN campaign. This business model keeps us one step ahead of the game and assures our backers get the books that much faster.
The art, coloring, lettering, etc is DONE. Not only for the main stories, but for the Stretch Goal shorts as well. Aside from advertisements to be added post-campaign, these books are ready to go to print. Reliability. That's another thing Knuckle Supper Studios offers it's backers.
With the books already at 64 pages in the first 3 issues, stretch goals could put the books at at least a total of at least 91 pages. WOW, what a bargain!
 

Help us help you
We enjoy making these books, but we're not making them for ourselves. We're making them for you. And we can't do it without your support. Help us follow our passion and we'll deliver quality, entertaining comics. That's our promise to you. Comics are meant to be an escape from real life; not a lesson on morality, political correctness, identity politics, etc. We're not here to tell you how to live your life. We're here to help you forget about it for a little bit.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Can't afford to contribute? No worries. Please consider sharing this campaign on your social medias. Remember: Sharing is caring! Check out the IndieGoGo share tools to make it easier. Every little bit helps and is appreciated!
Thanks, The KSS Crew

Pages 1 and 2 of issue 1

​Pages 3 and 4 of issue 1

​Pages 1 and 2 of issue 2

​Pages 3 and 4 of issue 2

​Pages 1 and 2 of issue 3

​Pages 3 and 4 of issue 3

story:
Introduction

Comic books have been very influential in my life. I started collecting since before I was able to read. Growing up I wanted to be a comic book writer. I've been creating my own characters and writing comic book stories since I was in junior high school. Comic books inspired me to get an art degree. Now I'm a web and graphic designer by trade, and I'm a proud family man with a wife and three kids. I still dream of being an accomplished comic book writer. By supporting this project you are helping to make this dream come true!

Oscar Choquecota Ale and his team at Bokuman Studios are the artists for the "Night Wolf" comic book series. These very talented artists have already started working on issue 2, as you will see some of their amazing artwork here. Carlos Herrera contributed to the "Night Wolf" project by creating gorgeous character designs, the cover and first four pages of issue #1. Also DC Comics colorist, Ross A. Campbell did the colors for most of issue #1, which is available in print and for digital download. You can get a copy here or through one of the campaign perks.

About Night Wolf

"Night Wolf" has an unique take on the supernatural, theology, mythology, and fantasy. If you love stories about anti-heroes and supernatural beings like werewolves, vampires, demons, witches, zombies and more then this is the comic book for you. The story encompasses elements of horror, magic, and science in a modern setting.

“Night Wolf” Synopsis

Born into the outcast breed of werewolves known as the Monoki, eighteen-year-old Rodney Marcelli is reluctantly thrown into an ancient war between good and evil in today's world where the line has blurred. With the help of Snow Paw, the Pureblood Monoki, and the supernatural evil slayer, Night Hunter, Rod must learn to master his newly found lycanthropy and mysterious kinetic energy power that only he possesses. While struggling to keep his soul from the conflict within, Rod must fight the Dark Covenant in order to avenge his friends and family, and save the girl he loves from the master vampire, Lord Malice. Rodney Marcelli is Night Wolf!

Character Designs

Variant Cover By Carlos Herrera & Ross A. Campbell 

Example Pages

Goals

The funds raise by this campaign will be used for...

  • $3000 - Issue 2 - Digital Version of the fully colored Cover and 24 pages
  • $7000 - Issue 2 - Printed Version of the fully colored Cover and 24 pages
  • $10,000 - Get started on Issue #3 right away
  • $12,000 - Issue 3 - Digital Version of the fully colored Cover and 24 pages
  • $15,000 - Issue 3 - Printed Version of the fully colored Cover and 24 pages

Risks & Challenges

The only foreseeable challenges are keeping the production schedule on track with more than one artist involved. Also, Ross recently signed a contract with DC Comics. We are very happy for Ross on such an achievement, but sad to see him go. However, Oscar's team at Bokuman Studios will be taking on all of the artwork including the colors and are doing a great job. Sometimes life gets in the way and deadlines are missed, but we will get Night Wolf Issue #2 done and into your hands no matter what!

If campaign is not fully funded T-Shirts & Hoodies cannot be produced and sent out. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share the campaign on social media
  • Tell your friends, your family, and your comic book fanatics!

story:
Hello my name is JD Calderon and I’m a long time indy creator and I’ve run and completed a number of campaigns and I’m looking to share The Oswald Chronicles with you :D

Here we are at the final 2 issues of this exciting chapter in Oswald's life! In these 2 issues we will see Oswald confront an evil Ork Queen, while Diane and Ordith look to hold off an Ork army!

Each book will is limited to 500 copies for the variant covers, while the classic covers are  limited to 250 copies and will be signed and numbered.

We will be offering virgin covers. What that means is that the covers will be printed without any logos or text on them, so the art will not be obscured.

Also don’t be afraid if you missed the previous issues they’re still available.

We're also offering for the first time "It Came Seeking Me" a story where Oswald confronts a new kind of evil that seeks him out for help.

What We Need & What You Get

  • All funds for this project will go back into the project and be used to fund future issues.
  • We’re offering alternative covers plus awesome virgin covers.

The Impact

  • When I first started working on this series I didn’t intend to make it about Oswald. His name was in the title but it was really supposed to be him telling other characters stories that he ran across that he dictated. To some degree that still exists, but Oswald through sheer will made the story his own and it’s become a story of the smallest of us taking on challenges well beyond himself and doing his best to see them through.  

Risks & Challenges

  • The work is already done so there aren’t many risks.

Other Ways You Can Help

If can't contribute that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about The Oswald Chronicles.
  • And please use the Indiegogo share tools

Passing Queens and Making Homes issues 7 & 8 Written by JD Calderon and Illustrated by Jade Gonzalez with alternative colors by Donny Hadiwidjaja with colors by Carlos Alberto Moreno

It Came Seeking Me: Written by JD Calderon, Illustrated by Matt Lunsford

story:
Admiral Pizza Book 3 "Slice of the action"

Admiral Pizza is your NEW favorite pizza powered superhero! He has 2 Action packed books. "The Life And Times of Admiral Pizza & friends" And "Admiral Pizza: The Revenge of Dark hand"

He was mentioned in PMQ Pizza Magazine, And has a Videogame On playstation 4 made in dreams.

My Name is Alex Luebke, CEO of CRAZY LAND COMICS Our star title...Admiral pizza! He is the leader of the Snergaville city sea and space fleet. Admiral pizza is a comic for all ages. (too extreme for babies), Co created by me and my kid cousin Quetzal in 2008- Every Monday after school we would make homemade pizza and draw! I love Drawing comics, And people Loved our adventures-So i continue the tradition!

I always dreamed of selling my comics i created at a comic convention.  And My quiet hometown of Fairbanks Alaska was having it's first! I had ordered a few Dozen copies - But i KNEW it wasn't going to be enough! The Push From my "Pizza Power Campaign" I was able to get enough copies for everyone!!

It turned out to be a SMASH SUCCESS!! The Books flew off the Table Like Slices of pizza at a Sunday buffet! I sold over 120 BOOKS With Pizza stickers, Trading cards, Pizza flying discs, and even Pizza clothes! 

And now is your chance to get a SLICE OF THE ACTION of the Admirals biggest BADDEST Adventure yet!! 80 pages in this XXL stuffed crust book brimming with ALL the toppings!!!

And Admist all the challenges of 2020-We can forward to a LIGHT!

ALASKA COMICON 2021 ! It is very important to me to bring the tradition of PIZZA POWER to the city...AND THE WORLD!

 

What the Admiral Needs & What You Get

I Want to work hard to create 1 or more Comic Books every year.  I promised everyone who bought a copy of my book that i will deliver the goods-And the Admiral ALWAYS delivers. If you choose to contribute to my campaign you will be part of the greatest pizza adventure...OF ALL TIME. Your Pledge will be used to help the Admiral battle the rising costs of paper & printing books. And to continue the tradition of creating and delivering awesome new pizza comics to my Alaskan city, and the world!!

I'm using a new printer- Mixam. I will be printing over 100 Books.  And am setting up this campaign to: 

  • Help in the original investment of printing my new comic book.
  • Get the Books into the hands of Convention goers, Book Stores, Fans..And YOU.
  • To continue the tradition of creating and delivering awesome new pizza comics to my Alaskan city, and the world!!

You will be receiving a book i made with passion and care- Your Choice of: Collectable Trading cards, Pizza stickers, Coffee cups, Original sketches, And signed Artwork-And more! If i exceed my goal, A possible stretch goal will be- The production of MORE books! With the long term goal of creating an online store.

 

The Battle Ahead-

THE CORONA VIRUS- COVID 19- CORONACHAN

  • Its very possible the virus gets worse. The convention could be canceled/delayed.
  • If this Happens: I will set up an online store for hungry customers with a long term goal of keeping it stocked with Books/Products! But why wait?! Get your Slice now!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my campaign on your Facebook, twitter, and other social media! Get the word out! Use the Indiegogo share tools! 

Never give up! Never stop fighting! Don't let your pizza dreams be dreams!

Follow me on twitter!

Read it on Tumblr!

Read it on TAPAS!

Read it on WEBTOONS!
