story:
“Go to the Burning Spring. Make Red Salt.”

Why Should You Fund This Campaign?:

- You will help educate and inspire public action of serious environmental concerns through an entertaining platform.

- Award winning, Emmy nominated,  three time Telly winning  filmmaker.

- You get seriously cool and personalized swag.

My Production Cost Break Down: Budget Needed (artist, colorist, letterer: $90 per page x 140 pages): $12,600 !

Want to Support in Other Ways than Financially?
If you would like to support this campaign, but can't financially, you can still help by spreading the word to your friends, family, and coworkers by word of mouth and also by Sharing on All Your Social Media!

About SALT: Approx. 140 pp., full color eco-horror graphic novel conclusion of CARBON series.

Writer: Daniel Boyd (www.danielboyd.com)  Artist: Predrag "Peka" Ivaovic

Publisher: Caliber Entertainment  Film/TV, Multi-media representation: Zero Gravity.

Carbon created Heat, can Salt redeem him? Salt completes the tale begun with Carbon, which climaxed as Heat Hatfield rescued the few Eden Hollow citizens who survived the cataclysmic ignition of the eternal coal sea. In Salt, Heat reluctantly dons the mantle of messiah to lead his tattered band toward safety—or doom. But where can they find salvation?

Behind them, the fire spreads hotter than the world can survive, fueled by the liquefied remains of Earth’s first civilization—a people cursed by God for not maintaining balance with the Earth. And as the coal inferno spreads, Nathaniel Golliday and his zealous lunatic fringe seize the reins of State government in the chaos of a rapidly accelerating environmental disaster. Golliday declares himself governor of West Virginia, and vows to subdue all those who would oppose him.

At the grimmest hour, Heat and his band receive a command from the awakened God: “Go to the Burning Spring. Make Red Salt.” God’s mystery is both riddle and signpost to the promised land, and Heat must find the narrow path before twin evils descend on him and his people and threaten to engulf the earth.

Golliday activates a private army of underground militias to consolidate his power and eliminate Heat, but in the meantime, the National Party descends on West Virginia. Their plan? To eliminate Golliday and quench the inferno by deep drilling the largest fracking operation in history.

As the clock ticks toward Earth’s doomsday, the preservation of humankind depends on Heat Hatfield and the small, brave band of coal miners he leads in this conclusion of the CARBON series.

Like CARBON, the sensational tale in SALT delivers excitement with a message: Entertainment with purpose.

More In-Depth Look at Your Perks:


Space Preachers/ Chillers DVD:

J.Q. Dickinson Jar of Gourmet Salt:

 

CARBON Graphic Novel:

Red Salt DVD:


Chillers Series (Book 1 and 2):


America's Got Talent Winner Landau Eugene Murphy Jr. Back Stage Passes: (Check him out: www.landaumurphyjr.com)



Check out the SALT's Prequel CARBON:


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BOOK 1: CARBON QUOTES

" The collaborative effort of Daniel Boyd and Edi Guedes, "Carbon" is a superbly illustrated graphic novel that while a fictional entertainment, brings to bear some very real environmental issues and touches upon some very real human conflicts. Exceptionally well written and presented from first page to last, "Carbon" is very strongly recommended and rewarding reading."

- The Midwest Book Review

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

“Danny Boyd’s Carbon combines three distinct genres- Lovecraftian gorefest, religious picture book and politicall allegory- to tell the story of our slow and conscious self-poisoning.”

– John Sayles, from his introduction

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"This graphic novel’s tale is a self-contained piece of world-building, loaded generously with imaginative flair and yet still grounded in reality like the wise Aesop born anew." 

- Richard Caldwell, Heavy Metal Magazine

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"With CARBON Boyd marries sci-fi monster flick ideas with Appalachian tragedy, showing us imaginative allegory and authentic profundity do not have to be mutually exclusive."

- Chris Oxley, "Elston Gunn" of Ain't It Cool News

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"CARBON reads like an H.P. Lovecraft-influenced Robert E. Howard yarn updated for the age of mountain top removal and hydrofracking. There is a message here, andBoyd and Guedes deliver it with a mother lode of action and horror."

--Bob Calhoun, author of "Shattering Conventions: Commerce, Cosplay and Conflict on the Expo Floor"

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"In a world overrun with second rate, copy-cat comic books, "Carbon" is a truly unique graphic novel experience. Where a lot of comic books try to be "cool" these days - "Carbon" is actuallyverycool! It's a graphic novel that explores humanity's exploitative relationship with nature that is heartfelt, intimate, and totally outrageous.

- Scott Marcano, graphic novelist, screenwriter of Bio-Dome and Sanitarium  

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"Faith can be a cruel mistress. Faith in our community, our employers, our churches and our leaders. Faith in ourselves especially. And while in these uncertain times having faith in others can be difficult, the talent displayed by the creative team here in a tale of very topical concerns is beyond any shadow of doubt. CARBON is explicitly for those who want to believe."
-Dave Elliott, Co-Founder/Co-Owner of ATOMEKA Press

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

“Carbon is outstanding.  A great fantasy adventure wrapped in a tale of greed and corruption gone haywire.  Highly recommended.”

- Adam Hamdy, Writer/Filmmaker, The Hunter, Pulp

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"Filmmakers, scholars, poets, authors, photographers, musicians and visual artists have used their skills to explore what mountaintop removal coal mining does to mountain communities and our life support system (water, land, air). Boyd’s pulse-quickening Carbon is the first creative work in the graphic novel medium to tackle this subject and it will inspire an entirely new audience to join the movement to end mountaintop removal."

- Vivian Stockman, Ohio Valley Environmental Coalition

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"This gorgeously illustrated, testosterone-torqued ride does nothing less than chronicle the history of time from Genesis to Revelation. Boyd exposes the symbiotic relationship between humans and the coal that may keep furnaces burning, create jobs, and fill corporate coffers, but it could ultimately cost us not only the Garden, but our very souls."​

- Marie Manilla, author of "Shrapnel" and "The Patron Saint of Ugly"

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"With spectacular allegorical style and expressive artwork, Mr. Boyd's graphic novel shows the struggle of live carbon (man) to deal with fossil carbon and the impacts to our earth. The graphic novel "Carbon" shows the need to transition from carbon based electricity to clean power. We hope that our political leaders heed the warnings and implement policies that lead to a cleaner, healthier world."  

- Bill Price, Sierra Club Environmental Justice Program. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

''Carbon' is a colorful, fast-paced thriller that draws on an iconic Appalachian theme -- courageous coal miners who fight forces of evil underground. The book is a great read, and I look forward to the sequel!"  

- Tom Rodd, Project Director, Friends of Blackwater

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

“Danny Boyd’s CARBON is both horrifying and thoughtful, and is especially poignant for those with family or friends in the mining industry.”

- Mark Justice, author of "The Dead Sheriff" and "Looking At The World With Broken Glass In My Eye," and host of Pod of Horror

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"... he has fashioned a spell-binding horror tale, a perfect vehicle for delivering the goods on what often seems to those who live here a tale of injustice too far-fetched to believe.  But you will believe CARBON.  Boyd is compelling truth-teller – the blood and gore bear witness."

- Marc Harshman, Poet Laureate of West Virginia

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

" Without preaching, Boyd’s message seems clear: We the people endured the clear cutting of our timber; sacrificed long term benefits for coal’s short term jobs---  jobs responsible for  contaminating water, soil, air, and often wrecking the health of the employees.  Jobs offered by irresponsible employers willing to ignore slurry dams and pollution. Boyd is saying it loud and clear.  This book is fire in the hole!"

- Phyllis Wilson Moore, West Virginia Literary Historian 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"... it is a masterpiece of action and adventure. This graphic novel provides unique perspectives on all things; beginning at the true beginning: creation. Compelling, genuine characters are relatable and unattainable. This cast includes a bad-ass baseball player; the gruff, grizzled, yet essentially kind mine workers, my personal favorite: the River Rat (aka as White Water River Guide), and The Man (He Who Gets Rich From The Fruit of Their Labors). His greed endangers the lives of his producers, yet he has no qualms. He underestimates the miners.  Love, family, friendship and community create a strong, unbreakable bond, thus turning apparently ordinary folks into true, awe-inspiring heroes.

My fellow readers, if you seek something absolutely unlike anything you’ve read, this is it."

- JV Poore, Goodreads

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

" Like a carefully constructed film, Carbon’s dialogue is secondary to, and in service of, image, but the characters are well defined and succeed in illuminating various aspects of the central theme. And, most importantly, Boyd honors the coal miners. Kudos to Daniel Boyd for giving them a Voice, and creating a wonderfully entertaining and fantastical journey in the process. Perhaps, like I am now compelled to do through this review, others who have been silent will now begin to speak."

- Joey Madia, New Mystics Reviews

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

" Boyd wrote the book (illustrated by Edi Guedes) to make a point — in dramatic, apocalyptic and cinematic fashion — about the real villains in the Environment vs. Economy battle. ... He (Boyd) is a native of West Virginia — you can hear it in his accent — and he loves the area and its people. But he sees the wool being pulled over their eyes by energy companies that are vilifying the government for its so-called “war on coal. Instead of adhering to Earth-friendly practices, he sees the coal companies as cloaking themselves in populist rhetoric, and deceptively switching the feud to one between the federal government and West Virginia residents who rely on coal for their livelihood."

- Guy D'Astolfo, The Vindicator (Youngstown, OH)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

with the Earth. And as the coal inferno spreads, Nathaniel Golliday and his
zealous lunatic fringe seize the reins of State government in the chaos of a
rapidly accelerating environmental disaster. Golliday declares himself governor
of West Virginia, and vows to subdue all those who would oppose him.
At the grimmest hour, Heat
and his band receive a command from the awakened God: “Go to the Burning
Spring. Make Red Salt.” God’s mystery is both riddle and signpost to the
promised land, and Heat must find the narrow path before twin evils descend on
him and his people and threaten to engulf the earth.
Golliday activates a private
army of underground militias to consolidate his power and eliminate Heat, but
in the meantime, the National Party descends on West Virginia. Their plan? To
eliminate Golliday and quench the inferno by deep drilling the largest fracking
operation in history.
As the clock ticks toward
Earth’s doomsday, the preservation of humankind depends on Heat Hatfield and the
small, brave band of coal miners he leads in this conclusion of the CARBON
series.
Like CARBON, the
sensational tale in SALT delivers excitement with a message: Entertainment with
purpose. More In-Depth Look at Your Perks:Space Preachers/ Chillers DVD:J.Q. Dickinson Jar of Gourmet Salt:  CARBON Graphic Novel:Red Salt DVD: Chillers Series (Book 1 and 2):America's Got Talent Winner Landau Eugene Murphy Jr. Back Stage Passes: (Check him out: www.landaumurphyjr.com)Check out the SALT's Prequel CARBON:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------BOOK
1: CARBON QUOTES

" The
collaborative effort of Daniel Boyd and Edi Guedes, "Carbon" is a
superbly illustrated graphic novel that while a fictional entertainment, brings
to bear some very real environmental issues and touches upon some very real
human conflicts. Exceptionally well written and presented from first page to
last, "Carbon" is very strongly recommended and rewarding
reading."
- The Midwest
Book Review
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
“Danny Boyd’s Carbon combines three
distinct genres- Lovecraftian gorefest, religious picture book and politicall
allegory- to tell the story of our slow and conscious self-poisoning.” 
–
John Sayles, from his introduction
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"This graphic
novel’s tale is a self-contained piece of world-building, loaded generously
with imaginative flair and yet still grounded in reality like the wise
Aesop born anew." 
- Richard Caldwell, Heavy Metal Magazine
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"With CARBON Boyd marries sci-fi monster flick ideas with Appalachian
tragedy, showing us imaginative allegory and authentic profundity do not have
to be mutually exclusive." 
- Chris Oxley, "Elston Gunn" of Ain't
It Cool News
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"CARBON reads like an H.P.
Lovecraft-influenced Robert E. Howard yarn updated for the age of mountain top
removal and hydrofracking. There is a message here, andBoyd and Guedes deliver it with a
mother lode of action and horror."

--Bob Calhoun, author of
"Shattering Conventions: Commerce, Cosplay and Conflict on the Expo
Floor" 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"In a world
overrun with second rate, copy-cat comic books, "Carbon" is a truly
unique graphic novel experience. Where a lot of comic books try to be
"cool" these days - "Carbon" is actuallyverycool! It's
a graphic novel that explores humanity's exploitative relationship with nature
that is heartfelt, intimate, and totally outrageous. - Scott
Marcano, graphic novelist, screenwriter of Bio-Dome and Sanitarium  
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"Faith can be a
cruel mistress. Faith in our community, our employers, our churches and our
leaders. Faith in ourselves especially. And while in these uncertain times
having faith in others can be difficult, the talent displayed by the creative
team here in a tale of very topical concerns is beyond any shadow of doubt.
CARBON is explicitly for those who want to believe."
-Dave
Elliott, Co-Founder/Co-Owner of ATOMEKA Press
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------“Carbon is outstanding.  A
great fantasy adventure wrapped in a tale of greed and corruption gone
haywire.  Highly recommended.” 
- Adam Hamdy, Writer/Filmmaker, The Hunter, Pulp
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"Filmmakers,
scholars, poets, authors, photographers, musicians and visual artists have used
their skills to explore what mountaintop removal coal mining does to mountain
communities and our life support system (water, land, air). Boyd’s
pulse-quickening Carbon is the first creative work in the
graphic novel medium to tackle this subject and it will inspire an entirely new
audience to join the movement to end mountaintop removal."- Vivian Stockman, Ohio Valley Environmental
Coalition 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"This gorgeously
illustrated, testosterone-torqued ride does nothing less than chronicle
the history of time from Genesis to Revelation. Boyd exposes the symbiotic
relationship between humans and the coal that may keep furnaces burning, create
jobs, and fill corporate coffers, but it could ultimately cost us not only the
Garden, but our very souls."​
-
Marie Manilla, author of "Shrapnel" and "The Patron Saint of
Ugly"------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"With spectacular allegorical style and
expressive artwork, Mr. Boyd's graphic novel shows the struggle of live carbon
(man) to deal with fossil carbon and the impacts to our earth. The
graphic novel "Carbon" shows the need to transition from carbon based
electricity to clean power. We hope that our political leaders heed the
warnings and implement policies that lead to a cleaner, healthier world."
 
- Bill Price, Sierra
Club Environmental Justice Program. 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
''Carbon' is a colorful,
fast-paced thriller that draws on an iconic Appalachian theme -- courageous
coal miners who fight forces of evil underground. The book is a great read,
and I look forward to the sequel!"  
- Tom
Rodd, Project Director, Friends of Blackwater------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------





“Danny Boyd’s CARBON is both horrifying and thoughtful, and is especially
  poignant for those with family or friends in the mining industry.”
- Mark Justice, author of "The Dead Sheriff" and
  "Looking At The World With Broken Glass In My Eye," and host of Pod
  of Horror
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------




"... he has
fashioned a spell-binding horror tale, a perfect vehicle for delivering the
goods on what often seems to those who live here a tale of injustice too
far-fetched to believe.  But you will believe CARBON.  Boyd is
compelling truth-teller – the blood and gore bear witness."
- Marc Harshman, Poet Laureate of West
Virginia------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
" Without
preaching, Boyd’s message seems clear: We the people endured the clear cutting
of our timber; sacrificed long term benefits for coal’s short term jobs---  jobs responsible for  contaminating water, soil, air, and often
wrecking the health of the employees. 
Jobs offered by irresponsible employers willing to ignore slurry dams
and pollution. Boyd is saying it loud and clear.  This book is fire in
the hole!"
- Phyllis
Wilson Moore, West Virginia Literary Historian 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"...
it is a masterpiece of action and adventure. This graphic novel provides unique
perspectives on all things; beginning at the true beginning: creation.
Compelling, genuine characters are relatable and unattainable. This cast
includes a bad-ass baseball player; the gruff, grizzled, yet essentially kind
mine workers, my personal favorite: the River Rat (aka as White Water River
Guide), and The Man (He Who Gets Rich From The Fruit of Their Labors). His
greed endangers the lives of his producers, yet he has no qualms. He
underestimates the miners.  Love, family,
friendship and community create a strong, unbreakable bond, thus turning
apparently ordinary folks into true, awe-inspiring heroes. 
My
fellow readers, if you seek something absolutely unlike anything you’ve read,
this is it."
- JV Poore,
Goodreads------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
" Like a carefully constructed film, Carbon’s dialogue is secondary to, and
in service of, image, but the characters are well defined and succeed in
illuminating various aspects of the central theme. And, most importantly, Boyd
honors the coal miners. Kudos to Daniel Boyd for giving them a Voice, and
creating a wonderfully entertaining and fantastical journey in the process.
Perhaps, like I am now compelled to do through this review, others who have
been silent will now begin to speak."
-
Joey Madia, New Mystics Reviews------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"
Boyd wrote the book (illustrated by Edi Guedes) to make a point — in dramatic,
apocalyptic and cinematic fashion — about the real villains in the Environment
vs. Economy battle. ... He (Boyd) is a native of West Virginia — you can hear
it in his accent — and he loves the area and its people. But he sees the wool
being pulled over their eyes by energy companies that are vilifying the
government for its so-called “war on coal. Instead of adhering to
Earth-friendly practices, he sees the coal companies as cloaking themselves in
populist rhetoric, and deceptively switching the feud to one between the
federal government and West Virginia residents who rely on coal for their
livelihood."
- Guy D'Astolfo,
The Vindicator (Youngstown, OH)------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

story:
Hi everyone!

Let us introduce you the universe "Ash".

Your acquaintance with the world of "Ash" will begin with the comic book "Butterfly" which consists of 5 chapters.

Today, we collect $ 30,000 to help us to continue the work on first issue of the series, as well as to release the print edition and to reward our backers.

The print edition would be available in 2 versions: 56 page paperback and 80 page hardcover with additional pages with concept art




The story

"Ash" universe has its origins in Mogoro - the "black iceberg", towering over the veil of snow storms. The silence of lifeless emptiness and deadly breathof devouring time surround the black city walls rising up into sky.

In times immemorial, the human civilization was destroyed by its own progress - the Great Explosion brought the epidemic and death to the planet, changing it beyond recognition.The remnants of humanity have created the project "Black Iceberg 1" - city surrounded by huge walls with perfect protection system.People locked themselves from the outside world and created conditions for a new mankind. 

Living a life by a new rules previously unknown to science changed once the "highest" stageof evolution - human. It affected mostly the inhabitants of poor areas of the Lower Town- the incidence of birth mutations increased among them. Eventually, mutants became part of thesociety, and later the line between them and other people has worn off. High society of Upper Town decided to build a wall between the upper and lower part of the residential areas, thereby not allowing sprawling the infection of mutation on its territory. Since then, the inhabitants of the upper city became known as "Pure". These days Lower Town is sinking into poverty and crime, life is exchanged for a mere pittance, death permeates the air, and red spots of blood congeal on the dirty snow of lonely streets. Faceless mass of so dissimilar creatures fights every day, without regrets and principles, for the right to live. Though there are those who do not agree to kill for a piece of bread, they have one choice - to work in factories, for the sake of "the good and prosperity" of society.

Upper Town hides behind its wall rich and so similar people - they control everything that happens Mogoro. Religion and the power of law - these are the tools of this caste of chosen. Temples, breeding the super humans, created the Order - the power and punishment of the true faith. Goddess of Light, who endowed with prophecies archbishop of the Church, gave birth to people in the time of her advent thousands of years ago. Cleansing from all sins by gaining faith in the Creator is the highest goal, and prophecies are the path to light and purity! Religion and power of Upper Town are the sources of life and the curse of Mogoro.

Young boy Lema and his sister Rita were born in the most dangerous part of the Lower Town ​​- District of Flowers. Once they witness an event that will change their lives andslightly open some secrets of the city Mogoro. What awaits them..?


We'd like to bring to your attention some pages of our graphic novel. Your acquaintance with the first part of the story begins with shots of the night city of Mogoro.

Lonely streets covered with blanket of dirty snow are witnessing events that introduce us to the main characters of the book.

The style of the novel includes many things that influenced the creativity of the author. Love of the French, Russian and Japanese animation and of American comics and science fiction of different times and authors formed a vision of the project. The experiment, which began two years ago, today was embodied in the pages that are presented by the author to your strict judgement. We hope that it will not leave you indifferent!


Alexander Gudkov - sponsor, marketing and advertising manager of the project. Without his help this campaign would be impossible.

Dmitry Klyushkin is the creator of "Ash'. In 2013, while working as concept artist for game company in Saint Petersburg, he started to think about creating some small personal project. With help from his fellow artist, he slowly began to work on general concept and idea and later started developing his own vision and style of future project. He also gained the ability to ignore the need for sleep. In 2014 Dmitry decided to leave his day job and returned to his small hometown on Sakhalin Island in Russian Far East. Work on this project helped him to open new creative horizons and opportunities. Since Dmitry works alone on his project, the path to his dream is difficult, but extremely interesting and rewarding.

The goal of our campaign is to raise minimum 30000$ to complete the production of first of the five chapters of "Butterfly" book of graphic novel "Ash".If campaign is successful, we'll use the print edition to gain the attention of publishers and animation studios and to open other possibilities for developing the project. We'll also certainly continue to work on other chapters.Project "Ash" is an attempt to prove that even two people are able to create a whole world with your support, because every idea becomes real for the sake of a dialogue between author and his reader, what is often forgotten these days.


For each episode and character we create concept art: environments, props, vehicles, character items and much more.  We create it for unique atmosphere of our story. Most of these materials you will be able to see in hardcover edition.




And of course we greatly appreciate any help!

If you like our project, tell your friends about us!

Links to the official group:

 https://www.facebook.com/ash.pepel

Since Dmitry works alone on his project, the path to his dream is difficult, but extremely interesting and rewarding.The goal of our campaign is to raise minimum 30000$ to complete the production of first of the five chapters of "Butterfly" book of graphic novel "Ash".If campaign is successful, we'll use the print edition to gain the attention of publishers and animation studios and to open other possibilities for developing the project. We'll also certainly continue to work on other chapters.Project "Ash" is an attempt to prove that even two people are able to create a whole world with your support, because every idea becomes real for the sake of a dialogue between author and his reader, what is often forgotten these days.
For each episode and character we create concept art: environments, props, vehicles, character items and much more.  We create it for unique atmosphere of our story. Most of these materials you will be able to see in hardcover edition.

 https://www.facebook.com/ash.pepel

story: For years I have spent creating, perfecting and collaborating on this project and now we are ready to bring it to life and print! With your help and support this will meet reality. The Unseen graphic novel is an epic tale of the battle that wages for us The Human race "The Sea of Souls". All forces good and evil battle it out till the apocalypse comes. From possessed serial killers to nuclear war, secret clone soldiers and New world order and those caught in between. This will leave you breathless and wanting more. The over all series contains 12 full books and 11 short illustrated interims to fill in the blanks. All written, illustrated, colored and text by me "Bryan Makana Revell". Please help me make my life long dream come true. My eternal gratitude for all your help. Please see the great rewards and a few lucky people may get a chance to be immortalized as a main character in the series, after that who knows. Personal note: This story comes from my life experiences, dreams and visions. I hope that you enjoy this story as it is my life. The characters are mainly based on real people and real experiences. This is my passion please help me make it a reality.

story:
Hello, I'm Vincent Ferrante, chronicler and custodian of the adventures of Witch Hunter. And publisher of Monarch Comics.

Witch Hunter's adventures started when I was eleven, although I was writing, drawing, and stapling together mini-comics since I was about five. That was also the time I realized I was pretty good at the writing, very good at the stapling, but not so very good at the drawing. Fast-forward past potty training, advanced potty training, puberty, a refresher course in potty training, and onto the Creative Writing Program at NYU. I was offered to take part in the program during what would have been the end of my senior year. I accepted, not just because it was a great opportunity and an honor, but because it meant another year of college and the postponement of reality. That is when Jon Redmont, aka Witch Hunter, started letting me in on things about his origin and his purpose which he had previously kept to himself. The Witch Hunter story that I wrote for the NYU Creative Writing program became the basis for the Witch Hunter comic book I eventually would publish after I graduated college...which, in fact, did happen, or so I'm told. (That last year was a lot of fun...and wee bit blurry.)

Anyway, an idea to publish Witch Hunter under a comic book company called Mass Exodus Comics was discarded when someone pointed out the name made it sound like everyone would be running away from me. So I changed the name to Dark Spire Publishing and I published the first Witch Hunter ashcan edition. It was a down-and-dirty version of his first adventure along with some sketches and an editorial welcome to Witch Hunter's new fans, the few that we had, other than my mom. I exhibited that year at an earlier version of the NY Comic Con, with a booth right near DC Comics. After that I began to promote Witch Hunter at other shows in the northeast U.S. while I gained publishing and promotion experience working at entertainment newspapers, magazines, and book publishers.

Then I met Lisa.

For all the people that believed in me, and I'm grateful to say that there were, and are, many...no one believed, and still believes in me more than Lisa. After we got married, she helped me start Monarch Comics and became my editor while I wrote and published issues of Witch Hunter. Which brings us pretty close to the now. I'm very grateful to have business and creative partners like Nicholas Blake Seals, Phil Avelli, Hunter McFalls, Alfred Accettura, Joe Kitchell, and Matt Herring. Through self-promotion, and more than just a little bit of money, we've gotten more than a few people to get to know Monarch Comics and our small, fun line of titles, including Evil Monkey Man, Horror Island, The Last, Monarch Comics Chronicles, and, of course, Witch Hunter, plus novels like Monkey See, Sea Monkey, and non-fiction titles like The Unofficial Doctor Who Companion. As you've likely already guessed, this has all built up to the part where I say that we need help to expand our circulation and grow our business through a crowd-funding campaign. Our plea is in the next, and last, paragraph. I promise.

This campaign is to fund a new print run of Witch Hunter #1, revised and expanded, for the purpose of reaching new fans at this year's New York Comic Con and fulfilling orders through our new website, as well as real stores that you will start to see our titles popping up in. We've included a lot of incentive tiers with lots of ways we're saying thank you for your support. You can never go wrong when you do what you love, and I love Witch Hunter. It's a story of people not believing in magic, or in their own potential, and thereby having that magic stolen from them by others who seek to use its power for their own nefarious purposes...to turn the world into their vision instead of each of ours. It's about the elder races that used to live here, like elves, dwarves, goblins, and dragon folk, who want to take the world back from humanity because we don't appreciate it. It's about evil witches siphoning our magic every time we buy a product, watch any form of media, or vote for one of their candidates, and giving that magic to the elder races to reshape the world into an earlier, pre-human state, after taking a magical cut for themselves, of course. Our hero, Witch Hunter, himself a good witch, attempts to save humanity from the evil witches, and from itself. Using his diverse skill set and a healthy dose of irreverence (which anyone who knows Dean from Supernatural will appreciate) Witch Hunter battles the Scarlet Circle through time, space, and dimension...and when all else fails, he simply blows things up, or sets them on fire, which is what makes comics so cool. That's why our motto at Monarch Comics is "comic books the way they're supposed to be...fun." We're very grateful to supporters of our previous campaign for Evil Monkey Man, and hope you see more of what you love in Witch Hunter. If you do, please tell your friends, family, and people on the street to support Witch Hunter, and share the campaign on social media. Thanks for reading.

story: I am seeking funds to produce a regular monthly comic series and novels featuring the adventures of Monster Hunters Inc. We already have distribution. These costs would go towards hiring talent and production staff.
story_txt: I am seeking funds to produce a regular monthly comic series and novels featuring the adventures of Monster Hunters Inc. We already have distribution. These costs would go towards hiring talent and production staff.

story:
Cosmic Odyssey

I'm not going to ask you for anymore then a dollar, slightly more then the price of a coke to help rebuild Cosmic Odyssey.

  • We are all Cosmic Odyssey, a place were people gather and enjoy life.
  • As you all know we were closed for a time due to how sick I became and while I'm doing better, I'm not doing as well as I'd like to be, nor even pretend to be . So I'm trying to put together enough funding to expand and become even better, for all of you.
  • I'll rebuild our store from the ground up and push us ever bigger and better, until I no longer can.

My time with you is nearly done but Cosmic Odyssey will always be with you.

To do this we need funding

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We'll be doing roughly 75% of everything as product, 25% to various other odds and ends.
  • As always Cosmic Odyssey, is a community as well as a business so let's grow both together.
  • Even if I don't reach my goal every dollar will be split 75% 25% to build the business.

Growth

Your contribution will help grow not just Cosmic Odyssey but the card game community as well as we reach out to you new customers.

  • I'm just a small business looking to get bigger and to help my customers while doing so.
  • You all know I built Cosmic Odyssey from The ashes of old Odyssey, We'll keep growing and rebuilding until everything is great.

Health

Those of you who know what happened to me know what happened.

  • I'm fairly certain I'm running out of time.
  • So I want to grow the store bigger then ever while I have the time so it is always here for you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford the price of a coke, you can always pass this along to those who can

  • I'm not asking for much just a dollar from everyone.
  • Please pass this along to everyone you know I'm not asking for much.

story:
Introduction

Hi, everyone! My name is Rachel Roth and I'm the creator/ writer of Bait and Switch: The Comic. I've been writing for years, primarily screen writing that includes original features, pilots, and spec scripts. I'm now venturing into comic book writing with Bait and Switch. Additionally, I'm currently writing a LGBTQ fantasy novel with a friend and we're hoping to get is published on Amazon. 

This campaign is to create the very first issue of Bait and Switch: The Comic. This campaign is so that I can pay my incredible team: my artist, Corinne Schipull and my colorist, Erica Ostrowski.  As it stands now, we have the bare bones of the comic. This means that all the thumbnails have been completed and now all that's left is adding meat to the bones i.e. coloring and finalized art. 

Not only is it for them but it's for me as well. I've been working on Bait and Switch for almost a decade and this is the closest it's ever been to becoming a reality. 

If you all invest, not only will you help me achieve a decade long dream but you will be part of something that could have future potential for more. A new era of comics. A new comic book world that has endless potential for new characters, new stories, and more comics. 

 

The Project

For this project we are looking to make $8,000. The money is strictly going to my team. Too many feel that artists should do work for free but being one myself, I know how hard it is to make ends meet. So this indiegogo is for them. At the end of making this full comic, we intend to send it out to publishers and have a real comic that can be sold in stores. The hope is to continue making Bait and Switch: The Comic full time and have it become our full time jobs.

Now, the perks; our goal is to raise $8,000. If you donate to our cause you get early access to our bi-weekly updates. Watch for panels, line art, character sketches, the whole ten yards before anyone else. Next on our list of goodies, you guys will get a  piece of preliminary line art created by our artist, Corinne Schipull. For a little extra you could get one of those preliminary sketches colored by our colorist, Erica Ostrowski. Next on our list of amazing things, you can get a set of the original thumbnails of the comic.

The following perks are affected by how much we make in order for you to receive them.

***See our perks for the specific details.***

With your donations, we are able to give you bigger and better perks: Our first one would be the first three pages of the comic before anyone else! See what full colored pages will look like and what your money is truly going towards. The next gift you can receive with your donation is the complete comic in e-book form before the masses can even get their hands on it. Lastly, our gift to you for our last donation is a physical copy of the first edition of Bait and Switch: The Comic signed by the entire team. These all give you a chance to be a part of history. A part of something that has the potential to be so much more than any other comic. 

Regardless of what we make, the funds still go to my team. They are the ones who can make this possible along with you guys. So, give these girls an opportunity to do what they're passionate about. Give them the opportunity to jump start their careers with this comic. 

 

Stretch Goals:

- $300: Gets a complete Cover of the first Issue

- $900: Gets the first three pages complete: coloring and lineart

- $1,800: Gets us the 6 completed pages we need to pitch to publishers

- $3,300: Comic gets full line art

- $6,600: Comic gets full coloring

- $7,000: Complete Comic

 

Our Girls: Bait and Switch

Bait is a Harley Quinn/ Deadpool hybrid. She is energetic and silly. Bait also totally doesn't take the whole 'villain' role seriously despite their thievery. A master of disguise who literally has to change before and during missions in order for them to be successful and to get SOME notoriety as Bait. She also has two other personalities other than the 'Bait' visage. One of her personalities is Grace. She's a four year old who has been trying to take over the vessel of Sabrina for years but has never succeeded. However, now she has a hidden partner willing to help her gain control of the body. Then you have Trucker Dave, a pervy caricature of her late father. He keeps Grace in check and looks out for her. He also has a keen sense of humor and is more adult than the two ladies despite his own perversions. Bait herself, is also a personality. The three combined create their true identity known as Sabrina.  

Switch is a tech genius who creates all her own weapons and ALWAYS forgets to charge them despite what she says about having done so. Her brother was abducted by aliens as a kid and since then her mother has become a hover parent. As she grows older she begins to despise her mother AND gets entangled with the unknown entity, The Nightmare. He begins to blackmail her by telling her that if she doesn't get what he wants, he'll kill her brother with whom he is in possession of.  Switch is down to earth and very serious which compliments her and Bait.  Not only does she have The Nightmare to worry about but her ex-girlfriend who is now a superhero with The Consortium of Heroes. 

 

The Impact

Why ISN'T this project valuable to you and the world?

Let me break it down for you, this comic is about women for women by women (as is says in the video). But it's not just that, it's got a diverse cast of characters representing the LGBTQ community (Switch, for example, is a young Black woman who's ex is a female superhero). But she's not the only one. Later in the comic, we explore the character of Crimson Harbor. She's a trans superhero who used to be the head of the superhero group: The Consortium of Heroes. Not only that but we're shattering body shaming for men and women.  Not all of our characters are stereotypically good looking but are still adored by their fans. Looks don't matter; it's the amount of good you do to help people that makes them a hero or a villain. Along with such, our main character Bait deals with dissociative identity disorder, dealing with the taboo subject of mental disorders. BUT in the comic, SHE IS NOT HER MENTAL DISORDER. She is simply her.  This comic is meant to bring hope to those who don't have it, hope to those who fight everyday for who they are, hope to those who are lost. That's what makes this different than other comics and this is what your money will be helping towards. 

In times past, for this particular project I have shot a live action Bait and Switch teaser trailers. I have also had the pleasure of working with the late Stan Lee and Kevin Smith on another project with Legion M.

 

Risks & Challenges

Our primary challenge right now is getting the money to produce said comic. We need to get money for parcel and printing (eventually). 

The indiegogo is step one. This enables us to create this as our pitch packet and gets us to a place were we can start pitching it to publishers. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tweet, share, like, subscribe! Your voice will make a difference whether this gets made or not. So share this like your life depended on it and let your voice be heard! <3 Thanks so much! 

Here are our social media handles! Help us spread the word and watch for updates! :) 

Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/BaitandSwitchTheComic

Twitter:  @Baitandswitch3

Instagram:  baitandswitchthecomic

story:
نول للكتب هي دار نشر مستقلة تأسست في القاهرة عام 2018 . مهمة نول الأساسية هي نشر وترجمة القصص المصورة والمانجا والمساهمة في تطوير سوق القصص المصورة في العالم العربي.

قيمنا الرئيسية هي الجودة والتنوع، أدبيًا وفنيًا ومضمونًا، نعمل على ترجمة  ونشر قصص مصورة، ضمن إطار هذه القيم، من جميع أنحاء العالم وتقديمها للقارئ العربي. كذلك فإن دعم  المبدعين العرب، خاصة الشباب منهم، هو جزء مهم من خطتنا، لذا نطمح لدعم وتمويل أكبر مجموعة ممكنة مع تزويدهم بالإمكانيات و الفرص التي تتيح لهم التطور والوصول لأعلى المستويات الفنية.

نطمح أيضًا لأن تكون لنا بصمة في المشهد الثقافي والاجتماعي العربي بالمستقبل القريب، وأن يصبح مقرنا بالقاهرة مساحة مشتركة للمبدعين لإقامة ورش وتجمعات أدبية و فنية، ومعارض، ونوادٍ للكتب. كما يعمل قسم التحرير الخاص بنا خلال أيام الأسبوع لدعم الكٌتاب الشباب.

 

هذه حملة طلب مسبق

نحن نقدم لك الفرصة لشراء إصدار محدود خاص من واحد أو العديد من كتبنا الأربع الأولى التي ستنشر قبل توافرها بالمكتبات من خلال طلب الكتب مسبقاً ، فأنت لا تشتريها فقط ، بل أنت أيضاً تدعم دار نشر مستقلة و تشارك في مبادرة جديدة لتطوير ثقافة الكوميكس في المنطقة العربية.

هذه ليست حملة لتمويل ما أو لجمع تبرعات ، ولكنها حملة للحجز المسبق. في نول للكتب رأينا أن نقدم الفرصة لمحبي الكوميكس لشراء كتاب  أكثر من كتبنا الخمسة الأولى التي ستكون متاحة حصريا هنا قبل الإصدار الرسمي. هذه الطبعة الخاصة ستكون موقعة من كاتب أو رسام العمل.

Why participate in this campaign?

This is a pre-order campaign. This means that we offer you the opportunity to buy a special limited and signed edition of one or many of our first four books to be published before the official release. By pre-ordering books, you are not only buying them, but you are also supporting a young independent publishing house and taking part to a new initiative and development of the Comics culture in the Arab region.

تعرف على عناويننا

تحتوي مجموعتنا الأولى على أريعة كتب / روايات مصورة باللغة العربية ، مترجمة من الإيطالية والفرنسية والهولندية والإنجليزية.  تستغل هذه الإصدارات الإمكانيات الأدبية والبصرية لفن الرواية المصورة بشكل كامل

Get to know our titles

Our first collection contains four graphic novels in arabic, translated from Italian, French, Dutch, and English, in addition to one original Arabic work. We chose works that take full advantage of the medium’s potential, both as a visual and literary experience.

 

الخالدية .. الرواية المرسومة

موظف حكومي اخترع مدينة أسماها الخالدية في السجلات الحكومية كي يتسنى له جمع مرتبات و مصروفات المدينة من ضرائب و مصاريف قوة الشرطة الخيالية. قام الموظف ببناء المدينة من الطمي بغرفته لمجارة تخيلاته  وبدأ باختلاق انتفاضات محلية لزيادة مصروفات الشرطة. هذه الحبكة تحمل الكثير من النقد اللاذع للبيروقراطية الحكومية. صدرت الرواية بالهولندية قبل أيام من 25 يناير2011

“EL Khaldiya ”, Art and scenario by Milan Hulsing. Story by Mohamed El-Bisatie

A man invented the city of Khaldiya in order to collect the salaries of an imaginary local police force. He produces fake documents and builds the city out of clay in his own home, as a realistic depiction of his own imaginings. He maximizes expense claims by inventing rebellions that need to be crushed by the police - violently, of course. This twist lends the story a political charge and enables the storyteller to criticize police corruption, detailing a time when the police were either bullying citizens, or in a brothel. The graphic novel was published in Dutch during the beginning of the Arab Spring, a few days before the uprising in Tahrir Square began.

------

كولترآين .. رواية مرسومة

نشأ جون كولترين كطفل فقير بكارولينا الشمالية، وأصبح أحد أعظم عازفي الجاز في التاريخ. موهبته و روحه التجريبية كتبا بداية عصر جديد للموسيقى. كولترين و فرقته الرباعية عزفوا موسيقى تجريبية عبرت عن حالة جديدة. أحد أعظم أعمالهم ألبومات  “My Favorite Things” و “A Love Supreme”. حياة كولترين ليست فقط قصة فنان عبقري، هي أيضا قصة أحداث سياسية واجتماعية شكلت وعي الفنان و جعلته أحد أكثر الموسيقين تأثيراً

“Coltrane” by Paolo Parisi 

John Coltrane rose from a hard and impoverished childhood in North Carolina to become one of the greatest jazz musicians of all time, whose talent for experimentation initiated a new movement in music. Coltrane and his quartet created some of the most innovative and expressive music of the era, including the hit albums “My Favorite Things” and “A Love Supreme”. “Coltrane” evokes an extraordinary life and the momentous historical events that formed its backdrop. A testament to a pioneer and a legend, whose music continues to inspire to this day.

------
 القاهرة طبعة تانية .. كتاب مصور
 

 

“Cairo Blues” by Pino Creanza

“Cairo Blues” details step by step and in a relevant way the events which took place in Egypt from 2008 to 2011, gradually dismantling the situation that led the Egyptians to revolt. First, the "history of sex, money and death", a murderous, erotic-politico-financial event, which splatters an Egyptian magnate, politically important and closely linked to the family in power. We are then very far from the daily concerns of the people, poor and busy sorting rubbish, which nests in the City of the Dead. 

 

“القاهرة طبعة تانية” يستكشف خطوة بخطوة الأحداث في مصر منذ عام 2008 إلى 2011 ويبحث عن الأسباب التي أدت إلى الإنتفاض. أولاً "تاريخ الجنس والمال والموت" جريمة قتل بها ما يكفي من الفضائح الجنسية والمغازي السياسية والإقتصادية لتلطيخ سمعة أحد "الحيتان" المقربين للنظام السابق. هذه الأحداث تقع على خلفية من الفقراء المشغولين بجمع القمامة في مدينة الموتى "مساكن الزلزال بـ هضبة المقطم ب شرق القاهرة.

--------
يلا باي .. بحرب ال 2006 
رواية مصورة

تمّوز 2006. يودّع غابريئيل الشوادي أبناء عائلته في مطار باريس عند رحيلهم إلى جنوب لبنان لقضاء عطلة الصّيف، ولكن، يتحول قتال على الحدود ما بين إسرائيل ولبنان إلى هجوم جوّيّ، وحرب. تختبئ العائلة في الأسابيع المروّعة التالية مع بعض الأصدقاء وأبناء العائلة، وتراقب عاجزة كيف يتم تدمير الأشخاص والبنايات من حولها، وتتأمّل، بعكس كل التوقّعات، بأن يتم إخلاؤها من قِبَل فرنسا بأمان. أما في باريس، فيتابع غابريئيل الأحداث وهي تتكشّف أمامه على شاشة التلفزيون ويتزايد الرعب في نفسه، ويقوم باتّصالات يائسة طالبًا المساعدة من كل من كان مستعدًا لأن يسمعه.


“Yalla Bye” by Joseph Safieddine and Kyungeun Park 

July 2006. When a conflict at the Israel-Lebanon border escalates into a full-blown aerial attack, Gabriel El Chawadi’s family has to hide. As they are witnessing people and buildings being destroyed all around them, they desperately keep hoping that France will evacuate them to safety. Staid in Paris, Gabriel follows the news on TV and sends out desperate calls for help to anyone who would listen.
story_txt: نول للكتب هي دار نشر مستقلة تأسست في القاهرة عام 2018 . مهمة نول الأساسية هي نشر وترجمة القصص المصورة والمانجا والمساهمة في تطوير سوق القصص المصورة في العالم العربي.قيمنا الرئيسية هي الجودة والتنوع، أدبيًا وفنيًا ومضمونًا، نعمل على ترجمة  ونشر قصص مصورة، ضمن إطار هذه القيم، من جميع أنحاء العالم وتقديمها للقارئ العربي. كذلك فإن دعم  المبدعين العرب، خاصة الشباب منهم، هو جزء مهم من خطتنا، لذا نطمح لدعم وتمويل أكبر مجموعة ممكنة مع تزويدهم بالإمكانيات و الفرص التي تتيح لهم التطور والوصول لأعلى المستويات الفنية.نطمح أيضًا لأن تكون لنا بصمة في المشهد الثقافي والاجتماعي العربي بالمستقبل القريب، وأن يصبح مقرنا بالقاهرة مساحة مشتركة للمبدعين لإقامة ورش وتجمعات أدبية و فنية، ومعارض، ونوادٍ للكتب. كما يعمل قسم التحرير الخاص بنا خلال أيام الأسبوع لدعم الكٌتاب الشباب. هذه حملة طلب مسبقنحن نقدم لك الفرصة لشراء إصدار محدود خاص من واحد أو العديد من كتبنا الأربع الأولى التي ستنشر قبل توافرها بالمكتبات من خلال طلب الكتب مسبقاً ، فأنت لا تشتريها فقط ، بل أنت أيضاً تدعم دار نشر مستقلة و تشارك في مبادرة جديدة لتطوير ثقافة الكوميكس في المنطقة العربية.هذه ليست حملة لتمويل ما أو لجمع تبرعات ، ولكنها حملة للحجز المسبق. في نول للكتب رأينا أن نقدم الفرصة لمحبي الكوميكس لشراء كتاب  أكثر من كتبنا الخمسة الأولى التي ستكون متاحة حصريا هنا قبل الإصدار الرسمي. هذه الطبعة الخاصة ستكون موقعة من كاتب أو رسام العمل.Why participate in this campaign?This is a pre-order campaign. This means that we offer you the opportunity to buy a special limited and signed edition of one or many of our first four books to be published before the official release. By pre-ordering books, you are not only buying them, but you are also supporting a young independent publishing house and taking part to a new initiative and development of the Comics culture in the Arab region.تعرف على عناوينناتحتوي مجموعتنا الأولى على أريعة كتب / روايات مصورة باللغة العربية ، مترجمة من الإيطالية والفرنسية والهولندية والإنجليزية.  تستغل هذه الإصدارات الإمكانيات الأدبية والبصرية لفن الرواية المصورة بشكل كاملGet to know our titlesOur first collection contains four graphic novels in arabic, translated from Italian, French, Dutch, and English, in addition to one original Arabic work. We chose works that take full advantage of the medium’s potential, both as a visual and literary experience. الخالدية .. الرواية المرسومةموظف حكومي اخترع مدينة أسماها الخالدية في السجلات الحكومية كي يتسنى له جمع مرتبات و مصروفات المدينة من ضرائب و مصاريف قوة الشرطة الخيالية. قام الموظف ببناء المدينة من الطمي بغرفته لمجارة تخيلاته  وبدأ باختلاق انتفاضات محلية لزيادة مصروفات الشرطة. هذه الحبكة تحمل الكثير من النقد اللاذع للبيروقراطية الحكومية. صدرت الرواية بالهولندية قبل أيام من 25 يناير2011“EL Khaldiya ”, Art and scenario by Milan Hulsing. Story by Mohamed El-BisatieA man invented the city of Khaldiya in order to collect the salaries of an imaginary local police force. He produces fake documents and builds the city out of clay in his own home, as a realistic depiction of his own imaginings. He maximizes expense claims by inventing rebellions that need to be crushed by the police - violently, of course. This twist lends the story a political charge and enables the storyteller to criticize police corruption, detailing a time when the police were either bullying citizens, or in a brothel. The graphic novel was published in Dutch during the beginning of the Arab Spring, a few days before the uprising in Tahrir Square began.------كولترآين .. رواية مرسومةنشأ جون كولترين كطفل فقير بكارولينا الشمالية، وأصبح أحد أعظم عازفي الجاز في التاريخ. موهبته و روحه التجريبية كتبا بداية عصر جديد للموسيقى. كولترين و فرقته الرباعية عزفوا موسيقى تجريبية عبرت عن حالة جديدة. أحد أعظم أعمالهم ألبومات  “My Favorite Things” و “A Love Supreme”. حياة كولترين ليست فقط قصة فنان عبقري، هي أيضا قصة أحداث سياسية واجتماعية شكلت وعي الفنان و جعلته أحد أكثر الموسيقين تأثيراً“Coltrane” by Paolo Parisi John Coltrane rose from a hard and impoverished childhood in North Carolina to become one of the greatest jazz musicians of all time, whose talent for experimentation initiated a new movement in music. Coltrane and his quartet created some of the most innovative and expressive music of the era, including the hit albums “My Favorite Things” and “A Love Supreme”. “Coltrane” evokes an extraordinary life and the momentous historical events that formed its backdrop. A testament to a pioneer and a legend, whose music continues to inspire to this day.------ القاهرة طبعة تانية .. كتاب مصور  “Cairo Blues” by Pino Creanza“Cairo Blues” details step by step and in a relevant way the events which took place in Egypt from 2008 to 2011, gradually dismantling the situation that led the Egyptians to revolt. First, the "history of sex, money and death", a murderous, erotic-politico-financial event, which splatters an Egyptian magnate, politically important and closely linked to the family in power. We are then very far from the daily concerns of the people, poor and busy sorting rubbish, which nests in the City of the Dead.  “القاهرة طبعة تانية” يستكشف خطوة بخطوة الأحداث في مصر منذ عام 2008 إلى 2011 ويبحث عن الأسباب التي أدت إلى الإنتفاض. أولاً "تاريخ الجنس والمال والموت" جريمة قتل بها ما يكفي من الفضائح الجنسية والمغازي السياسية والإقتصادية لتلطيخ سمعة أحد "الحيتان" المقربين للنظام السابق. هذه الأحداث تقع على خلفية من الفقراء المشغولين بجمع القمامة في مدينة الموتى "مساكن الزلزال بـ هضبة المقطم ب شرق القاهرة.--------يلا باي .. بحرب ال 2006 رواية مصورةتمّوز 2006. يودّع غابريئيل الشوادي أبناء عائلته في مطار باريس عند رحيلهم إلى جنوب لبنان لقضاء عطلة الصّيف، ولكن، يتحول قتال على الحدود ما بين إسرائيل ولبنان إلى هجوم جوّيّ، وحرب. تختبئ العائلة في الأسابيع المروّعة التالية مع بعض الأصدقاء وأبناء العائلة، وتراقب عاجزة كيف يتم تدمير الأشخاص والبنايات من حولها، وتتأمّل، بعكس كل التوقّعات، بأن يتم إخلاؤها من قِبَل فرنسا بأمان. أما في باريس، فيتابع غابريئيل الأحداث وهي تتكشّف أمامه على شاشة التلفزيون ويتزايد الرعب في نفسه، ويقوم باتّصالات يائسة طالبًا المساعدة من كل من كان مستعدًا لأن يسمعه.“Yalla Bye” by Joseph Safieddine and Kyungeun Park July 2006. When a conflict at the Israel-Lebanon border escalates into a full-blown aerial attack, Gabriel El Chawadi’s family has to hide. As they are witnessing people and buildings being destroyed all around them, they desperately keep hoping that France will evacuate them to safety. Staid in Paris, Gabriel follows the news on TV and sends out desperate calls for help to anyone who would listen.

story:
We're looking to build the following features into the http://karijokie.com website:

  • A vast catalogue of quality jokes licensed from joke book authors and comedians
  • State-of-the-art  joke organizing capabilities that let you create new routines based on keywords
  • Meetup-style Kari-Jokie clubs that connect with social media to build membership and organize fun local parties and comedy events
  • A MyJokes member page that lets you create your own custom routines and keep track of your activities in events, performances, contests, etc. 
  • K-J Pickup Lines, a singles app that interfaces with established dating sites
  • Premium features like access to video clips and inside scoops from “Kari-Jokie, the Movie,” the reality TV game show “Kari-Joke*STAR*, fun contests, promotional campaigns, etc.

Vision & Budget

Product testing of Kari-Jokie has shown how much it can bring a gathering to life, even when party-goers aren't drunk (the true test). Because it’s web-based, the growth possibilities of Kari-Jokie are almost limitless. From our launching pad in San Diego, Kari-Jokie home parties and public events will spread across the country and around the world, with the website expanding into different comic tastes and worldviews as well as different languages and cultures.

Here’s the launch budget:

WEBSITE DESIGN & DEVELOPMENT                      $12,000

PROMO VIDEO EQUIPMENT & CREW                       $5000

SPACE FOR ONGOING SHOOTS & EVENTS           $2500

EVENT PLANNING & ORGANIZING                           $1000

LICENSING SUCCESSFUL JOKE BOOKS                $5000

PUBLICITY & SOCIAL MEDIA MANAGEMENT       $2500

SUNDRY EXPENSES                                                       $1000

                                                                                          ____________

TOTAL BUDGET:                                                            $30,000

Kari-Jokie Perks

Thanks so much for your interest in our fun business venture! Our Kari-Jokie perks make great holiday gifts (or make it a gift to yourself!):

Level 1 – Joker - $5 – Three months of free membership to the Kari-Jokie website ($11.97 value) plus a personal thank-you email from founder Karl Weiss (priceless)

Level 2 – Jester - $15 – Nine months of free membership to the Kari-Jokie website ($35.91 value) plus a personal thank-you email from founder Karl Weiss, and special thanks in credits of movie (valueless)

Level 3 – Clown - $25 – One year of free membership to the Kari-Jokie website ($47.88 value) plus personal thank-you email from founder Karl Weiss, special thanks in credits of movie, genuine Kari-Jokie stickers, and fun outtake videos (worthless)

 

Level 4 – Fool - $50 – 18 months of free membership to the Kari-Jokie website ($71.82 value) plus personal thank-you email from founder Karl Weiss, special thanks in credits of movie, fun outtake videos, genuine Kari-Jokie stickers, and one-month free pass to K-J events (a complete waste of time)

Level 5 – Knave - $100 – Two years of free membership to the Kari-Jokie website ($96.76 value), three months of exclusive membership to the premium website ($39.98 value) plus official Kari-Jokie laptop stand ($29.99 value), personal thank-you email from founder Karl Weiss, special thanks in credits of movie, fun outtake videos, Google Hangout with creators, actors, and three-month free pass to K-J events (highly damaging)

                          

Level 6 - Wag - $250 – Two years of exclusive membership to the premium Kari-Jokie website ($479.76 value) plus official Kari-Jokie microphone with scroll speed adjustment and comic sound effect buttons ($49.99 value), official Kari-Jokie laptop stand ($29.99 value), personal thank-you email from founder Karl Weiss, special thanks in credits of movie, official K-J rubber chicken, fun outtake videos, Google Hangout with creators, actors, six-months free pass to K-J events (probably fatal)

And Finally...

We’re expecting to build up the membership base quickly to get the Kari-Jokie clubs and K-J Pickup Lines up and running, but in the meantime K-J clubs will be hosted by Meetup.com and Pickup Lines will partner with established dating sites. Outreach is crucial, so even if you can’t afford much (or any) financial assistance, you can still help a lot by putting out the word to your network of friends. And PLEASE use the Indiegogo share tools!

Here's a video of the website in action: https://www.youtube.com/edit?o=U&video_id=W...

story:
Aloha!


We are Katie Norris and Sinead Parker and we met seven years ago on the BA Hons Charades (Acting) course at The Manchester Met School of Theatre. 

We discovered we shared a birthday (26th February) and an affinity for nudity, wine and eighties music which eventually led to us creating our comedy double act….Norris & Parker. 


We write and perform original comedy and this summer we are taking our BRAND NEW show to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival. 

'See You At The Gallows' is a sordid soiree full of wild, dark and ridiculous sketches, characters and songs woven within a narrative of underlying aggression between ourselves.

We're delighted to be performing at the Pleasance Courtyard at the ungodly hour of 10.45pm for the whole of August.


We’ve been working with the hugely talented actor and musician, Chris Thomson to create original music for the show. Steve Hall has been brought in to direct. He was one third of We Are Klang (nominated for the Edinburgh Comedy Award in 2006.) He directed Pappy’s Comedy Award nominated show in 2007. 

 As 'Norris & Parker' we have written and performed shows at the Manchester, Camden & Edinburgh Fringe Festivals to sell out audiences and great reviews.

***** THE SKINNY

***** THE REVIEWS HUB

***** TUSK JOURNAL

***** THE GOOD REVIEW

**** WHATSONSTAGE

**** BROADWAY BABY

Last year’s show 'All Our Friends Are Dead' was a word of mouth hit at Just The Tonic at the Caves. Since then we have signed with Christian Knowles Management who represent various comedy legends like Mickey Flannagan, Zoe Lyons and Gary Delaney. We've made the big move to London seeking fame, fortune and reasonably priced rent and have been gigging on the comedy circuit ever since. 


We've also had the opportunity to forge creative links with Hull Truck Theatre by becoming Supported Artists and performing All Our Friends Are Dead as part of their theatre programme. 

So after an exciting year we're ready to head up to Edinburgh again and to give you an idea of our costs, here are our open books...

Venue Deposit- 420 pounds

Accomodation- 2500 pounds

Fringe registration- 295 pounds

Pleasance Joint Venue Brochure - 600 pounds

Production Fee - 3000 pounds

PR - 2500 pounds

Advertising, Marketing, Publicity - 923 pounds

Flyer and poster design & printing-  610 pounds

Flyering team - 840 pounds

Public Liability Insurance/PRS - 50 pounds

Costume, Props (Quiche, moustaches and catsuits)- 200 pounds

Travel and van hire- 300 pounds

The simple joy of making people laugh - Priceless (lies)

We have huge ambitions to move into TV and Radio and believe this years trip to Edinburgh could build upon our growing reputation, cult status and modesty. 

Which is why we're specifically crowd funding for the cost of hiring a PR Manager in order to achieve these ambitions.

Having PR means drinking espresso martinis in The Groucho Club but more importantly, getting our name out in the press. This includes listings, interviews and reviews in national newspapers and magazines. Already, we can see the difference of having PR and have secured several interviews in some brilliant publications.

We are financing Edinburgh ourselves by working various jobs and abstaining from social activities of any kind. Norris flips crepes and serves babycinos to Shepherds Bush (Chez Bu) yummy mummies. Parker pulls over-priced pints and supervises small children (despite not having a CRB) only joking, she's not a nonce but she is a drunk.


The work we do as Norris & Parker means everything to us as it gives us artistic fulfilment and creative control of our careers. If you are able to donate then thank you so much as it really will make a difference. 

It will mean that Parker can keep her kidneys and Norris can keep her virginity.

 If not then thank you for reading and please spread the word about the show!

'See You At The Gallows' is on at The Pleasance Courtyard (The Attic) at 10.45pm (3-28th August, except 21st)

And to leave on an inspirational quote from a great man;

"I didn't get where I was through talent alone, I got there through sheer hard work." - Charlie Parker 2012


Thanks Sinead's Dad, Thanks everyone.

Loads of love,

Norris & Parker

xxx

story:
We loved this manuscript from the minute we finished reading the first page! The Adventures of Snider the Spider by renowned author, John Taylor Gatto, is a fabulously funny rhyme about a spider, who is a big dreamer and has a fantastic plan for his life, which includes becoming a CIA spy. The narrative is rich with all the components that make a story great: interesting characters, humor, morals, and life lessons, plus it is a great teacher of language skills, too. The book is also rich with illustrations by internationally acclaimed artist, Anne Yvonne Gilbert. 

The major Snider funding we need help with are for the illustrator and publishing costs. The illustrator's fee is $15,000 and the publishing cost will be approximately $15,000. Our goal for this fundraiser is $30,000. The book is approximately 6 X 9 and 150 pages...full of many lively, unforgettable illustrations. 

For those unfamiliar with John Taylor Gatto, he was a New York city teacher, who won the New York state teacher's award several times before he wrote an op-ed to the Wall Street Journal titled, "I Quit, I think." He did quit because he had discovered, through researching the history of modern education, that schools were not the best place to educate children. John's personal story and his published books are fascinating and known around the world. To learn more about John's work, please visit his website:  www.johntaylorgatto.com.

This comic rhyme, though very different from anything John has done before, is equally brilliant and will be a fantastic contribution to any place where children's books are found. We eagerly invite you to join us in this project by helping with The Adventures of Snider the Spider campaign! And, please pass this on to your friends!
story_txt:
We loved this manuscript from the minute we finished reading the first page! The Adventures of Snider the Spider by renowned author, John Taylor Gatto, is a fabulously funny rhyme about a spider, who is a big dreamer and has a fantastic plan for his life, which includes becoming a CIA spy. The narrative is rich with all the components that make a story great: interesting characters, humor, morals, and life lessons, plus it is a great teacher of language skills, too. The book is also rich with illustrations by internationally acclaimed artist, Anne Yvonne Gilbert. 

The major Snider funding we need help with are for the illustrator and publishing costs. The illustrator's fee is $15,000 and the publishing cost will be approximately $15,000. Our goal for this fundraiser is $30,000. The book is approximately 6 X 9 and 150 pages...full of many lively, unforgettable illustrations. For those unfamiliar with John Taylor Gatto, he was a New York city teacher, who won the New York state teacher's award several times before he wrote an op-ed to the Wall Street Journal titled, "I Quit, I think." He did quit because he had discovered, through researching the history of modern education, that schools were not the best place to educate children. John's personal story and his published books are fascinating and known around the world. To learn more about John's work, please visit his website:  www.johntaylorgatto.com.
This comic rhyme, though very different from anything John has done before, is equally brilliant and will be a fantastic contribution to any place where children's books are found. We eagerly invite you to join us in this project by helping with The Adventures of Snider the Spider campaign! And, please pass this on to your friends!

story:
Most Exciting Manga Magazine in Indonesia, South East Asia, and BEYOND!


For those who are familiar with Japanese manga, you must know that most of the comics published there, start with a format of a periodical magazine (weekly or monthly). Each title will published per chapter within a certain period. With this format , the artist will have enough time to make quality artworks and the readers get more titles to read, on the publisher side, we can get what is the readers really want.

So we make SHONEN FIGHT an Indonesia Manga Magazine, with 12 titles per volume. Now indonesian readers will have more Indonesian Manga.  Yes, there are  already manga / comic magazine that are published in Indonesia, so what make us Different?

AWARD WINNING ARTISTs + NEW COMERs

4 of our line ups had won international award on several manga competition. And they also very popular here in Indonesia. In addition to that, we also get on board couples of first "professional artist" to feature their works on Shonen Fight. This way, we show that, we have the quality readers want, and the sustainability of Indonesia comic / manga artists. 

13 Titles per Volume

More than 300pages! So we are the biggest, thickest MANGA MAGAZINE in Indonesia.

Creators owned property

Creators owned their intellectual property. The publisher only hold the rights to publish, produce, and distribute.

JAPANESE EDITORIAL SYSTEM

We believe that editors, play an important role on creative process, thats why we have 5 editors working for us, and the leader is an editor from Japan! Yoshihiko Wakanabe (editor in chief) is a japanese manga editor with more than 20 years of experience. Now he's here to share his knowledge to other editors, and to work together with the artists since the development stage of the story.


in 2015, we have 4 Volumes already published

So far, as a new publisher, we can consider ourself quite success. Sales number for each volume goes up to 60% of production numbers. Still, there are lots of trouble we have to deal with. for example:

1. Bookstore commision in Indonesia is too big, right now, its 45-50% for bookstore, 10%for distributors, 10%for govt VAT. that leave us with 30-35% out of 5$ sales price.

2. We are yet to reach our optimal production number. To do that, we have to produce twice more than our current production run.

3. Ebook sales are yet to flourish in Indonesia, for now, we still have to put our money mostly, in printed books

4. Lack of promotion. For now, our main promotion channel is social media

2015 Milestone

  • 4 Volume (Indonesian edition)
  • 2 Volume (English Edition)
  • Major events attendance (Popcon, Indonesia Comic Con, Singapore Toys, Games, & Comic Convention)
  • Media Exposure (TV, Online, News Paper)
  • Positive Reviews

2016 Plan

We will use the money from this campaign to expand the publishing company and increase the production numbers as well as publishing new books from the magazine.

  • 6 Volume (Indonesian edition)
  • 6 Volume (English Edition)
  • Digital Platform edition (Indonesia and English)
  • 6 Books of Tankobon / Individual titles comic
  • 1 CD Soundtrack album (watch the teaser below)
  • Merchandising
  • 1 Self Hosted Events (mid 2016)


Why We need $75000 or more

As an creator's owned comic magazine, we pay the artists in advance and also to make sure that the artist get the amount they deserved. We want to be as professional as we should and as we can. currently our cost structure is to pay the artist. 

Right now we are a quite established business. The $75000 we're trying to get is to push Shonen Fight to a bigger level and a bigger stage. The operational cost  for each volume is nearly $20000. and so far, we are able keep the business running. the $75000  will make us run faster, and further.

Shonen Fight is not a social campaign. but one of the reason we create Shonen Fight is to make more local content as a start for Indonesian and South East Asian. So we can put ourselves together with our counterparts in Japan, US or Europe, which already established their comic industry. So we believe Shonen Fight will have social impact in terms of original comics from the region.


SPREAD THE NEWS! THANKS ALL!
