story:
What it is:

“The Roommate” is a comedy web series with 14 episodes ranging from 7 to 22 minutes in length.

Three friends in their twenties, two men and one woman, share an apartment in Washington, D.C. When they have trouble coming up with the rent, they hatch a hair-brained scheme to rent out the tiny room off the hallway. They keep having to find a new roommate because something always happens and the new roommate never lasts.

Shot in glorious 4k Ultra HD, “The Roommate” is a madcap absurdist comedy that manages to make bizarre sense within its own wacky universe. Fast paced, with witty repartee, at first glance it appears to be a quirky romp, but rumbling just beneath the surface is a biting social satire of the human condition in the age of global warming.  


With plenty of dick, puke, and defecation jokes, the “Roommate” unashamedly goes for the cheap laugh while at the same time ponders the big questions. If “The Roommate” were candy, it would be bittersweet dark chocolate on the outside and gooey caramel on the inside. If it were a car, it would be a Porsche with a speedometer that forces you to drive under sixty, and if it were a relative, it would be your crazy uncle Louie who thinks he is a chicken. 


Homeland security, Russian spies, a Capitol Hill intern with a sex blog, mean girls and even zombies make a appearance, proving that it is far better to have your brains eaten than die in a rising sea tide.


Why We Need Funding:

Until now, I have self funded this project. I starting filming in August 2013 and have over 75% of “The Roommate” in-the-can, and edited. But I left the most difficult and most costly scenes until last. I still have four more days to film and need to be able to pay the actors, location fees, make-up artists and extras. $10,000 will allow me to complete the filming and get the 14 episodes, which consist of more than two hours of content, up and available on the Internet. 


Still to be filmed is a flash forward scene where two of the roommates are married with a child and have to explain to their child that the zombie apocalypse was created solely as the result of her mother’s carelessness. The flash forward scenes will be much funnier if the zombies are on par with their peers from “The Walking Dead.”  I am fortunate to have on board a make-up artist who worked on that show. 


The Audience:

Although the “The Roommate” has the ingredients to be an all out sausage-fest, the lead character is a unmistakably strong woman, or will be once she sheds some emotional baggage. Males from 12 to 39, gamers, comedy fans, and women from 21 to 32 who have an imposter complex are all there for the taking. Employing a modern electronic-tracking matrix allowed us to drill down into the meta data (thanks NSA) and discover that the highly desirable demographic of left handed woman ages 14 1/2 to 15 1/2 have a propensity for “The Roommate.” We're received positive antidotal feedback from this group, our core audience, which includes such gems as “totally,” “for sure,” and “whatever."


The Cast

Working on a small budget meant working quickly, but I didn't compromise on the casting. I had the good fortune of putting together a talented, young cast that had real chemistry. They made the dialog believable, and the story fly.

Alex Vaughn (Corey): I wrote this part for Alex and then he … moved to Hollywood! I flew him back to shoot this and it was worth the extra expense because when Alex commits, he’s all in and he killed.


Shayna Blass (Holly): Alex recommended Shayna and she was the first to read for the part. I know I had my Holly right away, but had to wait a couple nervous weeks until she committed to the part. Now I can't image “The Roommate” without her. She portrays vulnerability as well as anybody in the business and has great comic timing.   


Jaben Early (Ray): Although I originally cast someone else in this role, when he dropped out and Jaben stepped in, I knew I was experiencing a stroke of good luck. Jaben played the part differently and better than what I originally envisioned. I had worked with Jaben before and respected his talent, but had never worked with him on a comedy before. Jaben not only does funny, he does it fearlessly. 



In Conclusion

Funny and definitely weird, “The Roommate” will continue to surprise you. We can say with certitude that arguably “The Roommate” is the greatest show never (yet) to have been made in the history of the world, nah, the universe!

You may ask “Do you think society owes you a Web series?” And I could answer that by saying, “Yes, it does.” I am not going to do that, but, instead, insist that you are framing the question wrong. It should be “Do you think you owe society a Web series?” Yes, dammit, I do, so please help me inflict “The Roommate” on society. It will never know what hit it. Give early, give often, and let’s get this done!

story:
Overview

COSMOS is a 12 issue maxi-series that I am especially pleased with.  This star-spanning story that is part mystery, part science fiction/adventure that brings together the cosmic heroes of over 70 Indie Comic Book Creators/Publishers in a single title.  This tale will pit the greater good against evil incarnate in a rollicking tale which will genuinely entertain you and serve to introduce backers to interesting new characters & worlds. 

Story Summary

Picking up where the events of COSMOS #1 left off, the hero Legend and his team The Vanguard, are searching for allies to help battle a looming threat to the planet.  Their search leads them to the quasi-mythical land of Kush and its ruler...NIMROD THE HUNTER!  But is Nimrod even willing to aid Legend & The Vanguard in their quest?  The cosmic powers of the universe known as The Universals convene to stave off a celestial menace to the universe.  Plus, Enigma the Soultaker and the mysterious Genesis embark on a journey to learn the origins of creation itself.  And if that wasn't enough, the evil Regime Empire has come to Earth!

The adventure continues with the second and third installments of the COSMOS Indiegogo series and if this campaign is successful, COSMOS #4 and #5 will be available in this campaign if we can raise over $2,000 on the platform with this campaign.


But first, we have to get COSMOS #2 and #3 funded!
 


Two words...Warrior Apes!!  COSMOS #3 has it all and it is coming to you with this awesome campaign.


PREVIEWS

Here are preview pages from the COSMOS Trade Paperback Volume 1:


COSMOS #1

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

COSMOS #2

The action heats up as Earth is attacked & a cosmic evil threatens the Advent Universe...and beyond! 

 

 


COSMOS #3

Earth’s heroes have mobilized to combat the alien invasion but their problems have gotten worse with the arrival of other strange visitors to the beleaguered planet.


 

CREATIVE TEAM

TONY KITTRELL (Writer, publisher, art director, me) - I created and published the Advent Comics universe including Lazarus, The Hit Squad, Titan the Ultra Man, Darklight & Crew, Savior and hundreds of other characters. I’ve written Advent Comics Spotlight, Pandemonium: Evil Incarnate Graphic Novel, The Regulators, Champions of Hope Graphic Novel and many more. When I am not working on Advent Comics, I am a career Firefighter/Paramedic at one of the busiest departments in the country.

DODY EKA PUTRA (Illustrator) Dody has illustrated COSMOS #1, The Alliance of Evil and Starlex among many others. In his native Indonesia, he is a rising star and highly sought after comic book creator internationally.

J.E. LOZANO (Inker) J.E. has inked the pages of numerous anthologies, magazines, and websites, including Terminus Tales Presents, Secret Identities: The Asian American Superhero Anthology, COSMOS and Tales of the Council Elders.

BRYAN A. MAGNAYE (Color Artist) Bryan has colored COSMOS #1, has colored or illustrated Joe Martino’s The Mighty Titan, War of the Independents and has done work for Red Anvil, Zenescope and my company, Advent Comics. Bryan colors can be seen in COSMOS #2.

ARSIA ROZEGAR (Color Artist) Arsia’s works include colored pages for Marvel, Image, Top Cow, Todd McFarlane Productions, Titan, and Zenescope.  Arsia is the Colorist on COSMOS #3.

SHAWN DEPASQUALE (Letterer) A writer and letterer, Shawn has been working in the comic industry since 2000. He has worked with Arcana, Oni Press, Platinum Studios, Zenescope and many others. Current work includes: Galaxies for Hire from Devil’s Due Comics.

And for the gorgeous and impressive cover for COSMOS #2:

JIMBO SALGADO (Cover) An amazing artist and rising superstar, Jimbo has done multiple covers for the COSMOS Maxi-Series as well as Atlas Unified, The Mighty Titan and many more. He has worked with DC, IDW, Marvel and Zenescope Comics to name a few.

TOTS VALEZA (Cover Colors) Tots is a master colorist whose work will grace several of the covers of the COSMOS series including two by Jimbo Salgado. You can also see his work on the upcoming Titan the Ultra Man #2 by Advent Comics.

VINCE WHITE (Logo Design) A writer and artist, Vince is the creator of the awesome cover logo and is also the owner of Darklight Studios which publishes The Legend of Will Power.

COSMOS #3 Cover Art:

MYKE GUISINGA (Cover) Myke is a dynamic artist from the Philippines whose work can be seen in various indie comics and his own Claw comic is a fan-favorite in his country.  Myke created this beautiful cover (and will return for the interior art duties for COSMOS #4).

RACHEL LACHANCE (Cover Colors) Rachel was the long-standing Colorist for Advent Comics and has worked on various other projects in comics and beyond.

 

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to increase the number of readers on this book and to at least make the minimum funding goal so that I can bring this book to you.   COSMOS is a HUGE series and I want it to be one of the best in the industry.  I have assembled what I hope will be some nice perks for those of you who are willing to back this.  I have lined up some of the best creators in the comic book industry to contribute to the COSMOS series - I hope that you will agree.

 

 

 

 

The Impact

Our first successful Indiegogo campaign was COSMOS #1 and we hope to continue that with the COSMOS Trade Paperback Volume # 1.  This is my 16th crowdfunding project overall and I will continue to bring everything that I have learned with each past successful campaign to this one.

If this campaign is a success, the next campaign will be for COSMOS #5.


Risks & Challenges

All of the books included in this campaign are completed.  They just need to be printed for the number of people who back the campaign.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute with your dollars, there are still ways that you can help out.  Please get the word out to all of your friends, family and loved ones to make some noise about the COSMOS Trade Paperback Volume #1.  Whether by social media (use the harsh tag #COSMOS), word of mouth or the Indiegogo Share Tools,  Let's make this campaign a success!

All of the books included in this campaign are completed.  They just need to be printed for the number of people who back the campaign.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot contribute with your dollars, there are still ways that you can help out.  Please get the word out to all of your friends, family and loved ones to make some noise about the COSMOS Trade Paperback Volume #1.  Whether by social media (use the harsh tag #COSMOS), word of mouth or the Indiegogo Share Tools,  Let's make this campaign a success!

story:
Think Sharks are bad ass? Prepare to meet DARK SHARK! A commando who loves his cigars almost as much as his knives! Assigned to take down the nacro Don Walrus, a powerful drug lord with a fondness of guns and an army of brutal mercenaries! Biting off more than he could chew leads to him re-assembling his old crew! FRANCHELICO, the kung-fu disco turtle; RIDER, Rabbit of Anarchy; WOODY, an unclassifiable green dog; and CORPORAL STIFF, the amiable dolphin! Did you miss all the gun-toting grim-and-gritty nonsense from the 90's? This is your book! Guns! Knives! Gritted teeth! Duck shooting!

 

I don't remember the day I picked up a pencil and started scribbling an idea, but it has always been a part of who I am. I love comics so strongly that they have infected my lifestyle.

I can’t deny my love for comics and cartoons! Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Biker Mice from Mars and even the Toxic Crusaders from Troma. All of them were my crown jewels, things that made me laugh and were just so fun!

 

That’s how BEAST COMMANDOS came to be, it’s my tribute to those toys/cartoons that gave me so much joy as a kid. Remember as a kid you’d make up imaginary battles between your toys? This book is all of it brought to life!

 

Amigo Comics was Beast Commandos’ first home 6 years ago, having the best reception with its first issue. Sadly, the sales weren’t too flattering, as a result it was cancelled before the second issue released. The news hit hard but I decided to accept the outcome and move onto new projects.

 

Imagine the surprise when I found out the comic was still selling well! Word of mouth spread leading to new fans picking it up. Bookstores were selling out of copies and reviews of my crazy ideas kept coming in. I even started getting job offers due to this, people wanting their books to get the same style as Beast Commandos.

 

If there was a moment, then it’s now! Beast Commandos has another shot and this crowdfunding campaign will see it through!

Cover by Roger Bonet

 

 

 

In this campaign, I want to bring Beast Commandos back to life with print runs of the first two comics plus extra goodies put in.

 

If successful, I’d have enough to work on a second volume (3 and 4) of the original ideas I intended for the series! It’s all going to provide more and more 90s action love for all!

 

I hope for your help in making this a reality!

Lets do our beast to make this happen!

 

Cover by Diego Galindo

 

 

DARK SHARK is tough, wild, truly a one-shark army! He has spent years on the trail of his nemesis, the fearsome criminal mastermind DON WALRUS. All that hunting was about to pay off as Dark tracked him down to his private estate.

Only to run into the mercs he hired for protection! He was prepared but not for the beating they gave him!

Wounded and humiliated Dark decides to reassemble the BEAST COMMANDOS! The fiercest team the Duck Kong has ever seen! Don Walrus and his Evil Team won’t stand a chance!

The team is made up of:

 

 

Dark Shark:

An elite shark soldier with one goal, to end Don Walrus and his reign of terror! A despot, violent and irascible making him the perfect team leader! He runs off a simple philosophy to life: "If you don’t succeed with force, it’s cause you lack enough strength"

 

Rider:

 Former member of the Biker Rabbits of Anarchy, kicked out due to his secret passions. He’s been riding solo ever since reminiscing about his days with the Beast Commandos in his solitude.  Faithful to his comrades this is one bunny you’ll always want watching your back!

 

Franchelico:

A Turtle with a jokey attitude, Franchelico joined up with the Kung-fu Disco Turtles to find more purpose in his life. All he got were cruel pranks and a massive headache. Kicked out after a mission gone wrong, he went for the solo vigilante role till Dark Shark came looking for him.

 

Woody:

An unclassifiable green dog that lives in his own little world. He treats life like a constant adventure always wanting another exciting challenge. There is a fiery side to him that even sends chills up Dark Shark’s spine, keep him happy at all costs!

 

Corporal Stiff :

 Reserve member of the Galactic Dolphins, a unit meant for rescue and counter attack missions. Not an original member of the Beast Commandos but saved Dark Shark’s ass after it took a beating from the Evil Team. Despite his rookie status he’s still a valuable member to the reassembled team.

 

 

Don Walrus:

The infamous leader of the underworld, with money and connections linked to several operations across the globe. Underneath his angry, trigger happy persona resides a tactical genius who is about to make his play for world domination!

 

 The most soulless and demented mercs that money can buy! Being on Don Walrus’ payroll means they’ll have an unlimited budget and endless fun with the terror they’ll reap!

 

Chinichi:

 Ninja assassin of the thousand eyes clan, a ruthless killer who regurgitate weapons hidden in his body for greater lethality. Trained in the mystical techniques of the Shinovi, he’s a master of stealth and espionage.

 

Faceass:

A sadist hardened by the worst conflicts in the world. He’s an entire black ops team rolled into one orca with his demolitions and firearms expertise.

 

Rumble:

 Champion of various titles in MMA and wrestling. He was disqualified and expelled for his brutality in the ring. He’s become a ferocious merc who settles everything with his fists!

 

Monkey Boom :

Butler and guard of Don Walrus, behind his exquisite manners hides a cold-blooded killer with an extensive killcount to his name. Capable of making crumpets one second and snapping necks the next, he’s the perfect bodyguard.

 

 

Cover by Leo Castellani

 

That and more awaits you in the pages of BEAST COMMANDOS!

Artwork by Roger Bonet and colors by Sonia Moruno

 

https://share.clip-studio.com/es-es/contents/vi...

or in PDF:

https://wetransfer.com/downloads/48d4273b8bfd3d...

 

 

-  BEAST COMMANDOS VOL 1:

  : a 72-page soft cover comic that contains Issues 1 and 2, the latter being completely new. Want more content? There’s also a 15-page crossover with the TERROR TRIO, a killer shark team from the upcoming comic BITE. Created and scripted by Robert Livingston (creator of TOM AND ARTIE, BITE also our editor). Some exclusive exclusive covers by Diego Galingo (STRANGER THINGS, DARK HORSE COMICS) and Leo Castellani (MARVEL).

-ARTIST EDITION:

72-page version in A4 format (size of original art pages) for those who want to take in the inks and techniques used to develop the book. All provided by the creator, Roger Bonet.

-BEAST COMMANDOS ALT COVERS:

 version with alternative covers created by Diego Galindo and Leo Castellani. Only 250 copies of this with the exclusivity these great artists deserve.

- ARTIST EDITION WITH A4 WHITE COVER:

72-page black and white comic (artist edition), meant for commissions to patrons who want a custom drawing by Roger Bonet creator. (Commissions can only be one character with a background or two characters without background, all in grayscale).

-POSTER IN A2 PLICATED:

poster of the alternative covers that can be purchased as an additional reward. Made from the covers by Roger Bonet, Diego Galindo and Leo Castellani.

-TEN ORIGINAL BEAST COMMANDO ART PIECES:

 comes included with the physical and digital purchase of the comic. A unique original for your hands to see the inking and drawing process!

https://beastcomandosorigialart.blogspot.com/?v...

 

-COMPLETE PACK:

Beast Commandos Vol 1, the two alternative covers, art edition in A4, black and white cover with its corresponding commission and the original cover in A3 with its transparent protector. Issues coming signed is dependent on buyer request.

 

 

All purchases will include an additional sticker of the Beast Commandos member logos! With free shipping!

 

Cover by Roger Bonet

 

Roger Bonet

Artist, writer and creator of Beast Commandos

Spanish inker, draftsman and screenwriter who studied at the Joso Comics School in Barcelona and began work at a very young age as an illustrator for Dungeons and Dragons magazines before going to work at Marvel Italia as an inker in series like Euroforce and Conan with Paco Díaz Luque and Xavi Marturet. Then he went on to ink some works in Avatar Press and then as inker in Marvel Comics, in collections such as Hercules and Ultimate Enemy, with Rafa Sandoval. He worked on X-men, Hulk and age of Ultron with Carlos Pacheco, and for DC comics he worked on Nightwing collections and Batwoman with Juan José Ryp among others. He is also the screenwriter of cazadores de Gonzos (Dibbuks, Spain), Urgences civernetiques (tabou editors, France) and Beast Commandos (Amigo comics, USA). As an artist he works with US publishers such as Zenescope comics, and Dynamite comics.

 

Sonia Moruno Martinerz

Colorist

Madrid cartoonist and colorist. He has collaborated in fanzines such as "Hormigas", "Amaniaco" and "la machine de albóndigas". He colored in US publishers such as ZENESCOPE, REVOLVE COMICS and AMIGO COMICS among others. He has also been a draftsman at Editorial SANTILLANA and RICHMOND for several years. But we have also been able to see as a cover artist for GRAFITO Editorial and JOTdownKIDS, collaborating with HERSTORICAS, illustrating a joint story on DIBBUKS or supporting "Comic 21". In 2014, I have published his first comic "LOS HIJOS DE ARAMAR" by EDICIONES BABYLON, which was also reissued for IDW in 2019. Currently, I have continued to color and draw, in addition to preparing a youth comic project that he will personally screenplay.

 

Cristian doconomasky

Lettered

Cristian was born in Barcelona, 1977, though he lives in Santiago, Chile. He currently works as an inker, penciler, letterer and logo designer for several publishers, including Heavy Metal Magazine, Scout Comics, Advent Comics, Mythopoeia, Blue Roo Comics, Crow Hill Comics among others. He is also the full creator for his series In,jvsticia, published now on Ariete Producciones.

 

Robert Livingston

Writer and Editor

Robert was born in Brooklyn, NY in 1993 but currently lives in Queens, NY. He’s a self-published comic writer working on his own IPs such as TOM N ARTIE (currently on Tapas), BITE, KAIJU DAYZ (future comic/animation series) and COSMO LASS.

 

Diego Galindo

Cover Artist

Diego Galindo, is a Spanish comic artist. After a year as a drawing teacher at the Faculty of Fine Arts in Seville (2009), he decided to guide his professional career in the world of comics, drawing a several projects with Amigo comics publisher. His production it's mainly focused on the US market, in 2017 he was awarded with the "Dragon award for the best comic" at the Dragon Con for "The Dresden files: Dog men"(Dynamite). In 2018 he starts to collaborate with Boom Studios making interiors and covers for titles such as Red Mother, Power Rangers or Firefly. At the moment he is currently doing the pencils for the new Stranger Things & Dungeons and Dragons series (IDW publishing and DarkHorse).

 

Leo Castellani

Cover Artist

Leonel Castellani (Argentina 1977) began his professional work in an art studio in the mid-90s as an assistant, colorist and draftsman for Warnes Bros., DC Comics, Disney, Scholastic, Egmont and Planeta publishing house, among others. In early 2000, he began publishing the series David & Goliath in Image Comics while continuing his work in the field of advertising animation and youth comics. He collaborated on licensing projects for Cartoon Network (Ben 10, Scooby Doo, Looney Tunes, Tom and Jerry) and various American and Asian studios as a concept designer, later moving to Marvel Comics drawing the strips and comics for the Super Hero Squad series. , and where he continues to work as a cover artist and illustrator. In parallel, he drew comics for the licenses of Disney Afternoon / Boom Studios (Chip & Dale Rescue Rangers, Duck Tales).
He also collaborates with Capstone Publishing as a licensed artist, illustrating books for the DC comics Superhero series.

 

 

FIRST PHASE: 15K

Beast Commandos switch from soft to hard cover!

SECOND PHASE: 35k

Page count increases to 80 with original sketches, unpublished designs, and exclusive content!

THIRD PHASE: 50k

unpublished exclusive poster creased A2 and free for all patrons.

FOURTH PHASE: 100K

Physical print of the 16-page ashcan free for all patrons.

 

 

more info:

https://www.facebook.com/comicbeastcomandos

Review Beast Commandos (first issue)

https://comicbookroundup.com/comic-books/review...

story:
Welcome to The Crimebusters!

 

 

The Crimebusters is a supernatural mystery adventure series featuring a team of student sleuths who investigate the unknown! And now they're back for a smash third issue!

In The Crimebusters #1, amateur detectives Chuck Chandler and Trixie Trouble must reluctantly team up to discover the truth behind the mysterious death of a beloved professor. Was it suicide... or supernatural?

In The Crimebusters #2, a ghost story leads Chuck and Trixie to uncover the truth behind a cold case from the 1890's. When the clues run out, there's just one way to learn what really happened: time travel?!

And in The Crimebusters #3, when people across campus begin randomly attacking each other in the fall of 1956, Chuck and Trixie must discover if it's sorcery, or secret agents... or both!! Find out the astonishing truth in "The Spell of the Sorcerer!"

 

No risk, all reward!

All three issues have previously funded on Kickstarter and are printed and in hand, so there's no risk involved! If you choose to back The Crimebusters, you'll get your comics as soon as the mail allows — or sooner if you choose the digital option!

 

Who will love The Crimebusters?

 

What startling secrets await you in the first three issues of The Crimebusters ?

 The Crimebusters #1 is a 36-page comic in standard American comic size, printed on high quality paper in glorious greyscale! And The Crimebusters #2 and #3 are even bigger at 40 whopping pages each!

The first issue includes the complete, self-contained 30-page comic adventure novel "Return of the Death Mask!" as well as the 4-page backup story "A Day in the Life" starring Squeeks the Monkey!

The second issue includes the complete, self-contained 31-page comic adventure novel "The Secret of the Ghost Bride!" as well as the 5-page backup story "Vera Veritas: Science Adventurer!"

The third issue includes the complete, self-contained 32-page comic adventure novel "The Spell of the Sorcerer!" as well as the 6-page backup story "To Protect and Serve" starring Officer Joe!

PLUS! if you buy the physical editions, you will also receive the digital PDF editions free, each of which feature dozens of pages of bonus material, including variant covers, concept art, and complete stories from the Golden Age of comics!

 

PREMIUM VARIANTS!

Every issue of The Crimebusters also features two premium variants, each of which pays homage to the great teen sleuth characters of the past that inspired The Crimebusters. 

First, the Boy Comics Variants are a tribute to the Golden Age adventures of leading man Chuck Chandler, who headlined Boy Comics for 14 years until the series ended with issue #119 in 1956. These variants carry the original Boy Comics logo and numbering, picking up where the original series left off, starting up with issue #120 and continuing from there! The cover for issue #122 is also by special guest and popular Golden Age fan artist Marc Svensson!

 

Then, the Trixie's Mysteries Variants are a tribute to all the strong female sleuths who have made the teen detective genre what it is, with each cover featuring leading lady Trixie Trouble in an homage to the Nancy Drew novels! The cover for Book 2 is from guest artist Heather Farrington, creator of the series Juvenile Diversion, while the cover for Book 3 is by guest artist Julie Oliveira, artist on the series Camp Bitter Lake!

 

ADD-ONS!

If you want to mix and match covers, it's easy with the Add-On feature. Once you've selected a single issue reward of your choice, just follow the prompts to the payment screen, and you will be given the option of adding on any extra copies you want of the cover of your choice, regular or premium!

 

Who am I and why am I passionate about The Crimebusters? 

My name is Scott Harris-King, and I am the artist and writer of The Crimebusters. As a kid, I loved teen detective stories, reading and collecting every volume of series like The Three Investigators and Trixie Belden. As an adult, I rediscovered that love when I came across a comic book character named Chuck Chandler — and amateur sleuth whose adventures took him from abandoned mines in upstate New York to Spanish bullfighting rings to the Amazonian rainforests.

I wanted to read more, but there was one problem: Chuck's series ended in 1956. That's when I decided that if I wanted to read the kind of comics I wanted, and was no longer getting from the big publishers, I'd have to make them myself. I created Trixie Trouble as a tribute to iconic girl detectives like Nancy Drew, and for the last three years, I've been hard at work on The Crimebusters — and loving every minute of it!

From the moment I read my first comic book at the age of 10, I've known I wanted to make my own comics. But it took a very special story and a couple of very special characters to turn "wanted" into "needed." I really hope you enjoy The Crimebusters as much as I do, and I can't wait to begin working on the next adventure!

story_txt: Welcome to The Crimebusters!  The Crimebusters is a supernatural mystery adventure series featuring a team of student sleuths who investigate the unknown! And now they're back for a smash third issue!In The Crimebusters #1, amateur detectives Chuck Chandler and Trixie Trouble must reluctantly team up to discover the truth behind the mysterious death of a beloved professor. Was it suicide... or supernatural?In The Crimebusters #2, a ghost story leads Chuck and Trixie to uncover the truth behind a cold case from the 1890's. When the clues run out, there's just one way to learn what really happened: time travel?!And in The Crimebusters #3, when people across campus begin randomly attacking each other in the fall of 1956, Chuck and Trixie must discover if it's sorcery, or secret agents... or both!! Find out the astonishing truth in "The Spell of the Sorcerer!" No risk, all reward!All three issues have previously funded on Kickstarter and are printed and in hand, so there's no risk involved! If you choose to back The Crimebusters, you'll get your comics as soon as the mail allows — or sooner if you choose the digital option! Who will love The Crimebusters? What startling secrets await you in the first three issues of The Crimebusters ? The Crimebusters #1 is a 36-page comic in standard American comic size, printed on high quality paper in glorious greyscale! And The Crimebusters #2 and #3 are even bigger at 40 whopping pages each!The first issue includes the complete, self-contained 30-page comic adventure novel "Return of the Death Mask!" as well as the 4-page backup story "A Day in the Life" starring Squeeks the Monkey!The second issue includes the complete, self-contained 31-page comic adventure novel "The Secret of the Ghost Bride!" as well as the 5-page backup story "Vera Veritas: Science Adventurer!"The third issue includes the complete, self-contained 32-page comic adventure novel "The Spell of the Sorcerer!" as well as the 6-page backup story "To Protect and Serve" starring Officer Joe!PLUS! if you buy the physical editions, you will also receive the digital PDF editions free, each of which feature dozens of pages of bonus material, including variant covers, concept art, and complete stories from the Golden Age of comics! PREMIUM VARIANTS!Every issue of The Crimebusters also features two premium variants, each of which pays homage to the great teen sleuth characters of the past that inspired The Crimebusters. First, the Boy Comics Variants are a tribute to the Golden Age adventures of leading man Chuck Chandler, who headlined Boy Comics for 14 years until the series ended with issue #119 in 1956. These variants carry the original Boy Comics logo and numbering, picking up where the original series left off, starting up with issue #120 and continuing from there! The cover for issue #122 is also by special guest and popular Golden Age fan artist Marc Svensson! Then, the Trixie's Mysteries Variants are a tribute to all the strong female sleuths who have made the teen detective genre what it is, with each cover featuring leading lady Trixie Trouble in an homage to the Nancy Drew novels! The cover for Book 2 is from guest artist Heather Farrington, creator of the series Juvenile Diversion, while the cover for Book 3 is by guest artist Julie Oliveira, artist on the series Camp Bitter Lake! ADD-ONS!If you want to mix and match covers, it's easy with the Add-On feature. Once you've selected a single issue reward of your choice, just follow the prompts to the payment screen, and you will be given the option of adding on any extra copies you want of the cover of your choice, regular or premium! Who am I and why am I passionate about The Crimebusters? My name is Scott Harris-King, and I am the artist and writer of The Crimebusters. As a kid, I loved teen detective stories, reading and collecting every volume of series like The Three Investigators and Trixie Belden. As an adult, I rediscovered that love when I came across a comic book character named Chuck Chandler — and amateur sleuth whose adventures took him from abandoned mines in upstate New York to Spanish bullfighting rings to the Amazonian rainforests.I wanted to read more, but there was one problem: Chuck's series ended in 1956. That's when I decided that if I wanted to read the kind of comics I wanted, and was no longer getting from the big publishers, I'd have to make them myself. I created Trixie Trouble as a tribute to iconic girl detectives like Nancy Drew, and for the last three years, I've been hard at work on The Crimebusters — and loving every minute of it!From the moment I read my first comic book at the age of 10, I've known I wanted to make my own comics. But it took a very special story and a couple of very special characters to turn "wanted" into "needed." I really hope you enjoy The Crimebusters as much as I do, and I can't wait to begin working on the next adventure! Issue #3 Sneak Preview!                                                                         Issue #2 Sneak Preview!                                Issue #1 Sneak Preview!

story:
Greetings everyone, my name is Gregory Michel, but some of you out there know me as GM, FallenAngel (for the last time, I don't worship the devil!), etc. And he's our story.

THE BEGINNING
I grew up idolizing fictional characters from comics from Spider-man to Sailor Moon and anything in between. When I was 9 years old, I made my first connection with a Dragon Ball volume. As I read it, and being mind-blown by it at the same time, I knew from this moment what I wanted to do in the future; I wanted to do a manga of my own. I even wanted to be published by Shonen Jump! Talk about being ambitious! I wanted to be noticed by Shonen Jump so I could meet one of my idols, Akira Toriyama, creator of Dragon Ball. If it wasn't for me, I would have never starter writing.


I think it would have been as such at Shonen Jump.

Until 16, I wrote loads of fanfictions. I even mixed characters from Dragon Ball, Digimon, Pokémon, and even Megaman in the mix. (Yeah, I had a crazy imagination.) In high school, I met Hagane and we became great friends due to our love for manga and for having the same aspirations; creating a series of our own. And we've been on it ever since. It was at that time that HEART OF WILDFIRE was born. At the same time, she had given the first breath of life by drawing the characters. 


I only gave the ideas, but she did the heavy lifting. Yes Hagane, you did! Stop being so modest!

Despite my huge desire to work and publish at Shonen Jump, I realized I was much more immature than I thought. Piercing through this business was hard and harsh, and even more difficult for non-Japanese ones as myself. Learning Japanese alone would have been incredibly time-consuming.

They were times I almost gave up. But I thought to myself, was it really important to reach Shonen Jump. And as stupid as it was, I simply said, "no." And just like that, it was as if I needed that simple answer to tear that wall down.

And with the rise of independent self-publishing platforms that came years later, I realized my dream could come true. At last.

WHAT IS HEART OF WILDFIRE?
Heart Of Wildfire tells the story of three brothers, Sahn, Tairo and Ryo Lamarey...

From bottom to top: Sahn, Ryo & Tairo, the Lamarey brothers
...aspiring to become living legends like the late hero Senthann Kameyata who passed away by defeating Shadolus, queen of calamities and goddess of chaos.

The late Senthann Kameiyata

The hero's sacrificial battle...

But the brothers' plan suddenly takes a fateful turn when they stumble on a medallion shaped as a flame: a Heart of Wildfire. 

The medallions; Hearts of Wildfire

Learning that these mysterious artifacts are coveted by the armies of the Sirken Cross, the same forces formerly led by Shadolus, the brotherly trio are engaged on a journey to find the remaining medallions before these hellish forces do and plunge the world of Gaelice into chaos by the hands of their new leader, the enigmatic one called the General.

What better way to become a living legend than saving the world?


THE RED RONINS
I found a small group of people that gathered around me to make this wonderful story a reality. I decided to call ourselves the RED RONINS. Red is for our passion, at we are passionate into our artistic craft and skills. Ronins is for the fact that even though we have been inspired by great artists, we are by unbound; like masterless samurais. 

THE RED RONINS
Hagane: Character designer, co-writer and cat/neko lover!
GM (me): Author, writer & creator of the H.O.W. project (also the only dude to can't draw...)
Memer: Page artist & secretly a Transformer (What? I'm sure he is!)
Lumaga: Digital colorist & Super Wizard (Colors like that are magical! Deal with it!)

With the team of these wonderful friends I have around me, I believe the road will be long, but it will be worth it through this great adventure. If it wasn't for them, I would have never made it to this point. 

(Hagane, Lumaga, Memer, thank you so much!)

AFTER FUNDING REACHED...
Sending the countless rewards would be my main priority, but it is a challenge I'm looking forward to tackle on. The script of HEART OF WILDFIRE's first chapter/issue is completed. All it needs is to be made, then published. 

The pages would be drawn and made in the process. Considering the page artist would be busy with H.O.W. along with other projects as well, I estimate an amount 5 to 6 months to be completed, for June 2016. Less if we're lucky.

After that...

THE OFFICIAL LAUNCH OF THE FIRST CHAPTER (A special 70-page special edition) WOULD BE AVAILABLE FOR SALE! (except for those who would already have it in the perks.) With the profits reinvested into the project to supply our finances to keep on working on this beloved series, of course.

Our goal is to give this comic/manga series a good kick start, to finally get it out there. And I believe with your support, this 15-year-old dream can finally come true.

RISKS & CHALLENGES
Making such a project is not a one-man task. Luckily, I have not only a good team around me, but great friends as well.

Challenges will always be on our way, and we're ready to face them on. No matter the problems and setbacks we'll have. Know this: we'll let you know everything along the way through our social network addresses, which is why I strongly recommend you to follow us on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook. And we're positive that we'll get the best of support from you guys.

More than that, this project will come in fruition. You're asking yourselves how can we be so confident.

If you've seen the video already, then you must know by now that I've been on this project since I was high school. In other words, 15 years ago. (Yeah, I'm much older than I look, lol)

Considering I'm still on it, this time with great support friends and teammates, it's safe to say that I'm going to make this happen. ;-)

So join the adventure! This will be fun! And you won't regret it! Thank you!

story:
Bref résumé

Le Sang de Dracula est la première BD d’une trilogie qui s’adresse aux jeunes du primaire de 7 à 12 ans.

Si on en croit la cinquantaine de jeunes que nous avons sondés, le succès de cette BD est assuré. C'est avec enthousiasme qu'ils nous ont guidé pour raffiner notre scénario et le rendre encore plus fantastique.

L’histoire est collée à la réalité des jeunes d’aujourd’hui.

Tommy est nouveau dans cette école où trois filles s’amusent à l’asticoter sans raison. Une petite gang plutôt agressive, ces trois filles, qui s’acharnent à lui faire perdre ses moyens.

Josie tente de venir à son secours et se fait intimider à son tour. Cloé est également nouvelle mais elle a plein d’idées pour se défendre; ainsi Tommy et Cloé deviennent amis. C’est le début de l’aventure.

Dans la famille de Cloé un grand oncle, le chercheur Origène, s’est toujours intéressé aux comportements des mammifères, du singe jusqu’à l’homme. Son secret, bien gardé, est une autre recherche qui porte sur une réalité plus explosive : trouver des antidotes aux drogues de synthèse qui ravagent les jeunes d’aujourd’hui. Cette recherche est gardée secrète parce que plusieurs groupes ne souhaitent pas qu’il réussisse et d’autres organisations veulent s’emparer de ses découvertes pour mieux les exploiter.

Plongés, malgré eux, dans un monde où les enjeux les dépassent largement, comment la gang de Tommy et Cloé va-t-elle s’en tirer? Une histoire à suivre.

Réaliser une bande dessinée est un travail  colossal. Une fois le dessin terminé, il est difficile d’imaginer quelle somme de travail à la chaîne cela a demandé. À partir d’un scénario détaillé incluant les dialogues, un premier crayonné est réalisé, le plus souvent grossier où il faut placer les personnages, l’action et le décor pour obtenir le nombre de cases et de pages qu’on souhaite imprimer une fois la BD terminée. Par la suite, il faut insérer les bulles, les légendes, les bordures et à l’aide d’un lettrage choisi et de façon contrastante  y glisser les dialogues. Le dessinateur termine les crayonnés  à l’encre noir. C’est l’encrage.  Finalement, ultime étape, les planches noir et blanc sont scannées pour y apposer la couleur et y insérer les séparations pour l’impression.

Parce que je ne dessine pas moi-même, je dois m’entourer de plusieurs collaborateurs, trois dessinateurs se sont succédés pour faire avancer le projet, d’autres viendront sans doute s’y ajouter.

Où ira l'argent recueilli

Si nous atteignons les $25,000 demandés, une partie de ce montant permettra de terminer les pages de dessins de la première BD dont le titre est Le Sang de Dracula.

Jusqu’à date, nous avons franchi une première étape (dessin de deux épisodes, un sondage auprès de la clientèle-cible et la planification du reste de la BD sous forme de cases et de pages) avec les fonds dont nous disposions, Mais pour compléter ce début d’histoire, nous avons besoin de vous.

Nous misons sur le socio-financement parce que nous souhaitons respecter les objectifs que nous nous sommes fixés : une BD collée à la réalité des jeunes, fantaisiste aussi pour capter leur intérêt et explorant leurs problèmes les plus cruciaux à partir de personnages attachants. La recherche de financement auprès d’organismes publics exige d’être prêt à faire des compromis et est un parcours ardu qui risque d’épuiser notre créativité et de briser notre élan.

Le scénario est déjà en place, la planification des pages déjà très avancée. Le dessin se paie à la page et il en reste 37 à compléter sur 48 pages au total.  Il faut également y mettre la couleur. Ces opérations demanderont presque la moitié du montant.

Le travail est considérable et le dessinateur mérite ce qu’il demande pour chacune des pages mais si nous n’atteignons pas le montant total, il faudrait penser à étaler la réalisation sur un temps plus long.

Le financement servira aussi  à engager les fonds nécessaires pour imprimer la BD avec une couverture rigide, 48 pages couleurs de qualité, (également page de garde, reliure, emballage, livraison etc.). Cette impression grugera une grande partie de l'autre moitié du montant demandé. Nous avons besoin d’argent pour cette impression qui est prévue au Québec pour l’instant mais si le montant total n’était pas atteint, il faudrait chercher une impression à un coût moindre.

Évidemment, il faut assurer les contreparties. Et nous le ferons avec plaisir.

Si notre objectif est dépassé, nous pourrons entreprendre de faire dessiner la deuxième BD de cette série dont le scénario est déjà écrit. Cette BD a des objectifs tout aussi audacieux. Elle est faite pour capter l’intérêt des jeunes, susciter leur passion et leur attachement à ces personnages sympathiques.

Nous sommes une équipe passionnée et nous tirerons profit de chaque sous que vous investirez pour vous offrir un produit de qualité qui sera un succès parce que nous avons déjà la preuve qu’il plaira aux jeunes que nous désirons atteindre.

Extrait d’un témoignage d’un jeune rejoint lors du sondage :

« …Cette BD a beaucoup de réalisme, me fait des émotions, a mon mode de vie. Cette BD va faire un malheur, j’en suis sûr. Cette BD m’a fait une explosion de plaisir.

De la part d’un lecteur sympathique

W..H. »

Indiegogo est pour nous une plateforme extraordinaire car elle nous permettrait de mettre au monde cette BD.


Comment pouvez-vous nous aider? 

Aide essentielle :

Vous pouvez réellement nous aider. Même si dans les contreparties qui suivent, il est mentionné des montants impressionnants, un $20.00 est une aide extraordinaire pour nous.

Savez-vous que seulement 1,500 personnes qui accepteraient d’investir ce $20.00 nous permettraient de dépasser notre objectif.

$20 n’est pas un  montant énorme mais ça va faire une énorme différence .

Merci de faire ça pour notre projet.


Voici également une aide appréciable :

Chaque personne qui souhaite nous aider peut le faire facilement.

Ce projet de BD a besoin d’être connu. Choisissez parmi vos contacts les personnes les plus susceptibles de nous aider d’une manière ou d’une autre.

Soit parce qu’elles possèdent un très grand nombre de contacts dans leur carnet d’adresses à qui elles peuvent écrire ou qu’elles disposent d’un peu d’argent à investir.

Faites parvenir un message personnel à ces contacts en les dirigeant vers Indiegogo pour leur permettre de connaître Tommy et Cloé.

Mille mercis pour ce coup de main essentiel.

Pour ceux qui voudraient se réserver une copie de la BD

Contactez-nous à l’adresse suivante : contact@tommyetcloe.com pour nous laisser votre adresse e-mail et nous vous contacterons quand la BD sera disponible.


Équipe


Je vous présente mon équipe. Il y a d’abord, moi, je suis le porteur du projet et j’ai plusieurs années d’expérience dans le réseau de la Santé et des Services Sociaux au Québec.

Au début de ma carrière j’ai travaillé auprès des jeunes, comme prof, animatrice et soutien au niveau de plusieurs programmes.

À travers ce parcours, je me suis éprise de la Bande dessinée, une réelle passion. Je l’ai utilisée dans le cadre de mes interventions auprès des jeunes. J’ai conçu la BD Tommy et Cloé.

Dans l’équipe de production, il y a aussi mon conjoint, mon lecteur , un critique avisé et un soutien également indéfectible. Il accomplit les indispensables tâches administratives.

Les autres membres de l’équipe (Annie-Justine, Vincent, Pascal , Nathalie et Patricia) ont tous des compétences diverses, soit en informatique,  en science du comportement humain, comme prof. et surtout ce sont tous des lecteurs fanatiques de bandes dessinées. Également Patricia est reliée aux contreparties.

Présentement  nous avons aussi un dessinateur qui travaille à mettre en forme le scénario que j’écris qui se colle très souvent à la réalité mais  est également truffé de fiction.

objectifs que nous nous sommes fixés : une BD collée à la réalité des
jeunes, fantaisiste aussi pour capter leur intérêt et explorant leurs problèmes
les plus cruciaux à partir de personnages attachants. La recherche de
financement auprès d’organismes publics exige d’être prêt à faire des compromis
et est un parcours ardu qui risque d’épuiser notre créativité et de briser
notre élan.
Le scénario est déjà en place, la planification des pages déjà très avancée.
Le dessin se paie à la page et il en reste 37 à compléter sur 48 pages au total.  Il faut également y mettre la couleur. Ces opérations demanderont presque la
moitié du montant.
Le travail est considérable et le dessinateur mérite ce qu’il demande pour
chacune des pages mais si nous n’atteignons pas le montant total, il faudrait
penser à étaler la réalisation sur un temps plus long.


Le financement servira aussi  à engager
les fonds nécessaires pour imprimer la BD avec une couverture rigide, 48 pages
couleurs de qualité, (également page de garde, reliure, emballage,
livraison etc.). Cette impression grugera une grande partie de l'autre moitié
du montant demandé. Nous avons besoin d’argent pour cette impression qui est
prévue au Québec pour l’instant mais si le montant total n’était pas atteint,
il faudrait chercher une impression à un coût moindre. Évidemment, il faut assurer les
contreparties. Et nous le ferons avec
plaisir.
Si notre objectif est dépassé,
nous pourrons entreprendre de faire dessiner
la deuxième BD de cette série dont le scénario est déjà écrit. Cette BD a
des objectifs tout aussi audacieux. Elle est faite pour capter l’intérêt des
jeunes, susciter leur passion et leur attachement à ces personnages sympathiques.
Nous sommes une équipe passionnée
et nous tirerons profit de chaque sous que vous investirez pour vous offrir un
produit de qualité qui sera un succès parce que nous avons déjà la preuve qu’il
plaira aux jeunes que nous désirons atteindre.
Extrait d’un témoignage d’un
jeune rejoint lors du sondage :
« …Cette BD a beaucoup de réalisme, me fait
des émotions, a mon mode de vie. Cette BD va faire un malheur, j’en suis sûr.
Cette BD m’a fait une explosion de plaisir.

De la part d’un lecteur sympathique 
W..H. »
Indiegogo est pour nous une
plateforme extraordinaire car elle nous permettrait de mettre au monde cette
BD.



Comment pouvez-vous nous aider? 
Aide
essentielle :




Vous pouvez réellement nous aider. Même si dans les contreparties qui suivent, il
est mentionné des montants impressionnants, un $20.00 est une aide
extraordinaire pour nous.
Savez-vous que seulement 1,500 personnes qui accepteraient d’investir
ce $20.00 nous permettraient de dépasser notre objectif.
$20 n’est pas un  montant énorme mais ça va faire une énorme
différence .
Merci de faire ça pour notre projet.


Voici également une aide appréciable :
Chaque personne qui souhaite nous aider peut le faire facilement.
Ce projet de BD a besoin d’être connu. Choisissez parmi vos contacts les personnes les plus susceptibles de nous aider d’une manière ou d’une autre.
Soit parce qu’elles possèdent un très grand nombre de contacts dans leur carnet d’adresses à qui elles peuvent écrire ou qu’elles disposent d’un peu d’argent à investir.
Faites parvenir un message personnel à ces contacts en les dirigeant vers Indiegogo pour leur permettre de connaître Tommy et Cloé.



Mille
mercis pour ce coup de main essentiel.


Pour ceux qui voudraient
se réserver une copie de la BD

Contactez-nous
à l’adresse suivante : contact@tommyetcloe.com
pour nous laisser votre adresse e-mail et nous vous contacterons quand la
BD sera disponible.

Équipe



Je vous présente mon équipe. Il y a d’abord, moi,
je suis le porteur du projet et j’ai plusieurs années d’expérience dans le
réseau de la Santé et des Services Sociaux au Québec.
Au début de ma carrière j’ai travaillé auprès des
jeunes, comme prof, animatrice et soutien au niveau de plusieurs programmes.
À travers ce parcours, je me suis éprise de la
Bande dessinée, une réelle passion. Je l’ai utilisée dans le cadre de mes
interventions auprès des jeunes. J’ai conçu la BD Tommy et Cloé.
Dans
l’équipe de production, il y a aussi mon conjoint, mon lecteur , un critique
avisé et un soutien également indéfectible. Il accomplit les indispensables
tâches administratives.
Les
autres membres de l’équipe (Annie-Justine, Vincent, Pascal , Nathalie et
Patricia) ont tous des compétences diverses, soit en informatique,  en
science du comportement humain, comme prof. et surtout ce sont tous des
lecteurs fanatiques de bandes dessinées. Également Patricia
est reliée aux contreparties.
Présentement  nous avons aussi un dessinateur qui travaille à mettre en forme le scénario que j’écris qui se colle très souvent à la réalité mais  est également truffé de fiction.

story:
Synopsis

Welcome to Only Human. An ongoing Comic Book Series about a true underdog. 12-year-old Wesley must defeat 7 eternal evils AND save the world from a New Age Zombie Apocalypse.

Wait!? Don’t like zombies? Don’t worry this is far beyond just another zombie book. Our zombies are just another character in a much larger cast.

Advance Praise for Only Human

“Love the way you take everyone’s points of view and split them up throughout the series… I’m really excited about this comic book and I really don’t get excited about a lot of comic books… There are only a handful that I can’t say enough good about and this is one of them. Everything from splitting everything up to the different points of view to the artistic design and the overall feel and take on the new zombie idea. It really does hit home. Where a person could sit back and be like, ‘dude that’s deep.’ You are doing a fantastic job with it and quite frankly I can’t wait to get my hands on some physical issues. Because I want to collect them, bag them and board them, this is good stuff man... We as readers appreciate a new take on the genre. I want to see something slightly different from the traditional hack and slash, and this is it.“ Tangent Bound Network

http://tangentboundnetwork.com/episode-85-only-human/

“The book is unlike anything I’ve read before… You’ll find these characters to be a lot more relatable than other comic book people… Other than the surreal art style and the relatable characters, Only Human also has the one thing everyone loves to hate and hates to love—cliffhangers. I remember getting to the end of the first issue and instantly feeling that all too recognizable feeling of “Wait, no! Finish now! Don’t make me wait!” It seriously got me hooked! All in all, Only Human is an enticing read, an underdog unfairly buried under the hype of comic powerhouses Marvel and DC. Well I for one believe that it deserves to receive the same praise as the comic book stories of The Walking Dead or any superhero comic! If you don’t believe me, then pick up a copy of Only Human and decide for yourself!” – MovieFinatic.com

http://moviefinatic.com/articles/zombies-and-mayhem-a-review-of-only-human

“I gotta tell you, I wasn’t lying when I said it was a real page turner. I really couldn’t pay attention to anything else while I was reading the book. You’ve definitely found a way of captivating the audience.” Comic Book Lovers

https://www.facebook.com/groups/1469729639910290/

Meet the Cast



Sample Pages

Perks

With your support we can be on a regular release schedule. Here’s how you can help:

Where will we be next?

Do you have a Comic Shop? We want you to carry our Book. Current locations:

Add these on to any pledge level at no additional domestic shipping cost.

If we reach certain levels, you get more for free! So spread the word!

This is a 0 profit campaign. Meaning that every dollar you pledge is going out to pay for the costs listed above. We want to stretch every dollar as far as it will go so we have responsibly sourced printing, production, and efficient packaging/promotions. So every $1 you pledge today will have the effective power of $2!

Risks & Challenges

Now having several books in print we have a strong grasp on what readers demand. Also, having the honor of working on multiple ongoing properties and doing Comic Book Creation workshops, have helped me to grow a lot as a creator and storyteller.

*Fine Print

*Cover of actual issue #2 will vary. Still a work in progress.

*Variant issues will include 1 of the variants of that book available for fulfillment. We cannot guarantee a particular variant is available at the time your order is shipped. Although we will do our best to accommodate special requests.

*Ads must be all-age appropriate and must be pre-approved. We retain the right to cancel and refund any advertisement that we do not find suitable for our audience. Also ad graphics must have a high quality look and feel to match the rest of the book. If the ad does not meet the quality standard we will attempt to work with you to bring the ad content up to par.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with others!
Post to social media!
Post to Facebook!
Post to Twitter!
Post to instagram!
Like: www.facebook.com/onlyhumancomic
Follow: www.twitter.com/onlyhumancomic
Follow: www.instagram.com/onlyhumancomic
visit: www.onlyhumanhq.com

story:
Gone are the days of swashbuckling stories shoving women into the background. Gone are the swoons and corsets and impractical heels. Embrace an adventure that lays siege to issues of gender, race and sexuality while engaging readers in the tale of a captain who always gets her girl.

Black Gold follows the story of Captain Jacqueline DeBeau and the crew of the Siren Queen as they sail the 19th century waters of the Mediterranean raiding merchant ships in the name of fortune and fame. Captain Jaq steers her ship with an iron fist. She demands respect and accepts nothing but utmost loyalty from her men. The crew of the Siren Queen never takes prisoners. Jaq DeBeau disallows the trade of human flesh - either for labor or pleasure - making her the toughest pirate captain to serve under. 


But when a loot job goes bad, Jaq doesn't command the loyalty she thought she did.

Help us fund a comic and launch a series.

This is a follow-up campaign. Our first attempt raised just enough to cover all the concept artwork. Hurdle one? Conquered. Now we're moving into production. Right now, the first issue of Black Gold is set to be a preview comic. It's twenty pages of piratey, actiony goodness that sets up a five act graphic novel and makes you want the rest of the series. 


Pencils, ink and color is going to run us $840. Lettering is going to be $10 a page. And whatever is left, should we hit our goal, is going toward a first print run and fulfilling perks. So all of the money will be going toward getting the comic finished, produced and printed so everyone can have a copy.


Since launching our Indiegogo campaign, we've been blessed to gain a financial investor to the Black Gold crew. The comic is now funded 100%!! This campaign page is now for pre-orders of the comic. Get your copy and join the crew while orders are open! All proceeds of this Indiegogo campaign are going toward a first print run~

The Perks

  • $5 -- Comics for the frugal - or environmentally conscious. Once Black Gold is finished, we'll email you a PDF copy (before anyone gets print copies!).
  • $20 -- In addition to your advance PDF copy, you're also going to get a color print copy mailed to your home along with a Black Gold post card to thank you for backing our project.
  • $50 -- If you carry a different bag each day of Comic Con (because each one gets full of goodies), then this perk is for you. Sure, you'll get to pick up a comic (in color, of course), but you'll also get all those goodies. There's no telling what you'll get. But leave us your shirt size. Oh... spoiler.
  • $500 -- Are you crazy? Oh, good. We like crazy, and this is some crazy support. Back us at this level, and you'll get yourself written into the comic. There's only one perk at this level, so when it's gone, it's gone. But it'll be worth it to see yourself crossing swords with Captain DeBeau. (Comic and swag bag included, of course.)

  • $2 -- Electronic copy of Black Gold. Get in on the action before anyone else!
  • $5 -- Grab your print copy of Black Gold before they're no longer available!
  • $50 -- Swag Bag o' Pirate Booty. And a comic, of course!

The Goal

Being a queer kid of the nineties the only representation of female and LGBT characters in mainstream media I saw was a joke - still is, really. Because of this, I saw a lot of stuff online that no teenager should ever be exposed to. So, when I was finally handed my college degree, I knew there was only one route to take. I had to use my powers for good.

Black Gold isn't about forcing a woman into a man's role - or a lesbian into the fray. My goal is to simply give comic readers a great story with the action and adventure (and a hint of romance) they crave - with a protagonist who just so happens to be a lesbian. No token characters - just to say they're there - but characters who are people. Normal people.

Because, in the end, Black Gold isn't about nuance or novelty; it's about normalcy. 

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD

Even if you can't contribute financially, sharing #BlackGoldComic and this campaign with your friends, family and followers can be just as valuable. Share a link on Facebook. Like our Facebook page. Follow us on Twitter. This is the very essence of a grassroots project, and it'll only be successful with your help and support. Whether this is the beginning of a series or an epic one shot is wholly up to you and that "share" button.

story:
Discover an all new Superhero!  Detrimony #1 is a 24 page comic book that is original in the fact that the main character‘s power is more of a curse than a gift.  The more angry Mason gets the worse “The Storm” will become.  I welcome you to the beginning of a story that will intrigue you and have you wondering what’s next at the end of each issue.  The first 8  issues are written and book #1 is complete.

My name is Daniel Buck, and I’m the creator of Detrimony.  I’m a mild mannered salesman by day and comic book creator by night.  I grew up in both Sargent and Omaha, Nebraska.  I started drawing in grade school and remember practicing to get better at an early age.  By 5th grade I was considered the artist of my class and I just kind of owned it and kept at it.  I‘ve always loved comic books and have drawn superheros for most of my life.  I‘m happily married to “The Luckiest Girl in the World” and a father to 3 great kids.  I appreciate you for checking this out and hope you back my Detrimony Project!  

Detrimony #1 has two covers available both pictured below.  

 

Cover A (pencils by the talented Vince Sunico, inks and colors by Daniel Buck)

 

 

 

Cover B (art by Daniel Buck)

 

 I chose $1000 as a funding amount so I can continue onto the second book with money to pay a couple other artist and speed thing up a bit instead of doing everything on my own.  I’ve hired two cover artist for book 2. One of which I’ve known since I was 5 years old, Robert Mangen, his work is sick and I can’t wait to have it included in book two he is doing 10 pages of pencils for me, I’ve included a cover Robert is working on so you can see what I’m talking about.  I will still be inking and coloring his work.

 

Cover for book 2 (art by Robert Mangen) 

 

I also have an awesome letter guy, Jeff Brennan, he did the letters on book one and they turned out great, I’ve already paid up front for book two.  I just wanted to mention this so you can see I’m really determined to get a second book out and keep the ball moving.  I’m doing most the work myself but having a bit of help will allow me to get more issues out faster and keep up on the quality especially with those I have selected. 

I’ve spent a lot of time developing/designing the characters and the story to ensure a fun ride and hope you give Detrimony a shot!  The price I am charging per book, is half the cost of a self-published black and white book I just purchased.   Detrimony is full color, half the cost, and much better. Let me know if you have any questions. Please pay close attention to the rewards included in each tier.  To get a signed book you must pledge $20 or more. 

I also posted my “stretch goals” below. Each goal hit will unlock extra rewards.  For example, if the campaign reaches a total of 150 Backers then everyone that pledged $20 or more gets an extra signed copy.  Check them out more below. 

Most all rewards will arrive in August Of this year.

 

Stretch Goal Print by Anand Ramcheron

 

Stretch Goal Print by Cory Hamscher

 

 

My family and I thank you!

 

 

Risks and challenges

My biggest risk is putting all this time and money into Detrimony and not having a distributor. 

I came up with Detrimony long ago but didn’t have all the tools to put it together. I found I didn’t know how to digitally color and that it was harder to learn than I thought. I also considered myself good on a computer but was always having to watch YouTube videos to figure out how to resize an image or how to change from one type of file to the next or to compress a file and several other tasks that would seem simple but I just hadn’t learned them before and it was really time consuming. Once I had drawn pages 1-16 in pencil and then inked them all I bought a Wacom Cintque to digitally color the pages and felt like I was coloring like a child. I took an entire year off from the book to learn how to digitally color through YouTube tutorials. I colored the 16 pages when I was ready, and have been moving forward ever since. 

Book 2 will be done using my new IPad using Procreate.  I really can’t wait for you to get a book and promise to fully deliver on everything mentioned.

I took an entire year off from the book to learn how to digitally color through YouTube tutorials. I colored the 16 pages when I was ready, and have been moving forward ever since. Book 2 will be done using my new IPad using Procreate.  I really can’t wait for you to get a book and promise to fully deliver on everything mentioned.

story:
WICKED is a 36-page full-color comic with backup features, written by the editor of video-games like Bloody Chronicles, Panty Party, and School of Talent Suzu-Route and the concept artist behind new more room hell. 

 

The Mind Behind WICKED

 

Hello! I'm Ouroboros Moon, Ori for short. I have been writing fiction for years, and as a young pitiful-earth child. I've always conjured up stories filling them with colorful characters in insane worlds, sharing them with anyone, and everyone who would listen and read. Which isn't many people (to be honest). But overtime as I kept at it. I’ve progressed quite a bit in my writing ability, formulating longer and more complex stories. As a now a self-proclaimed writer, anime-enthusiast, manga enthusiast, and even a part-time video game developer. So, I consider myself a professional storyteller! Who is adept at using my imaginative thinking and creative flair to bring my stories to life in engaging and entertaining ways. 

WICKED is a project that I've always wanted to publish for years. Currently I wrote a few versions of the story but as time went on the story evolved spawning this unique universe, out of another that was greatly different. Making WICKED's main narrative, a hodgepodge of ideas--that sung a beautiful song of entropy. 

  • Story: Ouroboros Moon 
  • Consulting Editor: Bill Williams
  • Main Art: Joesph (SickJoe) Gay
  • Letters: Joesph (SickJoe) Gay
  • Cover Artist: Matthew Weldon
  • Cover Artist: Ben Juniu
  • Character Designer: Momo
  • Character Designer: Aurimas Jucys
  • Character Designer: Andres Blanco
  • Character Designer: Black0Choco
  • Character Designer: Nikola Cizmesija
  • Character Designer: Ben Juniu

 

MY EDITORIAL & WRITING PORTFOLIO 

I've also work'd on some H-TYPE games but you don't wanna see any of those. 

 

The Artist Behind WICKED Joesph (SickJoe) Gay

Joe is a action and horror Indie artist, that did concept press release work for the Half Life 2 mod No More Room in Hell (that has over 1 million downloads), as well as the Zombie Panic spiritual successor Contagion by Monochrome Inc. 

 

JOE'S ART PORTFOLIO

 

 

 

What We Need To Make WICKED A Reality 

We actually have everything needed to make WICKED the best it can be, but we still need your help. It takes money to pay for professional art,. I've run all the numbers and here's the plan...

This funding is crucial to getting WICKED completed and distributed. I've been able to personally fund a portion of the project, but I need your help to bridge the gap. We need to raise a minimum of $2,800 to get this book made and onto your computer screen. Without your contributions, we can't do this. So, in return for your support, you get a piece of WICKED history in the form of one of our perks!

 

Perks

Take a look at all of the great tiers available to your right.

 

 

COVER ARTS & PROMOTIONAL ART

 

 

 

 

 

Work in Progress Pages for WICKED's

(Some) Early Development (Art For WICKED)

 

 

 

Stretch Goals & Milestones

(Locked) -- Free Comic - Under the Flesh (Comic 1 -3) unlocked when 25 backers is reached 

Locked) $2,800 - WICKED (issue zero) includes early development covers and designs 

(Locked) $5,600 - WICKED (issue one)  

(Locked) $8,400 - WICKED (issue two)

(Locked) $10,500 - WICKED issue zero (trade paperbacks editions, signed with backup feature comics by Joseph Gay. This also includes early development artwork and sketchs.)

(Locked) $11,200 - WICKED (issue three) 

(Locked) $14,000 - WICKED (issue four)

(Locked) $16,800 - WICKED (issue five) 

(Locked) $20,000 - WICKED becomes a on-going comic series! 

The Impact

WICKED is only possible with your support. It takes a lot of time, talent, dedication and money to produce a quality comic. Thank you!

 

Risks & Challenges

Timelines can be a challenge. That is why we are giving ourselves plenty of time to get this project finished and into your hands. I was very conservative with the timeline. The good news is, I'm not alone. I'm apart of a network of creators with successful campaigns who support each other. I view this project as a professional responsibility and I keep my commitments.

I am very transparent about the progress and process so you know exactly what is going on.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this campaign on social media and suggest it to friends.
  • Thank you!

 

GIVEAWAY INFORMATION

IMPORTANT NOTE - Giveaway is only available for residents of the United States of America and will be distributed fairly (in the bullet-points listed below) among those who support and donate toward this campaign. The winners of this giveaway will be drawn at random, at the end of this indie-gogo campaign. While the rewards will be distributed after the campaign funds have been received. 

The winner will be able to choose only one of the bullet-pointed rewards!  (You can't mix.) 

GIVEAWAY ITEMS. 

  • All Volumes of Golden Kamuy (1 to 4 + 5 & 7)
  • Drifters Volume 1 to 3 + Spider-Man 790 & 800 (signed by Dan Slot) 
  • Batman #50 (signed by Tom King) + Neon Genesis Evangelion Omnibus (Both)
  • Batman #50 (signed by Tom King) + Guardians  of the Galaxy How To Draw Groot 
  • Spider-Man Family Business (Signed by Mark Waid) + Fantastic Four (Signed by Dan Slot) 
  • Wolf Rain Trilogy DVDs +  She's the Ultimate Weapon  Battle Angel Alita Origins Volume 1 + Starwars Lost Stars
  • Durararara!! Volumes 1 to 4 + Durarara Yellow Scarves Arc (Vol 1 + 2) 
  • Lone Wolf & Cub (Hardcover) + Hellsing Volume 6 + APOSMIZ Volume 1 + Made in the Abyss Volume 1 + Durarara Sakai Arc (Volume 1 - 3) + Kaguya-sama Love & War Volumes 1 to 4

 

Social Media Account

https://twitter.com/Ouroboros_Moon

 

PREVIEW INFORMATION

The below pages are previews for the other comics that are included when you back/support WICKED's indie-go-go

 

 

HELLGORYTHM (PREVIEW) 

When the biotech companies started their body modifications, a race for people to express their individuality, their "truer selves" began. It didn't take long for degeneracy and vice to become rampant. In the corporatocracy of the future, those without money were left to fend for themselves against violent, technologically advanced super humans. Everything changed when the mysterious bounty hunting organization called the Hellgorythm was introduced to urban cities. No one knew where the bounty stations came from, only that there was good money involved and it kept them safe...

 

 

PUNCHLINE PREVIEW

 

OUTRIDER PREVIEW

Sheriff Sylvana, after repelling a raid on her city by savage outsiders, learns of a nefarious plot being carried out by her city's government. Along with her pet sugar glider, Leaf, and a bookish monk named Clem, Sheriff Syl begins her investigation.

story:
Who we are

Three Men in a Boot are a small group of Oxford based comics. Olly Jackson is the Writer, Jack Sutton is the improviser, and Wesley Nelson...um...he also takes part. 
They're passionately dedicated to three things: making people smile, making each other smile, and Earl Grey tea. Although you can't help with the last one, you can help with the first two.
Three Men in a Boot have (somehow) procured a place at the Fringe! Taking place in the Just the Tonic - The Little Kirk Room, throughout the entirety of August. They need your help to make it happen. 
What makes life harder for the three of them, but much better for everyone else, is that the show is being performed for FREE, so as many people as possible can come see it.

What We Need 

  • We're asking you kind folks for a hearty £2000, this won't nearly cover our costs for the trip, but it will help keep the bank off our backs! Plus we're putting the show on for FREE, so any help is dearly welcome.
  • Although this is no small amount of money, and we understand if some people can't stretch to much, all donations large and small will get us closer to being able to fulfil our dream.

Challenges

For three students, reaching Edinburgh is quite a feat. It took a huge amount of work to get to this point, and it seems a shame that we might fail due to financial restrictions. For the Fringe to work, we must cover transport costs, food costs, and accommodation costs (all at the busiest time of the year!) although the majority of this will come from our own pockets, any help is appreciated!

Other Ways You Can Help

Come and see our show, if you hit up the Fringe!
