story:
Are you looking for a high-octane, outrageous romp of a comic filled with murderous mailmen, angry accountants, aliens, space pirates, betrayal, and a whole lot of punching?

Good—because if you play your cards right, you just might find yourself the proud owner of SPACE BASTARDS, an over-sized hardcover comic book collection featuring art by co-creator Darick Robertson (the incomparable artist for The Boys), Simon Bisley (Lobo), Boo Cook (2000AD), Colin MacNeil (Judge Dredd), and Clint Langley (2000AD), all courtesy of the tireless folks at the Intergalactic Postal Service.

Who are these SPACE BASTARDS of which you speak?

Rewind. In the distant year of 2014, the plucky writers of SPACE BASTARDS approached artist Darick Robertson at Comic-Con International with the utmost professionalism and eloquently pitched him SPACE BASTARDS, which he immediately signed onto***.

*while he was trapped in a bathroom stall

** threw toddler-level rough sketches at him while pleading for his help

*** only agreed once we promised we would never do anything like this again

The result? SPACE BASTARDS Vol. 1, which was funded on Kickstarter back in the good old days of 2019.

But what actually is SPACE BASTARDS, you beautiful SOBs?!

In the future, violence is everywhere. Corporations are exploiting the weak and disenfranchised. And while America has taken to the cosmos, unemployment is rampant, infrastructure is crumbling, and basic services are unreliable. Getting mail between planets is damn near impossible. The Intergalactic Postal Service offers the best paying, yet deadliest, jobs in the universe.

In the Intergalactic Postal Service there are only three rules:

- Whoever delivers the package gets paid.

- A postal worker may kill or incapacitate any other postal worker to steal a package and deliver it themself.

- The more times a parcel changes hands, the higher the payout for completing that delivery. 

The wild ensemble cast of SPACE BASTARDS features an unemployed accountant, a death row inmate, a divorced real estate agent, an alien immigrant, a raging alcoholic, a retired privateer, and a former executive assistant in their new lives delivering packages for the Intergalactic Postal Service. Under the volatile leadership of Postmaster General Roy Sharpton, these Space Bastards are forever at each other’s throats trying to settle scores and earn big money.

No paperwork. No boss. No punching a clock (though someone somewhere is definitely getting punched). The courier that actually delivers the package gets paid. The ones that don't—even if they survive—get squat.

ENTER: SPACE BASTARDS "Directors' cut" Hardcovers.

These books are MASSIVE. Teeming with ultraviolence, humor, and face-melting artwork from amazing artists like Darick Robertson, Simon Bisley, Colin MacNeil, Boo Cook, Clint Langley & more, these 130+ page tomes are just over a foot in height so you can pore over every detail. 

The first two volumes of this magnificent series have already been produced.  With SPACE BASTARDS Volume 1, you’ll get TWO complete chapters with artwork by SPACE BASTARDS co-creator Darick Robertson...

A charming tale of a man wrestling with his inner demons with artwork by Simon Bisley...

Plus a slew of in-universe extras!

And Volume 2, which was just successfully Kickstarted, contains two more brilliant chapters by Darick Robertson...

An amazing introduction to "Resurrection" Mary with artwork by Colin MacNeil...

And a gritty story about a man forced out of retirement with artwork by Clint Langley...

 

Didn't I hear you already had a deal with the publisher Humanoids?

Great question, inquisitive imaginary reader. You might have heard that esteemed publisher Humanoids is publishing SPACE BASTARDS as periodical comic books, which will be the very first time SPACE BASTARDS is available at discerning comic shops across the country. That’s exciting! And that's how most people are going to find and experience the story. (But you're here, so clearly you AREN'T 'most people'...)

We’re bringing SPACE BASTARDS to Indiegogo so we can continue to pay advances to the artists -- and keep telling the sick, twisted stories of the Intergalactic Postal Service OUR way.  These Hardcover Volumes are for collectors, for fans of our artists, and for everyone who appreciates a more dynamic, less linear version of the story. Here we present SPACE BASTARDS in Tarantino-esque fashion. Our version dives down rabbit holes and takes the round about way so that you get the whole story the way we originally intended. It's a presentation that just wouldn't work as a monthly release. And it's freaking huge, did we mention that?

 

“A series of surreal and often bloody vignettes by some of the best artists in the business… A Looney Tunes-esque parade of debauchery and dynamism, as these artists work their magic to produce a comprehensive, and quite crazy, portrait of a universe gone mad.”—SCREENRANT

 

“Tarantino like… Who better to bring their story to life than The Boys’ Darick Robertson? If there is anyone who could depict this brand of action mixed with touches of humor and the aforementioned over the top violence, it is Robertson. And man does he come through.”—GEEK VIBES NATION

 

"New planets!, corrupt governments!, aliens!, dinosaurs! and blatant sexuality!. That hologram naked lady newscaster was interesting… This first issue is chock full of the best kind of insanity. I am dancing in my seat waiting to see what comes next. This has totally hooked me, and if you need a laugh, it’ll hook you too!”—FANGIRL NATION

 

“Robertson brings all of his famous grit and gore to Space Bastards...Space Bastards is about as crazy as it sounds. It’s a blood-splattered charge across the galaxy, with lots of parcels to deliver.”— MONKEYS FIGHTING ROBOTS

 

“A glorious grim, gritty and darkly humoured debut… A brash, ballsy book with a dark and satisfying humour running through it, with not one but two revelations at the end that should have you hungry for more.”—COMICON.COM

 

“Interesting to say the least… an original concept with a lot of violence and action to get your teeth into.”—IMPULSE GAMER

 

Risks and challenges

We have fully produced and printed SPACE BASTARDS Volume 1 and Volume 2. All artists, letterers, and colorists have already been paid. If you pledge, you will be getting one sent to you as soon as this campaign ends. The only challenges/risks are those inherent in shipping a three-pound oversized book. We will be using corrugated folding mailers and bubble wrap to make sure the book gets to you undamaged. *SHIPPING IS EXTRA* The big risk to this campaign will be international shipping costs. On top of that, some, but not all, international backers will have to pay import tax and duty upon receiving their rewards.

Please see FAQ for ESTIMATES before pledging.

There may be some delays with the mail itself, because delivering mail is hard (especially in a pandemic). The USPS has nothing on the Intergalactic Postal Service. *PLEASE READ THE FAQ BEFORE PLEDGING!*

Oh yeah, one more challenge: Keanu was not involved in producing this book/campaign.

Great question, inquisitive imaginary reader. You might have heard that esteemed publisher Humanoids is publishing SPACE BASTARDS as periodical comic books, which will be the very first time SPACE BASTARDS is available at discerning comic shops across the country. That’s exciting! And that's how most people are going to find and experience the story. (But you're here, so clearly you AREN'T 'most people'...)
We’re bringing SPACE BASTARDS to Indiegogo so we can continue to pay advances to the artists -- and keep telling the sick, twisted stories of the Intergalactic Postal Service OUR way.  These Hardcover Volumes are for collectors, for fans of our artists, and for everyone who appreciates a more dynamic, less linear version of the story. Here we present SPACE BASTARDS in Tarantino-esque fashion. Our version dives down rabbit holes and takes the round about way so that you get the whole story the way we originally intended. It's a presentation that just wouldn't work as a monthly release. And it's freaking huge, did we mention that?
 
“A series of surreal and often bloody vignettes by some of the best artists in the business… A Looney Tunes-esque parade of debauchery and dynamism, as these artists work their magic to produce a comprehensive, and quite crazy, portrait of a universe gone mad.”—SCREENRANT
 
“Tarantino like… Who better to bring their story to life than The Boys’ Darick Robertson? If there is anyone who could depict this brand of action mixed with touches of humor and the aforementioned over the top violence, it is Robertson. And man does he come through.”—GEEK VIBES NATION
 
"New planets!, corrupt governments!, aliens!, dinosaurs! and blatant sexuality!. That hologram naked lady newscaster was interesting… This first issue is chock full of the best kind of insanity. I am dancing in my seat waiting to see what comes next. This has totally hooked me, and if you need a laugh, it’ll hook you too!”—FANGIRL NATION
 
“Robertson brings all of his famous grit and gore to Space Bastards...Space Bastards is about as crazy as it sounds. It’s a blood-splattered charge across the galaxy, with lots of parcels to deliver.”— MONKEYS FIGHTING ROBOTS
 
“A glorious grim, gritty and darkly humoured debut… A brash, ballsy book with a dark and satisfying humour running through it, with not one but two revelations at the end that should have you hungry for more.”—COMICON.COM
 
“Interesting to say the least… an original concept with a lot of violence and action to get your teeth into.”—IMPULSE GAMER
 
Risks and challenges
We have fully produced and printed SPACE BASTARDS Volume 1 and Volume 2. All artists, letterers, and colorists have already been paid. If you pledge, you will be getting one sent to you as soon as this campaign ends. The only challenges/risks are those inherent in shipping a three-pound oversized book. We will be using corrugated folding mailers and bubble wrap to make sure the book gets to you undamaged. *SHIPPING IS EXTRA* The big risk to this campaign will be international shipping costs. On top of that, some, but not all, international backers will have to pay import tax and duty upon receiving their rewards.
Please see FAQ for ESTIMATES before pledging.
There may be some delays with the mail itself, because delivering mail is hard (especially in a pandemic). The USPS has nothing on the Intergalactic Postal Service. *PLEASE READ THE FAQ BEFORE PLEDGING!*
Oh yeah, one more challenge: Keanu was not involved in producing this book/campaign.

story:
Click here to get a free 50+ page preview!

 

I loved Lovecraft even before I knew his name. His lore permeated every inch of my childhood. I didn't know, for instance, that H. P. Lovecraft was the mind behind the Necronomicon when I watched Evil Dead. I didn't know he was the grandfather of psychological horror as I binged In the Mouth of Madness, Jacob's Ladder, Aliens, and dozens of other terrifying movies in my youth. 

I didn't even know Lovecraft created Cthulhu until well after I called the Great Old One's name. However, the older I got, the more I grew to appreciate the warped mind behind some of my all-time favorite things, and I wanted to create something that could show that love, with people who loved Lovecraft as much as I did, for people who loved Lovecraft as much as me.

And Cthulhu is Hard to Spell is the result of that process.

After the success of my first anthology, Monsters and Other Scary S^&t, I asked my fans, and fans of the book, what we should cover next, and they told me Lovecraft. 

Immediately, I was like "YESSSSS!!!!" 

Monsters and Other Scary S^&t was all about how monsters can represent anything from cute to scary and everything in between, and Cthulhu is Hard to Spell is just like that, but with Lovecraft. It's 35 stories that show just how deeply Lovecraft has permeated the  essence of our culture. 

When I create a book, the first thing I sit down to figure out is how my book can be different from everything else on the market. After all, there are HUNDREDS of Lovecraft anthologies out there, both from Lovecraft himself and from loads of authors who have carried the torch for him in the last century. 

Additionally, there are tons of stories told from a Lovecraftian horror point of view, dealing with the creepy, unsettling nature of humanity. I didn't think we could compete with those, nor did I want to, either. 

There is one thing I love, though, that I haven't seen a lot previously...a book devoted to the mythology of Lovecraft's universe. 

You see, I've always been fascinated by the gods and monsters of Lovecraft, and I never seemed to get enough of them in the stories I read. Most Lovecraft stories are filled with the horror aspect of Lovecraft, but low on the mythology. 

But my favorite part of Lovecraft is the mythology he crafted, the gods he made, and the way that mythology differed from the myths of every other mythology out there. So that's what I set out to create.

Cthulhu is Hard to Spell is a book steeped in the mythology and gods of Lovecraft. The stories inside it's pages follow the spirit of Lovecraft, but often strays from the tone of Lovecraftian horror. 

Sure, some of the stories in this book are Lovecraftian in nature down to their very core, but there are also funny stories, cute stories, fantasy stories, sci-fi stories, and much, much more which build on the Lovecraftian mythos. 

If you love the gods and monsters of Lovecraft, then Cthulhu is Hard to Spell is going to be your jam. 

Best of all, this anthology is ALL AGES APPROPRIATE. These aren't stories made for children necessarily, at least not all of them, but we toned down the cursing (there is none), the violence (there is no blood), and there was never any sex, to make sure you could show it to your child, even if they won't understand it all. 

I've had conversations with many people at shows asking for a book to indoctrinate their children, grandchildren, nieces, nephews, cousins, etc, into loving creepy things, and I think this book is a great primer for that, while being enjoyable to people who already love the creepy, too. 

We listened to you from the last anthology, and made sure this was: 

-Appropriate for all ages (even though we deal with some very dark topics) 

-Full color

-Shorter stories (2, 4, 6, or 8 pages) 

-All stories are even numbers, so they begin and end on the same page throughout. 

We used your feedback to make this anthology even better! You opinions are very important to us, and we appreciate them very much. 

Backers really loved our first anthology

The real reason we're doing a second anthology is because backers and fans loved our first anthology so much. I was hesitant to do a second anthology before the Monsters and Other Scary S^&t campaign launched. 

However, the response from backers was so positive that I gladly decided to go into the fray a second time. There is nothing like geeking out about something with creators and fans, and that is what our anthologies allow us to do.

Check out the reaction to our last anthology. We hope this anthology has an even better reaction! 

We brought back a bunch of creators from the first book and added a ton of new faces so we can make this book even more amazing! 

Who am I? 

 My name is Russell Nohelty, publisher of Wannabe Press, a small press that creates weird books for weird people, creator of Katrina Hates Dead S%&t, Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter, and Pixie Dust, along with the editor of both the Monsters and other Scary S^&t, and this anthology.  

I have raised over $100,000 on crowdfunding from 8 different projects, and have gotten exceedingly good at crafting amazing books which audiences love. My previous two projects, Monsters and Other Scary S^&t and Pixie Dust, both raised north of $25,000 from over 600 backers each. 

What are some of the stories in this book? 

Nora (art and words by Angela Oddling) -- a dejected teenager living in an ice village sets out to find Aphoom-Zhah and thaw his cold heart. 

The Dunwich Boys (art by Esther Pimentel, words by Eddy Hedington, letters by Nikki Powers) -- Yog-Sothoth has materialized in a house in Dunwich, and the Dunwich boys have to banish it from their neighborhood. 

The Eternal War (art and words by Eric Young) -- A retelling of the origin story of Lovecraft's universe, translated from the Voynich manuscript. 

Cat is Cryptic (art and words by Megan Hutchison) -- a story about the Cats of Ulthar, from Lovecraft's Dreamlands.

Tsathoggua's Triumph (art by John Edingfield II, words by Clay Adams) -- Tsathoggua dreams of his eventual conquest of the universe. 

Cleaning the Mess (story and art by Brandon Perlow, words by Paul J. Mendoza, Letters by Wilson Ramos, Jr.) -- Cthulhu has conquered another world, but all he really wants is his master to come find him. 

Song for the Harbinger (art by Brianna Gilmartin, words by Heather Kenealy) -- Ghroth doesn't understand why nobody likes his singing, all he wants to do is harmonize with planets, and they keep blowing up. 

The Yag-Kosha Mystery (art and words by Kelly Dochy) -- Yag-Kosha, the pacifist alien, has a mysterious koan for you. 

Mons (art and words by Matthew Childers) --Explorers on Mars find an ancient tome that could unlock the secrets of the universe, or unleash a Lovecraftian horror. 

The Summoning of Brkthruslpk (art by Robin Dassen, words by Don Perkins) -- A group of kids works to summon the ancient god Brkthruslpk onto the world. 

No DQ (art and words by Ryan Fisher) -- A weak, sickly wrestling fan gets to live out his fantasy of being a star after a mysterious stranger endowing him with an enchanted garment. 

Slumber (art by Lloyd Ladera, words by Sarah Anderson) -- After being woken up on a spaceship, a man has to escape the Lovecraftian horror chasing him. 

That's Cthulhu to You (art by Zac Skellington, words by Leo Baxter Kiker) -- An oddities store gets a new pet: Cthulhu. 

How to Summon the Dark Lord Hastur (Art by Cara Stemo, words by Johnny C, letters by Travis Duda, logo design by Nathan Burns) -- A card game, a tragic birth, a goverment experiment, and a violent crime all converge to release a deadly horror on the world. 

Church of Mormo (art by Claire Leslie, words by N.S. Kane) -- Greek spirit Mormo goes door to door trying to recruit Cthulhu worshipers to her cause. 

She Came Upon a Great Tree (art by Nick Kremenek, words by Mike Speakman, edited by Greg Smith) -- A delivery driver and part-time cultist must find a great tree to unleash Cthulhu and Hastur onto the world. 

Flycatcher (art by Dan Scalisi, words by Frank Martin) -- Even though they have been warned for years, the fly people of Dipterra are not prepared for the wrath of Yba'sokug. 

The Rally (art and words by Mary Bellamy) -- Lucifer needs new generals, and has decided to recruit Lovecraftian gods to his cause. 

Why is this book going to be so awesome? 

1. It's 176 pages of glorious comics! - That's a massive amount of awesome comics about monsters! Over 150 pages and 35 stories!

2. It's gonna be in hardcover! - There are lots of comics, but how many are printed in hardcover? Not many! 

3. All the UV spotting! There's gonna be spot UV all over the cover. I love spot UV and I've gotten exceedingly good at using it over the years. There might even be a little surprise if we can blow past our regular goal on that front. 

4. Glossy art paper - Most books are printed in gloss lamination, trapping all the glorious line work under an ugly, gross, yellow film. This anthology is different. It's printed on glossy art paper, which means the ink shines on top of the paper and looks like it's simmering, just like the any other art book on the market today. After all, we believe that comics are beautiful works of art and should be printed as such. 

5. Our creators have credits from all your favorites companies. Our creators have worked with Marvel, DC, Oni, Tokyopop, Heavy Metal, Fantagraphics, Upper Deck, Sony, and more along with brands like Teen Titans, My Little Pony, Invader Zim, Ghostbusters,Horizon Zero Dawn, and more. We have creators who have been nominated for Eisners, won Glyphs, Silver Eagles, WGA awards, and more! 

6. There are just so many many Lovecraftian gods and monsters. There was only one rule in this anthology; all of the stories needed to contain at least one Lovecraftian god or monster. This book is full of different types gods you know like Cthulhu and Azathoth, and ones you've never heard of as well! 

And you can get the whole book, including shipping, plus a pdf copy AND audio commentary for just $40, INCLUDING SHIPPING (in the US, at least)! 

Who drew that dope cover? 

 It was drawn by Aaron Alexovich, creator of my favorite indie comic of all time, Serenity Rose, a 500+ page graphic novel about a previously famous witch trying to come to terms with her powers in a very weird town. Read it. Buy it. Love it.   

If you've never read that book, you probably know him from his work on Invader Zim, both the television show and more recently on the comic book. 

Aaron is a powerhouse in the world of indie books, and Zim is one of my favorite animated shows of all time. He also drew the cover for the Monsters and Other Scary S^&t anthology. I really wanted him to come back for this anthology too, and I was so stoked when he said yes!  

On top of it all, Aaron might be one of the few people on earth that loves Lovecraft, especially Cthulhu, even more than me, which I once didn't think possible.

Did Dirk Manning really write the foreword? 

Yes, Dirk Manning, an icon of independent Lovecraftian horror comics, wrote the foreword for Cthulhu is Hard to Spell. He didn't have time to contribute, but he asked me if he could do the foreword, and I of course said yes. 

Dirk has raised a ton of money for Nightmare World, Tales of Mr. Rhee, and more, and that he wanted to contribute to this book means the world to me. 

Here is a snippet of what he wrote, which made me smile. 

For now, take the time to enjoy this book.

While it’s (another) unspoken truth that anthologies are often a hit-and-miss prospect, I can honestly say that there wasn’t a story in this collection that I didn’t enjoy... which shouldn’t be surprising since it’s a reminder that just like you’re not alone in what you know and feel, these stories reminded me I’m not alone either.

I was honored when I read those words. So yes, file under: Dirk Approved. 

What are the other stories in the book? 

Ashes to Ashes (art by Laura Neubert, words by Virginia Drohan) --  Quachil Uttaus learns what it means to be human.     

One Last Chance (art by Ben Herrera, words by K.J. Kaminski, colors by Emmanuel Torres) -- Humanity has one last chance to save the universe as they fight against the forces of Zathog on the planet Zarr. 

A 10,000 Year Curse (art by Dave Lentz, words by Dave Lentz and Ryan Kroboth, Inks by Rob Simmons, Colors by Ryan Kroboth) -- Even the old gods needs a night off, but it's often impossible to find a reliable babysitter, even for them. 

The Call of Stone (art and words by Shannon Kirkwood) -- After a woman dies, she finds her true purpose in protecting the Star Mother. 

Love Story (art and words by Christie Shinn) -- A love story about Mnomquah and Oorn's eternal love. 

Basatan vs. Satan (art by Lady Beaver, Words by Steve Waldinger, letters by T. Perran Mitchell) -- Basatan returns to the surface to take his rightful place as ruler of Earth, but Satan has other plans.

The Art of Losing (art and words by Nathan Leuth) -- After her family dies and the Apocalypse comes, a young woman finds strength in music. 

Sunset at Sarnath (art by Wesley Wong, words by Wesley Sun) -- An old man, a young girl, and a pig discuss who was responsible for the end of the world. 

The Marriage Counselor (art by Melissa J Massey, words by Madeleine Holly-Rosing) -- Mnomquah and Oorn go to marriage counseling, because even the best marriages fall apart sometimes. 

The Eyes of Yba'Sokug (art by Jonathan Howard, words by Michael R. Martin) -- a poem about the end of the world, which feels eerily relevant in our current times. 

The Believer (art by Claudio Sanchez Viveros, words by Christian Douglas) -- A Nyarlathotep cultist pontificates over the horribleness of man as he speaks to his daughter. 

Rise (art and words by Bradley Sheridan) -- Hastur is frustrated that his minions cannot overtake a town run by a godzilla monster. 

The Calling (art by Katrina Kunstmann, words by Caleb Thusat) -- An adventurer fights his way through a dungeon in order to take on a Lovecraftian god. 

The Last Convention (art by Lea Seidman, words by Anne Toole) -- The world is over, and everyone has to choose how they are going to die by going to the last convention and being pitched by different cultists or the various Lovecraft gods. 

The Crossroads (art by Silvio DB, words by Terrance Grace) -- Lovecraft writes a letter to his ex-wife as he slowly goes mad. 

The MC (art by Nic Touris, words by Jack Holder, letters by Micah Myers) -- An agent to Lovecraftian gods has to deal with his unruly clients as he tries to get them work. 

Azathoth's Slumber (art by Erik Lervold, words by Russell Nohelty, additional colors by Vlaire Donaghue) -- The outer gods have been playing music to keep Azathoth asleep for millions of years and they are sick of it. 

That's it! 

Did you dig it? If you did, then it's time to pledge. 

Still on the fence? No worries. Click here to get a 50+ page preview. 

I hope you believe this is going to be an amazing anthology. If so, pledge to the campaign and make this happen!

Kaminski, colors by Emmanuel Torres) -- Humanity has one last chance to save the universe as they fight against the forces of Zathog on the planet Zarr. A 10,000 Year Curse (art by Dave Lentz, words by Dave Lentz and Ryan Kroboth, Inks by Rob Simmons, Colors by Ryan Kroboth) -- Even the old gods needs a night off, but it's often impossible to find a reliable babysitter, even for them. The Call of Stone (art and words by Shannon Kirkwood) -- After a woman dies, she finds her true purpose in protecting the Star Mother. Love Story (art and words by Christie Shinn) -- A love story about Mnomquah and Oorn's eternal love. Basatan vs. Satan (art by Lady Beaver, Words by Steve Waldinger, letters by T. Perran Mitchell) -- Basatan returns to the surface to take his rightful place as ruler of Earth, but Satan has other plans.The Art of Losing (art and words by Nathan Leuth) -- After her family dies and the Apocalypse comes, a young woman finds strength in music. Sunset at Sarnath (art by Wesley Wong, words by Wesley Sun) -- An old man, a young girl, and a pig discuss who was responsible for the end of the world. The Marriage Counselor (art by Melissa J Massey, words by Madeleine Holly-Rosing) -- Mnomquah and Oorn go to marriage counseling, because even the best marriages fall apart sometimes. The Eyes of Yba'Sokug (art by Jonathan Howard, words by Michael R. Martin) -- a poem about the end of the world, which feels eerily relevant in our current times. The Believer (art by Claudio Sanchez Viveros, words by Christian Douglas) -- A Nyarlathotep cultist pontificates over the horribleness of man as he speaks to his daughter. Rise (art and words by Bradley Sheridan) -- Hastur is frustrated that his minions cannot overtake a town run by a godzilla monster. The Calling (art by Katrina Kunstmann, words by Caleb Thusat) -- An adventurer fights his way through a dungeon in order to take on a Lovecraftian god. The Last Convention (art by Lea Seidman, words by Anne Toole) -- The world is over, and everyone has to choose how they are going to die by going to the last convention and being pitched by different cultists or the various Lovecraft gods. The Crossroads (art by Silvio DB, words by Terrance Grace) -- Lovecraft writes a letter to his ex-wife as he slowly goes mad. The MC (art by Nic Touris, words by Jack Holder, letters by Micah Myers) -- An agent to Lovecraftian gods has to deal with his unruly clients as he tries to get them work. Azathoth's Slumber (art by Erik Lervold, words by Russell Nohelty, additional colors by Vlaire Donaghue) -- The outer gods have been playing music to keep Azathoth asleep for millions of years and they are sick of it. That's it! Did you dig it? If you did, then it's time to pledge. Still on the fence? No worries. Click here to get a 50+ page preview. I hope you believe this is going to be an amazing anthology. If so, pledge to the campaign and make this happen!

story:
!WARNING!

This graphic novel contains violence, depictions of drug use, suggestive themes, and is not made for children.

 

 

-Scientists claim to have disproven the existence of God throwing the world into violence and chaos. Xander, a former researcher has a WMD and plans to restart the human race, and the last shred of innocence is hidden away. There are no happy endings...

 

 

The Project

-Hi I’m Zach mostly known for my previous graphic novel World of Golma Thank you for taking the time to check out my project! NEOTERIC started in 2014 as a short 5 episode webtoon diving into the darker side of humanity. Asking questions like, what stops humanity from giving in to their basic desires? What is the voice of discernment that says "NO, THAT IS WRONG". And what would happen if you convinced people the voice does not exist? NEOTERIC explores that in the form of a family feud in a dystopian future. While also dealing with the corruption power brings...

 

 

 

The Family

-Family is tricky, and not everyone you love... loves you back...

 

The Stuff

 

Signed copies located in ADD ON

-Prints located as an ADD ON

First of the many prints to come!

Brad Ashworth Print

 

Other Ways to Help NEOTERIC

Please if you could share this project out on your social media!

Follow me on Twitter for updates on the project.

 

Thank you again for check out NEOTERIC!!!

story:
Welcome to our exclusive Indiegogo page for STOKER & WELLS book & merchandise!


This is NOT a crowdfunding campaign, this is our STORE.  With so many of us spending more time at home, we've slashed prices exclusively for Indiegogo customers so you can cozy up with hot cocoa in one of our new mugs, read our critically acclaimed graphic novel, and even use our beautiful new bookmarks for all your reading enjoyment in years to come.  

Created & Written by Steven Peros (SHI: Return of the Warrior, SHI: Haikyo) and Illustrated by Barry Orkin (SHI: Way of the Warrior, Demon Gun), Stoker & Wells: Order of the Golden Dawn is a printed & ready-to-ship, full color, 94-page graphic novel of the highest professional standard.  Please take a look at the exclusive "perks" and "add-ons" for not only yourself, but your Christmas needs as well! 

Stoker & Wells: Order of the Golden Dawn -- 1894 London, a 20-something H.G. Wells and a 40-something Bram Stoker meet and have a very unexpected 48-hour adventure that leads to the creative inspiration for both writer's first great success - The Time Machine for Wells and Dracula for Stoker.  It is not only a thrilling, scary, fun, and beautifully drawn adventure tale, but also a story about putting aside fear and self-doubt and stepping into your true identity.  A huge part of our motivation is to inspire children (of all ages) to READ and to WRITE. 

 

THE CRITICS RAVE!


 

Take a look at what the longtime former Senior Editor at Marvel Comics has to say about Stoker & Wells: Order of the Golden Dawn:

 

THE TEAM

WRITER/CREATOR - STEVEN PEROS

Steven is the co-writer of Billy Tucci's SHI: Return of the Warrior and the writer of the latest installment, SHI: Haikyo.  As a screenwriter, he started his screenwriting career with Lionsgate's The Cat's Meow, set in 1924, starring Kirsten Dunst, Eddie Izzard, and directed by Peter Bogdanovich, and has also written for Disney, MTV, NBC/Universal, AMC, and Lifetime. Steven's feature film directing debut, Footprints, was praised as "One of the 10 Best Films So Far This Year" by the President of the New York Film Critics Circle.  He has written for talent as diverse as Jackie Chan and Dolly Parton.  For more, please visit: www.stevenperos.com

ARTIST (PENCILS & INKS) - BARRY ORKIN

Barry has worked with SHI creator Billy Tucci as a colorist, inker, and logo designer. He also created numerous logo designs and illustrations for Crusade Entertainment.  Barry illustrated the critically acclaimed Demon Gun mini series with Blue Devil and Amethyst creator Gary Cohn.  For DC/Warner Brothers, Barry was part of the branding of the movie, Superman Returns. He created icons and graphics for the Superman Returns Style Guide and his Superman icon appeared on all of the packaging for the film’s licensed products world wide. Barry is also a surface designer, info-graphics designer, product designer, and concept artist.  

COLORS (PAGES 1-50) - CHRIS SUMMERS

COLORS (PAGES 51-94) - STUDIO HAUS

LETTERS - MARSHALL DILLON

OUR STORE

Here's what we're offering, which you can get nowhere else but on Indiegogo:

  • All physical copies of Stoker & Wells: Order of the Golden Dawn will be signed by creator, Steven Peros, at no extra charge.  A PDF download is also available.


     
  • Billy Tucci's Variant Cover Limited Edition will be signed by Billy for the very first time. ONLY 30 COPIES REMAIN! 


     
  • Five "Stoker & Wells" Bookmarks - Never before offered, these five bookmarks are designed by our own Barry Orkin and feature our five key characters.


     
  • "Stoker & Wells" 2-sided 11-oz mug - Never before offered, and only $10 plus shipping.


     
  • Limited Edition "Nina" Print - Signed and numbered by artist, Barry Orkin, this 11 x 17 inch poster is on sturdy card stock and LIMITED TO ONLY 50 so get yours while they last.
     

STOKER & WELLS
A Visual Symphony by Caliendo

Composer/visualist, Christopher Caliendo (award-winning composer for Sony, Fox, CBS) takes you on an audio-visual tour of our first book.  Produced, edited, and scored (magnificently!) by Christopher through his company, N-TERMEDIA.


SELECTED INTERIOR PAGES







Thank you!

Thank you for supporting our Stoker & Wells book and merchandise, all made with love, care, and attention to detail.

Please SHARE, ENJOY, and stay SAFE during this holiday season.

With all my best regards and appreciation --


Steven Peros
Writer/Creator

story:
VISION OF CAMPAIGN :- To start screening this film in movie theaters, Digital platforms, schools, communities & public screenings to share the message.

FILM Q , RAISES BURNING QUESTIONS TOWARDS SOCIETY AND MANKIND.   

Synopsis-

This film portraits a six year old girl from nowhere & a woman. The girl has a code name ‘doll’. Their lives had no contact point till getting implicated in an unstoppable mission.  Woman, perfectly aware, girl, perfectly unaware. The time bomb of destiny has been started…


I Sanjeev Gupta, the Writer/ Indie Filmmaker of internationally awarded feature film Q . I am facing problem to release film " Q " in movie theater because of lack of funds. It always happens with indie filmmaker. We always face fund problem, because we do what we like to do. I want to show film " Q " to audience in movie theater. Film " Q " is a film which is very close to my heart as a filmmaker. I try to show a feeling of a sold girl, who is unaware of her destiny. How a small child sold by people for money and taken by other for their good or bad reasons. Film " Q " reflect a universal problem & gives a insight of human emotions , deep relationships between people who are involve in this & create a awareness against child trafficking & child terrorism.  

It took me 8 years to finish my début feature film 'Q'. The rewards of my hard work were unexpected as the film was highly appreciated and loved across many national and international film festivals, the response of the audience were great and that made me confident to push this film for its theatrical release.

Q stands for many questions I have, and you would have.

Film " Q " is complete now, ready for distribution level but due to insufficient funds film is stuck. We need fund to push this project further. If we get this fund we will able to release film " Q " in movie theater & other digital platforms, schools, social public screenings, communities to share the message about Anti Child trafficking.

The money raised from this campaign will be spent on DCP ( Digital Film Print) design, film packaging, printing, publicity clearance, marketing, title certificate, censor certificate,  travelling, DVD's, posters etc. 
The complete Needed Fund Breakup is as follows:

The contribution made by the Indiegogo community I will be finally able to release my film and believe me, it's every film-makers dream to see his film running in film theaters so please join me in my effort of releasing film 'Q'.
Thank you very much,
Sanjeev Gupta

Technical Details

Runtime: 1 hr 46 mins
Language: Hindi (with English subtitles)
Certificate: Not rated yet
Release Date: ?

Officially Selected Indian International Film Festival of Paris , Extravagant India  , 2015 ( Best Feature Film Award , Grand Prix Du Festival Paris )

Officially Selected Sao Paulo International Film Festival , Brazil 2014 ( Brazilian Premiere )

Officially Selected European Split Film Festival , 2014 ( Croatian Premiere Europe )

Officially Selected Ecologico International Film Festival , 2014 ( Italian Premiere in Gallipoli Italy )

Officially Selected Indian International Film Festival Japan, 2015 ( Japanese Premiere )

Officially Selected Jagran Film Festival, 2014 , India (Best Debut Director Award)

Officially Selected Delhi International Film Festival , 2014 ( Best Actress Award)

Officially Selected Ladakh International Film Festival, 2014, India

Officially  Selected Gollupudi Sriniwasan Debut Film Director National Award, 2015 India (Best Debut Director Award)


Media Coverage

http://www.picklemag.com/news/Paris-Festival-Spotlights-New-Directions-in-Indian-Cinema/235/

http://eastasia.fr/2015/03/17/palmares-du-festival-extravagant-india/

http://www.extravagantindia.fr/en/palmares-2015-en

http://38.mostra.org/en/filme/8260-Q


Heeba Shah- Unknown Woman

 Ashwini shukla- Caretaker Man

 Muskaan- Sold Girl

Ayesha- Toddler Baby

Aldan- Small Boy

Writer/Director/Producer - Sanjeev Gupta

Director of Photography – Santosh Kumar

Editor – Ketankumar Gawde

Assistant Director - Samesh Mahajan

Sound Mixing – Hemant Rao

Sound Design – Priyanshu Raj

Music – Sari Shibuya


Also, please don't forget to like, share, comment and help spread the word about film 'Q' through our Facebook and Twitter pages. 

'Q' film website

Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about the things that matter.

                                                                                                 - Martin Luther King Jr.

story:
This crowd-funding campaign is an effort to gather funds to help produce the first issue of the comic. 

'Shattered Worlds' is a comic / graphic novel series set almost seven hundred years into the future. Humanity has spread out throughout the stars, having lost Earth to a climate change peak disaster several centuries ago. The galaxy is divided throughout; different nations occupy vast regions of space and border tensions can be brutal. The series will begin with an enigmatic bounty hunter out for blood. A criminal organisation known simply as the ‘Black Flag’ have returned from an apparent four year hiatus and threaten to reign disaster down upon a thriving colony world. Our protagonist must fight to stop the enemy from committing atrocities that would promise to lay a trail of devastation across entire worlds.

My name is Chris, and I'm predominantly a film maker; having studied writing and directing at university. I would however say that I'm a writer at heart and have some pet projects that I've been developing silently for some time now, as this page will indicate. My friend Callum and I set about writing the base for Shattered Worlds several years ago, and it has been a slow burner ever since. It was originally laid out to be an animated series, and I'd be ecstatic if one day we were able achieve that.  

'Shattered Worlds' is very important to me. When I was a teenager, my first experience of creative writing was with a number of online communities creating fan fiction for computer games. I cringe to think about some of my earlier attempts, but it's safe to say that if I hadn't been so devoted to those communities then, I wouldn't have made the career choices that have brought me to where I am today. Shattered Worlds is a continuation and expansion of those years; taking my best content and repackaging it into a manageable world of my own.

---

Our Goals

- Our aim with this crowdfunding campaign is to raise enough money to be able to cover the illustrator's fee, plus a general upkeep budget (for printing and such) for the first issue alone.

- That is why the target is reasonably low. Once we have our first issue ready to showcase, we will push it as far as we can; seeking out competitions, cons for advertisment, other creative opportunities and most importantly we will pounding our fists on the doors of the publishers!

- Once complete, we will be releasing the comic a few pages at a time for free online, although not for direct download. This will be done through our website, in a kind of ctrl+alt+del style comic strip. There will also be the added option of purchasing a hard copy for those who want it.

- Our longer term goal is the development of the first volume, which will be approximately fourteen issues long, based on our current outlines and drafts. So if you like our comic, we will look at taking the project further =]

- Take a look at our list of perks on the right! To begin with we'll be offering a selection of concept prints for different levels of commitment, but down the line we can start dishing out copies of the first issue!

---

We will soon have the infrastructure up and running to fully promote our concept, but for the moment you can follow our production development blog at shatteredworldscomic.tumblr.com, or our production company's facebook page at www.twentysevenproductions.co.uk. We also have other assorted social medias knocking around somewhere! I'll link everything up!

All accepted funds will be sent to a bank account in my name. To reiterate, it will all be used in keeping the project afloat on a production basis and paying our illustrator for their time.

Keep an eye on our blog for the freshest news. I'll be releasing new concept designs as and when we have them to show!

Please, if you like this project and think it has legs, then do push the share button! Our key to success lies in developing a strong audience, so if you like, then please don't hesitate to link to us all over the place! There are tools to share up at the top to the left!

Many thanks!

Christopher Linton.

our current outlines and drafts. So if you like our comic, we will look at
taking the project further =]
- Take a look at our list of perks on the
right! To begin with we'll be offering a selection of concept prints for
different levels of commitment, but down the line we can start dishing out
copies of the first issue! ---
We will soon have the infrastructure up and
running to fully promote our concept, but for the moment you can follow our
production development blog at shatteredworldscomic.tumblr.com, or our
production company's facebook page at www.twentysevenproductions.co.uk. We also
have other assorted social medias knocking around somewhere! I'll link
everything up!All accepted funds will be sent to a bank account in my name. To reiterate, it will all be used in keeping the project afloat on a production basis and paying our illustrator for their time.
Keep an eye on our blog for the freshest news.
I'll be releasing new concept designs as and when we have them to show!
Please, if you like this project and think it has
legs, then do push the share button! Our key to success lies in developing a
strong audience, so if you like, then please don't hesitate to link to us all
over the place! There are tools to share up at the top to the left!
Many thanks!
Christopher Linton.

story:
SOME COMMONLY ASKED QUESTIONS...
1) What does my contribution support?  (Artists 1st!)
2) Will I still get my rewards if the campaign doesn't get fully funded? (YES!)

Here's a video to answer those questions in detail:


Robin & Cory here!  We are so UNBELIEVABLY EXCITED to finally be sharing Wavemen with you. 

Cory got the idea for Wavemen when visiting his grandparents in Hawaii.  His mother is from the Big Island, and Cory was raised on a mixture of Western and Eastern myths and legends.

"What if all the legendary heroes I grew up with, like Momotaro, Issunboshi, Kintoki, and Kaguya, were on one big team, working together to solve supernatural problems?"  he thought.  Eight years of work later, with the help of five exceptionally skilled and unique artists, we're getting to answer that question.

The short answer?  AN AMAZING ADVENTURE.

Scroll down for all the details, or check out page samples, interviews, and artist features in the gallery!

Wavemen will be a continuing series.  Episode 1 focuses on our main character, Momotaro, also known as Peach Boy.  In his legend, Momotaro and three animal companions sail to Oni Island, an island full of monsters who have been raiding Momotaro's village.  Momotaro and his friends face down the Oni King, kill all the monsters, and become legends.

Our story starts one year later and explores the question:  "What happens when you send a fifteen-year-old-boy off to kill an island of monsters?"

Momotaro is deeply conflicted over what happened on Oni Island.  Did he become a monster to defeat monsters?  He withdraws from everyone, even his parents, who are desperately trying to reconnect with this solemn stranger so different from the son they remember.  All Momotaro wants is to quietly retire, at age 16, and fade away.

Then a ghost starts haunting his village, killing people one by one, and Momotaro feels called upon to be a hero once more.

He's not sure he can.

This IndieGoGo is to help us complete and print Episode One as a 50+ page, magazine-sized, comic issue, while paying our artists the fair wage they deserve.  The amount of detail they're putting into every single panel is jaw-dropping INCREDIBLE.  This collection will be black-and-white, so you can savor every gorgeous line.

We are paying our artists $125 per page, because we respect their time, effort, and expertise.  They bring their best work to every drawing, and we love them for it!  Please join us in valuing the amazing work they do.  Scroll down past the rewards to meet our team!

Any excess funds will help us start work on Episode 2!

Here's what you'll receive for your contribution!



Cory Childs - Head Writer

Cory Childs is the Editor in Chief of Moko Press and the Head Writer of Wavemen.  He enjoys history and mythology, and has embraced the challenge of weaving them together for this tale of Japanese legends and fantastic adventure.  This story has been his passion project for the past eight years, and he’s pleased to finally be sharing it with the world. 

Robin Childs - Co-Writer

Robin is a storyteller, illustrator, editor, creative coach, former engineer, and incurable eccentric.  She's been making comics since 2002.  Her first project was completed in 2010, totalling 800 pages, and she managed to last an entire two weeks before she dove into a new comic epic, LeyLines, for which she's published three books, with a fourth on the way!  Robin is also a member of the Webcomic Alliance, where she publishes articles and podcasts with her fellow WA characters...uh, creators.  (In truth, we're both.)  She's SO RIDICULOUSLY EXCITED about Wavemen that sometimes she's a little concerned that she MIGHT EXPLODE but so far detonations have been minor and with minimal property damage.  She hopes that you come to share in her enthusiasm (but not the explosions, for the sake of your neighborhood's windows).

Jonas McCluggage - Cover artist and interior artist, Episode 1

Jonas draws comics a bunch and wears the same clothes everyday. He travels a lot but right now he's in Pittsburgh. Shout out to his road dogs, couch surfers, shock rats, and dear mother.  Follow his work on Tumblr.


Jackarais THE GREAT - Interior artist, Episode 1

Jackarais is a Canadian comic artist that likes dogs and has bad fashion sense. He rides bikes and explores and sings too loud.  His current project is a webcomic about a lost cyborg in the apocalypse, called Bicycle Boy.  You can see more of his work at dA and tumblr.

Joel Mercer - Interior artist, Episode 1

Joel Mercer is a published graphic-novelist and freelance illustrator based in the UK. After a 7 year hiatus, he returned to art in 2007 attaining a Masters in Illustration from the prestigious University College Falmouth. Alongside the development of his next book publication, Alice’s Adventures in Steamland, Joel is also a University lecturer in the subject of illustration.

Sarah Becan - Cover artist, Episode 2

Sarah Becan is a comics artist, author, illustrator and designer based in Chicago, and the creator of “I Think You’re Sauceome”, a food-centric autobiographical webcomic.

She was awarded a Xeric Award and a Stumptown Trophy for Outstanding Debut for her first graphic novel,The Complete Ouija Interviews, and her work has twice been nominated for the Ignatz Award. Becan’s second graphic novel, Shuteye, was funded with a successful Kickstarter campaign and released in early 2012.


Her work has appeared in various publications, including Saveur Magazine, Eater.com, Love Chicago, Womanthology, TruthOut.com, and the collaborative serial Cartozia Tales. Becan lives in Chicago with her boyfriend Niles.

Khavy Tran - Interior artist, Episode 2

Bear enthusiast and art mercenary from Toronto, Khavy Tran has worked in film, comics, graphic design and illustration, doing everything from art direction and scriptwork to hand-painted signs and mural painting. Khavy has a vested interest in the intersectionality of feminism, representation, queer rights, racial diversity and global philosophies in her work, particularly as someone who is queer herself and first generation immigrant Vietnamese-Canadian. Khavy seeks to create engaging works that comment on the world around her and provoke thought as well as educate, represent and entertain.

You can find her at khavytran.tumblr.com, byz-antium.tumblr.com, or @byzantiuum on instagram and @khavytran on Twitter.

A NOTE TO ARTISTS

If you'd like to join our team as an artist for a future episode, please see our application page here! Artists of Japanese descent actively encouraged to apply!

The script is done and currently we have completed 23 of a total of 50 comic pages.  We have a strong and established working relationship with all of our artists and are confident that they will stay true to their commitments.   

Cory & Robin have successfully printed three books for Robin's LeyLines series already, so we're very comfortable with the process of creating and distributing books. 

This project will take some time.  There is a limit to how fast any artist can create a gorgeous piece of artwork, especially when many of our artists are also juggling day-jobs.  You can keep up-to-date with our progress by joining our bi-weekly mailing list, where we'll share with you every step forward that we make!

Thank you for taking the time to explore our project.  We hope you're just as excited by this story as we are!

We know that not everyone has the budget right now to contribute in a monetary way, but we would deeply appreciate it if you could share this project with your friends! 

We're so excited to be creating this comic and we can't wait for you all to see it.  Thanks so much for sharing in our joy and enthusiasm for Wavemen!

Additional Credits

Video music:  "The Valley Of Apples And Hope " by Krichotomy

Logo Designed by Dawn Griffin of Dawn Griffin Studios

story:
Ying Ko Graphics 

Publishing graphic novels and Popular American Culture works of historical significance for the comic book fans world wide.

What We Need & What You Get

Publishing is not cheap. A single graphic novel of 49 pages can cost well over $10,000 just to get it ready for printing. Artists have to eat, as do the writer, the editor, the production staff, etc. Then comes the printing costs...and shipping...and promotion if you expect anyone to know you've published something. All of this before you even have a copy to show someone...

  • Ying Ko is looking for $25,000 to prime the pump of a self sustaining stream of incredible works by the most talented authors and gifted artists that want to work with our company.
  • Every donor to this campaign will be included in the "Founders" page included in every book we publish. Additional perks are available at various levels of commitment.
  • All funds go to the production of additional volumes in our library...to artists and writers and production staff.

The Impact

There are gems of stories out there...future classics that lie dormant because they don't fit the "immediate blockbuster" mold that mainstream publishers require before supporting...with just as much potential to become the next "blockbuster".

  • We already have 4 additional volumes in various stages of development...both in our Classics Reimagined" line and in some new and exciting series. Our Classics" line includes more Allan Quartermain, some Captain Nemo, and even some Professor Challenger! 
  • In just this first year of publishing we've been approached by artists, writers and comics historians with fascinating and exciting potential new books lacking nothing but the capitol to allow the creators the time needed to devote to these dream projects.
  • We've already published the first volume in our "Classics Reimagined" series..."King Solomon's Mines" by Mark Ellis and Pablo Marcos. It's received glowing reviews from those who jumped on the band wagon early.
  • Inside every artist and writer is the "dream" story or creation that has their undivided love and effort. But 99% of the time it has to wait for the regular job to get through, for the regular income to filter in so the bills can be paid. And so it sits...a page done here and there when ever a free moment can be stolen from the daily schedule. The quality of these "works of love" always equal and even surpass the finest of the "regular" work.
  • Ying Ko Graphics believes these gems can see the light much sooner with just a little support to the creators. A reasonable rate for the amount of time needed to complete the work...a share in the profits...as well as full creator ownership.
  • The more funds raised, the more volumes we can produce.

Risks & Challenges

 Nothing is sure in life...but its also true that "nothing ventured, nothing gained".

  • Everyone involved in these projects is an established, recognized professional in their respective fields. Each artist, writer, and production lead has years of experience including recognition from their peers in the form of acknowledgements and awards. Their individual track records speak for themselves.
  • Our goal is to bring these gems to light, and we'll do everything necessary to bring these to full fruition...including seeking support when necessary with campaigns like this one.

Other Ways You Can Help

Everybody helps in their own way...and no effort goes unappreciated.

  • Whether you can afford to donate or not...help us get the word out to everyone in the world with a love for comics, comic books, and good literature. As they say, "Many hands make light work". (This proverb was first recorded in English in the early 1300s in a knightly romance known as  Sir Bevis of Hampton .)
  • Indiegogo has excellent share tools, but don't hesitate to reach out to us if you want additional suggestions!

Thank you for your support!

story:
The Chronicles of Era: Whispers of Redemption Book 2

An Introduction to Era

Hi, my name is Scott B Henderson and The Chronicles of Era: Book 2  is the final three chapters of the first story arc of an epic fantasy graphic novel.

Book 1 of The Chronicles of Era was successfully funded on Indiegogo in 2013, and Book 2 seeks to build on that success by continuing the story of three youths in a fantastic world, with a mixture of high fantasy, steampunk, and soft science fiction  

Where Book 1 Left Off


In Book 1* of The Chronicles of Era, readers were introduced to a world where mankind tried to create a paradise fit for the gods, only to have it collapse in a great cataclysm. Hundreds of years later the survivors rebuilt civilization, but their history is little more than myths and legends; a society fixated on the marvelous wonders of a lost age.  

The Illiam Imperium is expanding and looking to reclaim its lost flocks. Scores of missionaries are sent to the fringes of the known world to bring these wayward folks back within the fold, but a growing rebellion among the disenfranchised Joshians has caused an escalation in the power struggle. Seth and Sidrich escaped the slave trades by finding service with the Order of Lost, only to be exploited further by searching for remote Joshian villages. Meanwhile, Caitleth, a runaway from the Core, thinks she has found the adventure she was searching for, under the direct guidance of Father Partrich.

*Additional excerpts from TCOE: Book 1 available in Gallery.

Where We Pick Up With Book 2

After a brief synopsis of the previous three chapters, Book 2 will resume where Book 1 ended: Seth's origins and the nature of his visions are explored, but the missionaries of the Order of Lost push for the final assimilation of the Joshian Nation back into the folds of the Imperium. The conflict between the Joshian rebels and the Imperium is a powder keg ready to explode with destructive force. Seth, Sidrich and Caitleth will have one last chance to change their course in the coming conflict

The Chronicles of Era: Whispers of Redemption Book 2* will be 118 pages of black and white line art, with four coloured chapter breaks, a new map of the world of Era and a dramatis personae. 

*Additional excerpts from TCOE: Book 2 available in Gallery.

The Perks

The primary perk will be the printed graphic novel The Chronicles of Era: Whispers of Redemption Book 2, but there are many options which will combine Book 2 with TCOE: Book 1. 

The Chronicles of Era: Book 2 will be approximately 118 pages (the primary story, with chapter breaks, will be 110 pages). Filled with black and white line art, the book will be broken up by 3 coloured chapter breaks and one epilogue.  Greg Waller will once again lend his amazing skills in colouring these breaks. Rounding out the book will be a dramatis personae of the characters, a revised world map, CIP and a summary of Book 1.  

Other perks will include:

  • A PDF digital copy of TCOE: Book 2.
  • TCOE: Book 1 is 104 pages, black and white line art with 3 coloured chapter breaks. Includes Dramatis Personae, and map (old version). TCOE: Book 1 and its digital counterpart will be delivered at the end of the campaign. 

  • 5"x7" Thank You Cards. A random card will be selected from an assortment of 12 different images depicting characters or scenes from Era. Printed on 80 lbs. card stock, images will be colour and the reverse side will say "Thank you!", contact information, and suitable space for an original sketch by me.
  • Ashcan books (Book 2 preview and Look Ahead): 5.5"x8.5" books with black and white line art, colour front and back cover. 

  • Slip Covers: printed on 100 lbs cover stock, hand assembled. Slip Covers are included on all orders that include both Book 1 and Book 2. (Photo is not the final product, but the general design).

  • 11"x17" colour map of the world of Era and posters of covers or chapter breaks.  Printed on 80 lbs. card stock.
  • Original art drawn on Blueline Pro comic pages (either full size 11x17 or cut down to size).
Please forward any special requests or questions with regards to the reward to me. I am open to discussing arrangements for rewards and combinations not listed. 

Retailer Perks

If you are a retailer and interested in helping to spread the word of my independent work, there are perks just for you!  The perk will include 5 copies of Book 2 (or 5 copies of Book 1 and 5 copies of Book 2), at a discounted price specifically for retailers and vendors (each book retails at $25).  Included in the retailer perk will be copies of a Preview of Book 2: a 13 page excerpt from Chapter 4, signed and numbered. Shipping costs within Canada and the USA will also be waived to encourage retailers (international shipping charges will, unfortunately, still have to be applied, but reduced from what they would normally be). Thank You Cards will also be included.
Please contact me to get a preview PDF copy of the book.

Stretch Goals!

I already have Stretch Goals in mind, to hopefully encourage others to share and make this the best campaign that it can be!

Exclusive Numbered Covers by Guest Artists!

STRETCH #1

Winnipeg has a fantastic, supportive, comics community.  I have tapped those that I especially admire to create exclusive art for The Chronicles of Era Book 2. A limited number of alternate covers will be available by each of these amazing artists, as well as prints for certain rewards.

UPADATE (2/27/16)!!

2 GUEST ARTISTS UNLOCKED!

VARIANT COVERS FOR TCOE: BOOK 2 BY GREG WALLER, SCOTT FORD OR NYCO RUDOLPH ARE NOW AVAILABLE! 

AS WITH ALL VARIANTS, THE PERK WILL INCLUDE A COPY OF THE GRAPHIC NOVEL WITH A VARIANT COVER BY GREG, SCOTT (FORD) or NYCO, AND THE 5"X7" THANK YOU CARD. IF YOU WANT EXTRA REWARDS THEN ADDITIONAL GIFT DONATIONS MAY BE MADE. (as always forward any of your questions to me).

-Add $20 for a copy of The Chronicles of Era: Book 1

-Add $10 for an 11"x17" print

-Add $5 for digital copies

 PRINTS OF UNLOCKED VARIANTS WILL ALSO BE AVAILABLE.

Greg Waller: 

A proud Winnipegger, Greg Waller has studied and worked in the many departments of the comics industry. From writing his own comic series "Magnitude", colouring comics for Marvel and Avatar Press, and currently working on illustrating his own graphic novel, "Guerilla" (coming in 2016). 


Scott A. Ford:

Scott A. Ford is an artist, designer, and storyteller from Winnipeg, MB, Canada. His work is primarily composed of comics, illustration, graphic design, and typography. Scott has written, illustrated, and published the first two issues of his independent comic series, Romulus + Remus of which Issue 1 was nominated for the 2012 Manitoba Book Awards: Best Illustrated Book of the Year. In April 2014, Scott graduated from the U of M with an Honours Degree in Fine Arts. Since graduating, he has worked on a number of new illustration and comic projects including a full-length sci-fi/fantasy graphic novel, Ark Land. Scott has also created an illustration series for the At Bay Press Fiction Annual: Dreams and Nightmares that will launch at McNally Robinson Booksellers on April 5th.

Nyco Rudolph:

Nyco Rudolph is an artist/illustrator hailing from Winnipeg, MB. His style incorporates two of his biggest loves growing up: classic comic books and the film noir movie genre. Rudolph got his professional start designing show posters and album covers for the local music scene, before moving on to create his own illustrations and characters. It has long been a dream of Rudolph's to return to the world of comic books which inspired him so much as an artist. He is currently in the midst of writing and drawing his first graphic novel, a period piece set in 1937, Halifax, titled "Hell's Ark". 

Alternate covers and prints by these 3 amazing artist will be unlocked when the campaign reaches the stretch goal of $3800.


STRETCH #2

GMB Chomichuk:
GMB Chomichuk is an award-winning writer, illustrator and public speaker. His work has appeared in film, television, books, comics and graphic novels.  Sometimes he writes and/or illustrates occult suspense stories like The Imagination Manifesto, Midnight City and Underworld, science fiction works like Raygun Gothic and Infinitum, or inspirational all-ages adventure stories like Cassie and Tonk.  He wants you to join the fight and make comics. Watch his creative process in the Kelly-Anne Riess documentary Artists By Night.  Follow him on twitter and instagram @gmbchomichuk

GMB Chomichuk's alternate cover (and prints) will be available when the campaign reaches $4400. 


Funding

Most of the funds in the initial goal goes towards the production of the graphic novel: its 200 copy print run, slip cases and other miscellaneous printing, art supplies, shipping costs, and Indiegogo related fees and taxes.  Nearly half is just for printing.

While this is a personal project that I work on in what time I can carve out of my schedule, exceeding the initial funding goal will help to keep the book on course, allow for dedicated time, as well as unlock additional perks to supporters.

A Note on Shipping

Rewards going out beyond the borders of Canada will be shipped by the most basic of ground mail. As such there is no tracking. If you would prefer to have it shipped with tracking or receive it faster, an increased donation will be made. Please contact me to make such arrangements. 

Rewards within Canada will be delivered by myself (if possible) or shipping is covered by the basic goal.

My Background

I've been drawing since childhood, and even at an early age I drew pictures to stories. In high school and university I met a few exceptional teachers who had a profound influence on me.  After receiving my bachelor of Fine Arts from the University of Manitoba I worked on digitally colouring comic books, working in custom framing, and all the while continuing to experiment and refine my storytelling. To date I've illustrated twelve graphic novels for Canadian publishers and educators, including: 7 Generations: A Plains Cree Saga (which was nominated for best illustrated book in the 2013 Manitoba Book Awards), Sugar Falls and three stories for Tales from Big Spirit and most recently Betty: The Helen Betty Osborne Story, and A Blanket of Butterflies.
What others have to say about The Chronicles of Era:
"Scott Henderson's Chronicles of Era is gripping High Fantasy that soars from strength to strength.  With each chapter, his hero's journey grows ever more hazardous. Court intrigue and lurking dangers abound, as the visions that guide him also curse him.  In the tradition of Nausicaä and ApocaliptiGirl, Henderson intricately renders intrepid adventure in a world flung back to the Dark Ages by a half-forgotten war, to skilfully reveal his hero's inspired future and audacious destiny." 

Nicholas Burns - Arctic Comics, Super Shamou,True North

"Scott Henderson's work on 7 Generations and Tales from Big Spirit with David Alexander Robertson shows off his ability to tell real human drama up close and personal.  Henderson builds big worlds and big stories for the Chronicles of Era. If you want ancient robots, magical armies, sword fights, prophecies and high adventure then Chronicles of Era should be on your pull list."

GMB Chomichuk The Imagination Manifesto, Infinitum, Midnight City


Risks and Challenges

Unlike my first campaign for TCOE: Book 1, the second instalment is still being worked on. However, more than a third of TCOE: Book 2 is complete. 
This has been a project of passion for many, many (many) years, and I have remained committed to it.  However, this is a personal project, not one that pays the bills--as much as I wish it did. The biggest challenge is carving out the necessary time to compete the remaining pages of the book in time for its due date (Central Canada Comic Con 2016, at the end of October).  The book will be completed, even if the crowd funding campaign were to fall short, but it could just be a bit delayed. Success in this campaign that exceeds my initial goal will help me to stay the course and get the book done on time. 
Which leads us to the final point: 

Other Ways You Can Help

If this project is not to your tastes then let me thank you for taking the time to read about it. But, if you know people that might be interested in The Chronicles of Era, please share it. Share this campaign, send links to my WordPress site or twitter handle (@ouroboros09).  There are a variety of tools for sharing and links available. 

Thank you for your time and any help you can provide!

Join the fight, make comics!

Scott
story_txt:
The Chronicles of Era: Whispers of Redemption Book 2


An Introduction to Era

Hi, my name is Scott B Henderson and The Chronicles of Era: Book 2  is the final three chapters of the first story arc of an epic fantasy graphic novel.
Book 1 of The Chronicles of Era was successfully funded on Indiegogo in 2013, and Book 2 seeks to build on that success by continuing the story of three youths in a fantastic world, with a mixture of high fantasy, steampunk, and soft science fiction  

Where Book 1 Left Off


In Book 1* of The Chronicles of Era, readers were introduced to a world where mankind tried to create a paradise fit for the gods, only to have it collapse in a great cataclysm. Hundreds of years later the survivors rebuilt civilization, but their history is little more than myths and legends; a society fixated on the marvelous wonders of a lost age.  
The Illiam Imperium is expanding and looking to reclaim its lost flocks. Scores of missionaries are sent to the fringes of the known world to bring these wayward folks back within the fold, but a growing rebellion among the disenfranchised Joshians has caused an escalation in the power struggle. Seth and Sidrich escaped the slave trades by finding service with the Order of Lost, only to be exploited further by searching for remote Joshian villages. Meanwhile, Caitleth, a runaway from the Core, thinks she has found the adventure she was searching for, under the direct guidance of Father Partrich.*Additional excerpts from TCOE: Book 1 available in Gallery.
Where We Pick Up With Book 2
After a brief synopsis of the previous three chapters, Book 2 will resume where Book 1 ended: Seth's origins and the nature of his visions are explored, but the missionaries of the Order of Lost push for the final assimilation of the Joshian Nation back into the folds of the Imperium. The conflict between the Joshian rebels and the Imperium is a powder keg ready to explode with destructive force. Seth, Sidrich and Caitleth will have one last chance to change their course in the coming conflict
The Chronicles of Era: Whispers of Redemption Book 2* will be 118 pages of black and white line art, with four coloured chapter breaks, a new map of the world of Era and a dramatis personae. *Additional excerpts from TCOE: Book 2 available in Gallery.
The Perks
The primary perk will be the printed graphic novel The Chronicles of Era: Whispers of Redemption Book 2, but there are many options which will combine Book 2 with TCOE: Book 1. The Chronicles of Era: Book 2 will be approximately 118 pages (the primary story, with chapter breaks, will be 110 pages). Filled with black and white line art, the book will be broken up by 3 coloured chapter breaks and one epilogue.  Greg Waller will once again lend his amazing skills in colouring these breaks. Rounding out the book will be a dramatis personae of the characters, a revised world map, CIP and a summary of Book 1.  Other perks will include:

A PDF digital copy of TCOE: Book 2.

TCOE: Book 1 is 104 pages, black and white line art with 3 coloured chapter breaks. Includes Dramatis Personae, and map (old version). TCOE: Book 1 and its digital counterpart will be delivered at the end of the campaign. 



5"x7" Thank You Cards. A random card will be selected from an assortment of 12 different images depicting characters or scenes from Era. Printed on 80 lbs. card stock, images will be colour and the reverse side will say "Thank you!", contact information, and suitable space for an original sketch by me.
Ashcan books (Book 2 preview and Look Ahead): 5.5"x8.5" books with black and white line art, colour front and back cover. 

Slip Covers: printed on 100 lbs cover stock, hand assembled. Slip Covers are included on all orders that include both Book 1 and Book 2. (Photo is not the final product, but the general design).

11"x17" colour map of the world of Era and posters of covers or chapter breaks.  Printed on 80 lbs. card stock.
Original art drawn on Blueline Pro comic pages (either full size 11x17 or cut down to size).
Please forward any special requests or questions with regards to the reward to me. I am open to discussing arrangements for rewards and combinations not listed. 
Retailer PerksIf you are a retailer and interested in helping to spread the word of my independent work, there are perks just for you!  The perk will include 5 copies of Book 2 (or 5 copies of Book 1 and 5 copies of Book 2), at a discounted price specifically for retailers and vendors (each book retails at $25).  Included in the retailer perk will be copies of a Preview of Book 2: a 13 page excerpt from Chapter 4, signed and numbered. Shipping costs within Canada and the USA will also be waived to encourage retailers (international shipping charges will, unfortunately, still have to be applied, but reduced from what they would normally be). Thank You Cards will also be included.Please contact me to get a preview PDF copy of the book.Stretch Goals!I already have Stretch Goals in mind, to hopefully encourage others to share and make this the best campaign that it can be!Exclusive Numbered Covers by Guest Artists!STRETCH #1
Winnipeg has a fantastic, supportive, comics community.  I have tapped those that I especially admire to create exclusive art for The Chronicles of Era Book 2. A limited number of alternate covers will be available by each of these amazing artists, as well as prints for certain rewards.

UPADATE (2/27/16)!!2 GUEST ARTISTS UNLOCKED!VARIANT COVERS FOR TCOE: BOOK 2 BY GREG WALLER, SCOTT FORD OR NYCO RUDOLPH ARE NOW AVAILABLE! AS WITH ALL VARIANTS, THE PERK WILL INCLUDE A COPY OF THE GRAPHIC NOVEL WITH A VARIANT COVER BY GREG, SCOTT (FORD) or NYCO, AND THE 5"X7" THANK YOU CARD. IF YOU WANT EXTRA REWARDS THEN ADDITIONAL GIFT DONATIONS MAY BE MADE. (as always forward any of your questions to me).-Add $20 for a copy of The Chronicles of Era: Book 1
-Add $10 for an 11"x17" print-Add $5 for digital copies PRINTS OF UNLOCKED VARIANTS WILL ALSO BE AVAILABLE.Greg Waller: A proud Winnipegger, Greg Waller has studied and worked in the many departments of the comics industry. From writing his own comic series "Magnitude", colouring comics for Marvel and Avatar Press, and currently working on illustrating his own graphic novel, "Guerilla" (coming in 2016). Scott A. Ford:Scott A. Ford is an artist, designer, and storyteller from Winnipeg, MB, Canada. His work is primarily composed of comics, illustration, graphic design, and typography. Scott has written, illustrated, and published the first two issues of his independent comic series, Romulus + Remus of which Issue 1 was nominated for the 2012 Manitoba Book Awards: Best Illustrated Book of the Year. In April 2014, Scott graduated from the U of M with an Honours Degree in Fine Arts. Since graduating, he has worked on a number of new illustration and comic projects including a full-length sci-fi/fantasy graphic novel, Ark Land. Scott has also created an illustration series for the At Bay Press Fiction Annual: Dreams and Nightmares that will launch at McNally Robinson Booksellers on April 5th.Nyco Rudolph:Nyco Rudolph is an artist/illustrator hailing from Winnipeg, MB. His style incorporates two of his biggest loves growing up: classic comic books and the film noir movie genre. Rudolph got his professional start designing show posters and album covers for the local music scene, before moving on to create his own illustrations and characters. It has long been a dream of Rudolph's to return to the world of comic books which inspired him so much as an artist. He is currently in the midst of writing and drawing his first graphic novel, a period piece set in 1937, Halifax, titled "Hell's Ark". Alternate covers and prints by these 3 amazing artist will be unlocked when the campaign reaches the stretch goal of $3800.STRETCH #2GMB Chomichuk:GMB Chomichuk is an award-winning writer, illustrator and public speaker. His work has appeared in film, television, books, comics and graphic novels.  Sometimes he writes and/or illustrates occult suspense stories like The Imagination Manifesto, Midnight City and Underworld, science fiction works like Raygun Gothic and Infinitum, or inspirational all-ages adventure stories like Cassie and Tonk.  He wants you to join the fight and make comics.
