story:
LET THE ADVENTURES BEGIN!

SPACE TRUCKER!! SPACE PIRATES!! SPACE SHIPS!! ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE!!
The adventures have begun. Join Captain Luv and SPAID as they find themselves getting into situations that can change the course of the solar system. 
 

"CAPTAIN LUV: RISE OF THE PIRATE KING" - Chapter 1 is 24 beautiful full color pages and the first of 6 chapters. Each chapter will be from 24 to 32 pages in length. This is part of an ongoing series featuring Captain Luv.

YOU'LL FALL IN LOVE WITH LUV!


THIS BOOK IS RATED 'MATURE'. There is sex, violence, profanity, nudity, and other mature themes. This book is not designed for children.
 

DOMESTIC SHIPPING FREE ON ALL PERKS
(SHIPS FREE IN THE USA)
  

CHAPTER 1 COVER ART

WHO IS CAPTAIN LUV?

Captain Luv is a space trucker and a former war hero. Accompanied by a rogue artificial intelligence, named SPAID, he reluctantly finds himself on adventures that could affect the course of the solar system. 

"Captain Luv: RISE OF THE PIRATE KING" - CHAPTER 1 is completed and will go to print at the completion of the campaign. Backers can expect delivery starting in July.
  

INTERNAL ART PREVIEW

 

 

CAPTAIN LUV VOL. 1

So.. you're wondering: Where do you find the first book?

"CAPTAIN LUV: THE HERO OF THE CLEANSING" is 72 beautiful full color pages and the first book in an ongoing series featuring Captain Luv. It is the story of how SPAID and Luv meet. This story also explains the legend surrounding Captain Luv and how he became the hero of the cleansing.  This is the essential book in the Captain Luv series.
You can find the Original Cover and Variant exclusive to the first campaign still available inDemand here: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/captain-luv-the-hero-of-the-cleansing/x/22281020#/.   Order one now & it ships on the next business day. 

 

ABOUT THE TEAM

AUTHOR & CREATOR

Drew Eash: Writer, Musician, Marketing professional 
 

ILLUSTRATOR

Andrea Bormida: 30 years experience and recently worked on the successful B&W Italian comic Nathan Never.
 

COLORIST

Slamet Mujiono: Extremely talented gentleman

 

STRETCH GOALS

$1500 - Trading Card

$3000 - Book Mark

$5000 - Pinup

$10,000 - 2 Pages of Bonus Art added with Chapter 1.

(Stretch Goals guaranteed ONLY to people who back prior to printing)

GOALS NOT REACHED IN TIME
$15,000 - 2 Additional NEW Trading Cards 

$25,000 - ??

$35,000 - ??

story:
___ "TALES OF ZERO"___

       48 page Horror Sci-Fi Comic Adventure

Lines and Designs: MATT QUEEN

Additional Art by: JEREMY THEVENOT

Colors and Words: PETER PAUL SMITH

Cover Artists: Elliot Rodriguez, Pablo Romero, Brett Cantrell

TALES OF ZERO is art-house B-movie comic with a cinematic style that's part Indiana Jones, and part Aliens '86!  It's a 48 page movie for your mind, with grainy old school horror vibes!

It's a coffee table comfort comic for fans of B-Movies and Pulp Sci-fi Horror and Lovecraftian fiction, -- a diesel fueled remix of the classic "Satampra Zeiros" stories of the 1930s by Clark Ashton Smith, H.P. Lovecraft's California based contemporary.

The textures grit and weathered feel of the art are something you will want to hold in your hand, and your friends won't be able to put down. Back the tier that's right for you, & we'll bring this physical book into your hands, and together we'll bring this wild adventure to life! 

A WEATHERED, ATMOSPHERIC ART-STYLE:

The Story:

Our story takes place on the Space Mining Colony called Zeta-3. The Corporation gave their construction crews a liquid stimulant called "the Juice" that temporary gives youth strength & stamina, and allowed them to work longer hours and dangerous conditions.

Now the station is finished and there is no more work for these old "scrappers" but they are still addicted to "the Juice" and have to seek odd jobs to pay for it.

At the local Bar we find ZERO and OSILLO, two "scrappers" who have just met RIKK, a young data analyst with a dog, who has never been outside the colony, yet yearns to have a real adventure.  

ZERO proposes an journey to the nearby alien ruins, where certain valuable relics might be found. With these they would have enough money to pay for their ongoing juice habit, and get transport off this world to find new adventures. But, as these high spirited adventurers set out for the ancient ruined city ... something very ANCIENT and EVIL is waiting for them . . .  

THREE COVER CHOICES:

Choose from three outstanding cover choices, or bundle them for a discount price!

COVER A "STANDARD" - Art by ELLIOT RODRIGUEZ

COVER B "Campaign Exclusive VARIANT" - Art by PABLO ROMERO

COVER C "Wraparound for Black-and-White Edition" - Art by Brett Cantrell

 

Thanks and Acknowledgements:

This comic is a love letter to Clark Ashton Smith, and the pulp era of the 1930s. We hope you back this book and that it is as much fun for your to read as it was for us to make

YOUR CREATIVE TEAM

  • MATT QUEEN - Lines and Designs (pencils )
  • ZADE STUDIOS - (Epilogue Line Art)
  • BRETT CANTRELL - "Scarlet Scepter ASHCAN'
  • PETER PAUL SMITH - Script Atmosphere and Lighting (words & colors)

And OUR COVER ARTISTS

Elliot Rodriguez,  Pablo Romero, and Brett Cantrell

 

Follow on Twitter: @purplesmurf13 and @talesofzero

story:
"Sam (Glanzman) is best known for his USS Stevens and Haunted Tank stories for DC, but for me, Sam’s KONA: MONARCH OF MONSTER ISLE is absolutely mind-altering. It's like reading a vintage pulp magazine soaked in LSD." –Atomic Junk Shop

 

 

"Featuring dismemberment, mutant animals, and at least 100 deaths per issue, KONA definitely stands out among the wider world of comics as a whole. If you don’t know KONA, now’s the time to learn!"

–io9

 

 

"Kona is a cave man who helps the family of Dr. Henry Dodd after they crash on Kona’s lost, dinosaur-populated Pacific island. Not limited to garden-variety prehistoric creatures, (Sam) Glanzman created a fever dream of surreal, horrific monstrosities."

–The Comics Journal

 

 

"The whole thing heaves and pulsates like the ink itself has come down with a strange and maddening fever. As (Sam) Glanzman is such a fine craftsman there's a grace and beauty to what's unfolding in every single shift in perspective and each flash of outright visual madness. Boy, what a thrill."

–Comics Reporter

 

 

"Jungle lord Kona, along with Dr. Dodd and his family, explore jungle worlds of savage apes, sabre-toothed tigers, and primitive tribes in this high-octane adventure comic. Artist Sam Glanzman fills each panel and page with lush detail and action in the best tradition of Tarzan, and the story-line feeds up enough action and adventure for any fan of Edgar Rice Burroughs."

–Atomic Avenue

 

KONA #2 standard cover by Sam Glanzman

 

KONA #2 variant cover by Thomas Yeates & Stephen R. Bissette

 

WELCOME to the campaign to publish KONA #2...issue two of the weirdest, wildest comic ever published!  KONA: MONARCH OF MONSTER ISLE tells the story of a strange hero known only as Kona, saving the lives of Dr. Henry Dodd, his daughter Mary, and his grandchildren Mason and Lily, after this group crashes their army surplus blimp on the prehistoric Pacific island that Kona calls home.  Befriending them, Kona becomes their protector, saving them from giant animals, monsters and much more!  Originally published in 1962, this series has never been collected or reprinted until now! This issue features a variant cover by comic book masters Thomas Yeates & Stephen R. Bissette.  This issue also has a pin-up by Thomas Yeates & Al Williamson.  And don't forget that each issue contains an essay about KONA and Sam Glanzman by Stephen R. Bissette!

 

Pin-up tribute to Sam Glanzman by Thomas Yeates & Al Williamson

 

This issue has both limited edition covers, and standard covers.  The  limited edition covers by both Sam Glanzman and Thomas Yeates & Stephen R. Bissette will be on card-stock with a beautiful matte finish, and will ONLY be available from this campaign! There are also covers available signed by both Stephen R. Bissette & Thomas Yeates!

The variant cover this month is a mind-blowing collaborative effort by Thomas Yeates and Stephen R. Bissette.  Yeates is responsible for the image of Kona, and Bissette the background of monsters and dinosaurs.  In fact, as you can see below, his "background" was so incredibly detailed that I decided to use it for this issue's back cover.

 

KONA #2 back cover by Stephen R. Bissette

 

For those who missed our last campaign, you can pick up both covers from KONA #1 (seen below) by Sam Glanzman and fan-favorite Bart Sears.

 

KONA #1 standard cover by Sam Glanzman

 

KONA #1 variant cover by Bart Sears

 

KONA: MONARCH OF MONSTER ISLE was originally published in 1962, and therefore needs to be fully restored.  We are lucky to have the brilliant Allan Harvey restoring each page of this incredible comic book series.  Below are some samples of the work he is currently doing on this second issue.

 

KONA #2 restoration sample #1

 

KONA #2 restoration sample #2

 

KONA #2 restoration sample #3

 

As many of you know, I have worked very hard for several years to bring the incredible work of comic book master Sam Glanzman back into print.  Collections I have edited and/or published include A Sailor's Story, U.S.S. Stevens: The Collected Stories, ATTU, Red Range: A Wild Western Adventure (with Joe R. Lansdale), Voyage to the Deep, and (coming soon) The Lonely War of Capt. Willy Schultz (with Will Franz). We were even lucky enough to receive an Eisner Award nomination for the U.S.S. Stevens collection by Glanzman that I edited, which contains true stories about his time serving in the Pacific Theater during WWII.  But aside from his war comics, KONA might just contain some of the most incredible pages that Glanzman ever illustrated.  I can't wait to get KONA back into print for both long time fans to enjoy, and a whole new generation to discover!  Your support will ensure this incredible -and historically important- comic book series lives on for years to come!

#SamGlanzmanForever #LongLiveKona #LongLiveComics

Drew Ford (Publisher, IT'S ALIVE!)

story:
Short Summary

It's been about 8 years since I set out on this crazy road of stand-up comedy. Since that first nerve wracking performance, some amazing things have happened. I've done comedy festivals, met and worked along some of my favorite comics, and even met my childhood idol Dave Chappelle. Comedy has afforded me the opportunity to travel to amazing places and meet even more amazing people. 

As I move forward and deeper into this journey, I am preparing to meet another life long dream of mine. TO HAVE MY VERY OWN COMEDY ALBUM! With your help, this dream WILL become a reality. 

On August 30th at Morty's Comedy Joint in Indianapolis, we are going to make some magic...(and maybe even a baby?). So come on and be a part of this extremely special night!

What I Need & What You Get

To reach my goal, I will need to raise $1,500 by July 1st. These funds will cover recording, producing, distribution, photography, album artwork and promotional costs. I'm setting out to put a quality product that I and you are proud of.  The album will be available on I-tunes, Spotify and a whole heap of other platforms.

If you donate, you'll get things from a signed copy of the album to a picture of me shirtless holding a box of kittens (probably not). But seriously, the rewards are awesome. You can get t-shirts or an advance manuscript of my new book to be released next year, "Adventures in Tinderland". (But I know you want that picture of me shirtless holding a box of kittens...).

The Impact

As a kid, all I watched was comedy. I was influenced by everyone from Richard Pryor to Mitch Hedberg. In college, I fell deeper in love with stand-up as I frequented a place in Bloomington, IN called the Comedy Attic. The Comedy Attic has been named one of the best ten comedy clubs in the country. Needless to say, I'm beyond proud to have started there.

It is extremely important to me to make that comedy scene and the comedy scene of Indianapolis proud. I feel that I am at a point where I can do that with an album. In New York, I've been relentless with developing material and pushing the limits of my own comedy. Hopefully, the beginning to now will culminate on September 30th. That's the dream.

Risks & Challenges

Hmmm....I could bomb! Ahhhh! (Think positive Dwight. Think positive.) The date of the recording is set for August 30th but there is a very slight chance that it may be moved to Labor Day weekend, September 6th. If this happens, you'll be the first to know!...Well, actually I'll know before you but you'll know shortly after me!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, I understand. Believe me, I am a comic after all. I would beg you to do your best to share with your closest family and friends or on facebook. I'd love you forever if you helped me spread the word.

Thank you so much and thank you in advance!


Dwight Simmons
story_txt:
Short Summary It's been about 8 years since I set out on this crazy road of stand-up comedy. Since that first nerve wracking performance, some amazing things have happened. I've done comedy festivals, met and worked along some of my favorite comics, and even met my childhood idol Dave Chappelle. Comedy has afforded me the opportunity to travel to amazing places and meet even more amazing people. 
As I move forward and deeper into this journey, I am preparing to meet another life long dream of mine. TO HAVE MY VERY OWN COMEDY ALBUM! With your help, this dream WILL become a reality. 
On August 30th at Morty's Comedy Joint in Indianapolis, we are going to make some magic...(and maybe even a baby?). So come on and be a part of this extremely special night!   What I Need & What You Get To reach my goal, I will need to raise $1,500 by July 1st. These funds will cover recording, producing, distribution, photography, album artwork and promotional costs. I'm setting out to put a quality product that I and you are proud of.  The album will be available on I-tunes, Spotify and a whole heap of other platforms.
If you donate, you'll get things from a signed copy of the album to a picture of me shirtless holding a box of kittens (probably not). But seriously, the rewards are awesome. You can get t-shirts or an advance manuscript of my new book to be released next year, "Adventures in Tinderland". (But I know you want that picture of me shirtless holding a box of kittens...).
    The Impact As a kid, all I watched was comedy. I was influenced by everyone from Richard Pryor to Mitch Hedberg. In college, I fell deeper in love with stand-up as I frequented a place in Bloomington, IN called the Comedy Attic. The Comedy Attic has been named one of the best ten comedy clubs in the country. Needless to say, I'm beyond proud to have started there.
It is extremely important to me to make that comedy scene and the comedy scene of Indianapolis proud. I feel that I am at a point where I can do that with an album. In New York, I've been relentless with developing material and pushing the limits of my own comedy. Hopefully, the beginning to now will culminate on September 30th. That's the dream.
    Risks & Challenges Hmmm....I could bomb! Ahhhh! (Think positive Dwight. Think positive.) The date of the recording is set for August 30th but there is a very slight chance that it may be moved to Labor Day weekend, September 6th. If this happens, you'll be the first to know!...Well, actually I'll know before you but you'll know shortly after me!
    Other Ways You Can Help If you are unable to contribute financially, I understand. Believe me, I am a comic after all. I would beg you to do your best to share with your closest family and friends or on facebook. I'd love you forever if you helped me spread the word.
Thank you so much and thank you in advance!

Dwight Simmons

story:
Short Summary

Quantum Flux is a student inspired comic book directed by 8:15 Comics Head Writer Eric Orton, in association with Venture Prep, a Denver charter school. The 3 students, Enrique Castaneda, DiAnthony Brown, and Kyler Stanford, were directly responsible for the content of the comic, character design, plot creation, character backstory, and many other miscellaneous designs involved with creating the comic book. Mr. Orton was responsible for guiding the students in adequate techniques in the creative process; overseeing brainstorming sessions, helping the students when they got stuck, and overseeing the production process from classroom ideas, to a full-fledged comic book. This IndieGoGo fundraiser is the final piece in a very amazing puzzle. With your support, the hard work of these students will pay off, seeing their ideas cultivated into a real-life comic book series.

What We Need & What You Get


  • The $500 here would go towards completing the art and funding the printing.
  • The perks are awesome, including the book itself and  collectible character prints

The Impact

Successful completion of the comic would also ensure its completion in time to sell at Denver's 4th annual ComicCon, a feat that a successful campaign here would make possible just in.

Risks & Challenges

This project has overcome many challenges, the first being getting a complete working script together with the students in a limited amount of time. The students exclusively worked after school on this project, doing research on topics previously unknown to them, and working with the director to successfully incorporate new ideas into the story.

story:
I created an extra perk the last two days which I think is very cool. It`s a 3D Illusion Cthulhu Stand and will be sent as a digital high res file with the manual to build it. EVERY pledge will get this and a Digital Copy of the completed Graphic Novel.

You can check out the 3D Illusion Stand in the extras section or directly on youtube: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uLfpGyd0XU8&feature=youtu.be


"A very interesting and attractive take on Lovecraft..."

Clive Barker (Hellraiser, Jericho, Dread)

 

"Michael`s artwork has a closed atmosphere which is full of details. His technique reminds me of my own early work and fits the story about the great high priest Cthulhu in a very original way. His handling of the story is impressive, he shortened the story but kept it authentic by using Lovecraft`s original text. "

H.R. Giger (Alien, Species)


“In his hallucinogenic interpretation of the Lovecraft mythos Michael Zigerlig has realized a fantastic visual obsession. Terrifyingly beautiful. mesmerizingly decorative. Horror has never looked so good. using the graphic novel format Zigerlig has given usan uniqe interpretation of an iconic literary work.”

Brian Yuzna (Re-Animator 1-3, Dagon, Crying Freeman)


Michael Zigerlig began his career at the School of Art in his home of Bern, Switzerland. After his appreticeship as a grapic designer, he started working as a freelance illustrator and comic book artist and had his first publication in 2010 with H.P. Lovecraft`s “Call of Cthulhu” by Transfuzion Publishing with an introduction by friend H.R. Giger. Additional 2010 illustration credits include the short story “Sherlock Holmes: Murder at Moulin Rouge”, written by Gary Reed and published by Transfuzion Publishing and IDW Publishing, and the short story “The Book by H.P. Lovecraft”, which was published by Aklopress in the compilation “The Aklonomicon”. He has worked with Producer/Director Brian Yuzna for several of his Projects.

Five years have passed now since I heard the call of the great Cthulhu and created my first Graphic Novel, an adaptation of the the famous work by H.P. Lovecraft. I vividly remember when I sent the first five pages to H.R. Giger which actually led to him writing the introduction and me meeting him and producer and director Brian Yuzna for the very first time. Sadly the legendary artist is not here anymore to see this new version but together with his wife Carmen Giger-Scheiffele, Batman artist Kelley Jones, film maker Brian Yuzna and Lovecraft artist Nick Gucker we are starting a new series called H.P. Lovecraft`s Library of Horror and i`m proud to present my coloured Call of Cthulhu as the first feature of this new comic book label. To color all 61 pages and redesign the whole layout for colouring I need a funding amount of at least 17`000 Dollar. At least 8`500 Dollar will be used for the production of perks and their shipment to you. This money is for the cost of production only. However, there are several perk options that include a signed limited edition print, either in soft or hardcover and of course all pledgers will receive a digital copy of the completed graphic novel. The coloured Call of Cthulhu is the first issue of H.P. Lovecraft`s library of Horror and hopefully there`s a lots more to come. But whatever reprints there may be in the future, you will know you were there right from the start. right where it all began. 

And to make this true I need your support.

We do have amazing perks to choose from like posters, art canvases, phone cases, mugs, backpacks, skateboards, custom illustrations, signed limited print issues and much more. I`m sure in our collection of 18! perks in total, everybody will find something. It`s important to us that you are getting something really awesome in return for your support. All merchandising articles will come with the motif of your choice. you can find all available pictures in the art gallery of this indiegogo kickstarter and these articles are exclusive to this campaign. now… In case we only meet the minimum, which is a third of the funding goal or 5600 dollar I can at least realise the first of the three chapters. In case we don`t even get to these 5600 all pledges will of course be returned to you. But after you`ve just seen what I potentially have in stall for you I`m sure you`ve come to the same conclusion as I did. This must be done. please make it happen. And please share this project to Lovecraft and Comic Book enthusiasts you know. Thank you, thank you so much for making the coloured Call of Cthulhu a reality and lay the ground for H.P. Lovecraft`s Library of Horror.

Kind regards, Michael

story:
My name is Jolene and I am a comic book artist who has been published in books ranging from small comic publishers to bigger ones like IDW. Over the last 7 years of working as a published comic artist I have had the desire to pay forward the wonderful opportunity of seeing my work published to other comic book creators. Additionally I've met some truly fantastic comic storytellers that just need someone to believe in them and their stories. All of these are my reasons for creating Vivifica Studios. 

'The Midnight Candle anthology' was an idea that was conceptualized out my desire to start giving creators that chance to get their work published. I have been published in a few anthologies myself and I wanted to share the joy of that collaboration with other creators. When editor Dana Skvarek and I threw this idea out there to a few forums and Facebook we had no idea how many people would even want to be a part of our dream. We were soon overwhelmed with submissions and were very excited to see this project take shape. 

The Midnight Candle Anthology is a Horror graphic novel consisting of over 13+ comic stories and 20+ creators. Many of these creators are from all over the U.S.A and a few in other places of the world. For a few of these creators this is a very big chance to get that publishing credit to their names as well as the sheer joy of seeing their work in print. 

This is where you come in.  



What We Need & What You Get

Digital comics and books are excellent, but there's nothing quite like the feel of paper between your fingers. And printing those pages costs money, so let's break it down:

  • Our printer, Artist Express can get our books printed, packed, and on our door step for just under $1,000. 
  • For contributing to our campaign, you can get the book digitally, printed, even get some cool artist swag to go along with it all, depending on the level you choose!
  • Your name, First name and last initial, will be listed in the book! 
  • Crowd funding is great, but it's a risk, and sometimes risks don't pay off. In the event we DON'T reach our goal, we'll still work to make good on our promise to deliver to each and everyone of you that supported us. The delivery date might have to be adjusted, though. 


The Impact

Ever drop a penny into a charity collection box at your favorite hip coffee shop? You know you're helping, but you don't know how. With us the results are right in front of you the whole time!

  • We want you to be a part of the success of printing a graphic novel. Let's face it, don't you want the bragging rights when you show off YOUR fancy shmancy book to your friends and can prove you helped get it made?
  • Unlike a Hollywood movie campaign, ours is truly grass roots. We CAN'T do this without you! Even if we could, we wouldn't want to! It's lonely at the top, let's get there together!


Risks & Challenges

Every campaign has it's risks, and this one certainly isn't without a few. 

  • We have a minimum number of books we have to print, and so we have to hit a minimum amount of contributions. But we're not worried, we have you on our side!
  • Like we mentioned before, if we don't hit our goal there are other options, but they're not pretty. AND those options will delay printing overall, and delay getting your awesome book into your awesome hands.


Other Ways You Can Help

We live in the real world, and we know gas prices are high, burgers can be expensive, and Playstation just came out with that incredible game you have to have! No worries, if you can't contribute financially, here's how you can still be involved:

  • Ask friends and family to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Social media is a great tool! Let's flood the interwebs!
  • Indiegogo has an excellent "Share" tool that links directly to, well, us! Hit that button and the magic starts!

story:
From Victim To Victory

The first book in this comic book series tells the story of a girl who learned to love herself through adversity. She had a lot of bad things happen to her, which left her trapped in a cage of fear, guilt, and shame. Eventually, she decided to stop being a victim and start fighting back.

She learned that everything happens for a reason, but really, only you get to decide the meaning behind the events of your life. She decided to give her life meaning by becoming a super hero, to empower other victims of violence, and then, of course, write a comic book about it!

It's a love story, but not like the love stories most people have read. It is a love story about a girl who falls quite madly in love with herself.

"From Victim to Victory" is a 250 page, full color graphic novel about how to become your own super hero!

Be the first to get your hands on the book!

"From Victim to Victory" will be released in December, 2015. However, by being a part of the Indiegogo campaign, you'll be the first to read the book! Advance copies will be shipped to anyone who pre-orders the book through Indiegogo. The book will be sent out to contributors a week before it will be available for sale to the public.

Your options for buying the book today:

  • eBook -- $15
  • Paperback copy (includes eBook)-- $35
  • Hardcover copy (includes eBook)-- $60
  • Autographed hardcover copy (includes eBook) -- $100
Everyone who pre-orders the book through the Indiegogo campaign will get to read each chapter as it is finished. It will be sent to your email as an eBook!
Hardcover copies are only available through the Indiegogo campaign.
Please include an additional $5 for shipping outside the United States.

The Extras!

I'll be releasing a lot of special extras over the course of the campaign! The extras are separate from pre-ordering the book, so you can get as many as you want! Be sure to check back again throughout the campaign!

June 2nd - Launch Day - Autographed Numbered Art Prints

To start out, I have 75 numbered prints of the cover art to sell (out of 100, the first 25 were already claimed, before we even got to today)!

June 9th - Week 2 - X-Files inspired "George the Fear Monster" t-shirt

One of the main characters in the book is George, my inner fear monster. He's really sweet and cute, but often gets afraid of silly things. I'm also a big fan of the X-Files so I made this t-shirt! The t-shirt is American Apparel, made and printed in the USA. Men and women's sizes are available, and will be shipped after the campaign is over. (For more George, check out the comics at fearmonster.org!)

June 16th - Week 3 - Hippie "George the Fear Monster" t-shirt

George is also a hippie. So, I made this 1960s inspired t-shirt! It reads, "Make Love Not Fear." If you're at least part hippie and you believe there should be more love and less fear in the world, then you'll love wearing this shirt with pride! The t-shirt is American Apparel, made and printed in the USA. Men and women's sizes are available, and will be shipped after the campaign is over. (For more George, check out the comics at fearmonster.org!)

June 23rd - Week 4 - Anxel "The Angel of Death" signed art print and t-shirt!

This is Anxel, the bad boy love interest in the book. He's a Spanish speaking smart ass, and super protective of me. I mean... my character! He's my guardian angel, basically. You'll get to know him much better in the book, of course. But if you're a Twilight fan and you were "Team Edward," then eat your heart out! I mean, why settle for a vampire when you can have an angel? (Actually, technically, he's nephilim -- half angel, half human.)

This numbered art print is an 8.5x11" and it's autographed by the author. Only 100 available!

Anxel is also available as a t-shirt! The t-shirt is American Apparel, made and printed in the USA. Men and women's sizes are available, and will be shipped after the campaign is over.

FAQ

Q. I can get a book on my Kindle for $0.99. Why should I pay $35 for a comic book?

A. This is more than just a comic book! It's a really long comic book. It's 250 pages of full color art! For one thing, color printing is very expensive, so the book costs more than a normal book with just words does.

Secondly, you're not only paying for the book, but all the time I've invested into research, writing, rewriting, rewriting again, and drawing the book. It takes a lot more time to make a graphic novel than it would for just a normal Kindle book.

Thirdly, you're paying for quality. I put my whole heart and soul into this book, and I love what I'm doing. The book is a piece of my soul, and thus priced accordingly. I'm selling my soul to you rather than to the Devil himself. (Don't worry, that was never an option. Just a joke!)

Q. When does the book come out?

A. The book will be out in December, just in time for Christmas. So if you want to get your Christmas shopping done really early, buy everyone on your Christmas list a copy of the book! Please note, by pre-ordering through the Indiegogo campaign, you'll get the book a week before everyone else. Also, hardcover and autographed copies are only available through the Indiegogo campaign.

Q. I can't afford the book. Is there a way to get a free copy?

A. Kind of, but not exactly. If you'd like to become an official promoter of the book, send me an email at jillian@fearmonster.org. I'll give you a special link to share with your friends and family. If 10 people buy the book through you, I'll give you a free copy!

Q. If I buy one of the extras, do I still have to buy the book?

A. Yes. The extras are just that, extras! I did that on purpose. A lot of my fans love George but aren't big book readers. And a lot of my fans are comic book readers but don't really like t-shirts with stuff printed on them. So, you've got options! You have the choice to buy as much or as little as you want through the Indiegogo campaign!

Why It Helps So Much to Pre-Order...

I've been working on this baby for 4 years, and I'm fully committed to getting it done and in your hands by Christmas this year! The only real challenge is running out of money for rent and food before I get done. Then I would have to go get a "real job" and nobody wants that.... Right?

The more books I can sell ahead of time, the more time I have to dedicate to drawing the rest of this story!

The Backstory...

Four years ago, I started to write a book about my life. Like everyone, I wanted a beautiful love story. I wanted a fairy tale picture of perfection -- Prince Charming and Snow White living happily ever after...

I had it, for just a moment.

And then my happy-ever-after ending went all haywire. These things keep happening. I did a lot of self-help to figure out why. I eventually came to the conclusion that, for the most part, it boils down to "shit happens." That's life. But it's all in how you look at it.

Either it's shit... or it's fertilizer for planting new seeds.

I'm writing a whole comic book series, and each book tells the story of a different "love of my life." The first book, quite naturally, tells the story of my first true love.

  • It tells the story of when, why, and how I made the decision to follow my heart, no matter how many stupid ideas it came up with.
  • It tells the story of how falling in love with your soulmate can change you forever.
  • It tells the story of how you can survive a broken heart.
  • It tells the story of how a small, well-timed moment of kindness can redirect the course of a person's life forever.
  • It tells the story of how I fell in love with Spain, long before I ever touched down in Barcelona.
  • It tells the story of how I've been a victim of violence.
  • But more importantly, it tells the story of how I've overcome my circumstances each and every time it happens.
  • It tells the story of how I became my own "white knight."
  • It tells the story of how I became a real life super hero. (And even put together a pretty cool costume!)

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't buy the book today, feel free to help out in other ways!

  • You can share this with your friends, and of course tell them why you want to read the book!
  • Like my fan page on Facebook, and share the things that you like! http://www.facebook.com/jillianratliffcomedy
  • If you'd like to become an official promoter of the book, there are some special prizes in it for you! Contact me via email: jillian@fearmonster.org 

I'm excited to finally hold the finished product in my hands. Care to join me?

 "From Victim to Victory" will be released in December, 2015. However, by being a part of the Indiegogo campaign, you'll be the first to read the book! Advance copies will be shipped to anyone who pre-orders the book through Indiegogo. The book will be sent out to contributors a week before it will be available for sale to the public.
Your options for buying the book today:  eBook -- $15
Paperback copy (includes eBook)-- $35
Hardcover copy (includes eBook)-- $60
Autographed hardcover copy (includes eBook) -- $100

Everyone who pre-orders the book through the Indiegogo campaign will get to read each chapter as it is finished. It will be sent to your email as an eBook!
Hardcover copies are only available through the Indiegogo campaign.

Please include an additional $5 for shipping outside the United States.




   The Extras! I'll be releasing a lot of special extras over the course of the campaign! The extras are separate from pre-ordering the book, so you can get as many as you want! Be sure to check back again throughout the campaign!
June 2nd - Launch Day - Autographed Numbered Art Prints
To start out, I have 75 numbered prints of the cover art to sell (out of 100, the first 25 were already claimed, before we even got to today)!



June 9th - Week 2 - X-Files inspired "George the Fear Monster" t-shirt
One of the main characters in the book is George, my inner fear monster. He's really sweet and cute, but often gets afraid of silly things. I'm also a big fan of the X-Files so I made this t-shirt! The t-shirt is American Apparel, made and printed in the USA. Men and women's sizes are available, and will be shipped after the campaign is over. (For more George, check out the comics at fearmonster.org!)


June 16th - Week 3 - Hippie "George the Fear Monster" t-shirt
George is also a hippie. So, I made this 1960s inspired t-shirt! It reads, "Make Love Not Fear." If you're at least part hippie and you believe there should be more love and less fear in the world, then you'll love wearing this shirt with pride! The t-shirt is American Apparel, made and printed in the USA. Men and women's sizes are available, and will be shipped after the campaign is over. (For more George, check out the comics at fearmonster.org!)


June 23rd - Week 4 - Anxel "The Angel of Death" signed art print and t-shirt!
This is Anxel, the bad boy love interest in the book. He's a Spanish speaking smart ass, and super protective of me. I mean... my character! He's my guardian angel, basically. You'll get to know him much better in the book, of course. But if you're a Twilight fan and you were "Team Edward," then eat your heart out! I mean, why settle for a vampire when you can have an angel? (Actually, technically, he's nephilim -- half angel, half human.)
This numbered art print is an 8.5x11" and it's autographed by the author. Only 100 available!


Anxel is also available as a t-shirt! The t-shirt is American Apparel, made and printed in the USA. Men and women's sizes are available, and will be shipped after the campaign is over.


    

FAQ
Q. I can get a book on my Kindle for $0.99. Why should I pay $35 for a comic book?
A. This is more than just a comic book! It's a really long comic book. It's 250 pages of full color art! For one thing, color printing is very expensive, so the book costs more than a normal book with just words does.Secondly, you're not only paying for the book, but all the time I've invested into research, writing, rewriting, rewriting again, and drawing the book. It takes a lot more time to make a graphic novel than it would for just a normal Kindle book.Thirdly, you're paying for quality. I put my whole heart and soul into this book, and I love what I'm doing. The book is a piece of my soul, and thus priced accordingly. I'm selling my soul to you rather than to the Devil himself. (Don't worry, that was never an option. Just a joke!)
Q. When does the book come out?A. The book will be out in December, just in time for Christmas. So if you want to get your Christmas shopping done really early, buy everyone on your Christmas list a copy of the book! Please note, by pre-ordering through the Indiegogo campaign, you'll get the book a week before everyone else. Also, hardcover and autographed copies are only available through the Indiegogo campaign.Q. I can't afford the book. Is there a way to get a free copy?A. Kind of, but not exactly. If you'd like to become an official promoter of the book, send me an email at jillian@fearmonster.org. I'll give you a special link to share with your friends and family. If 10 people buy the book through you, I'll give you a free copy!Q. If I buy one of the extras, do I still have to buy the book?A. Yes. The extras are just that, extras! I did that on purpose. A lot of my fans love George but aren't big book readers. And a lot of my fans are comic book readers but don't really like t-shirts with stuff printed on them. So, you've got options! You have the choice to buy as much or as little as you want through the Indiegogo campaign!

Why It Helps So Much to Pre-Order...
I've been working on this baby for 4 years, and I'm fully committed to getting it done and in your hands by Christmas this year! The only real challenge is running out of money for rent and food before I get done. Then I would have to go get a "real job" and nobody wants that.... Right?
The more books I can sell ahead of time, the more time I have to dedicate to drawing the rest of this story!

The Backstory...
Four years ago, I started to write a book about my life. Like everyone, I wanted a beautiful love story. I wanted a fairy tale picture of perfection -- Prince Charming and Snow White living happily ever after...
I had it, for just a moment.
And then my happy-ever-after ending went all haywire. These things keep happening. I did a lot of self-help to figure out why. I eventually came to the conclusion that, for the most part, it boils down to "shit happens." That's life. But it's all in how you look at it.
Either it's shit... or it's fertilizer for planting new seeds.
I'm writing a whole comic book series, and each book tells the story of a different "love of my life." The first book, quite naturally, tells the story of my first true love.

It tells the story of when, why, and how I made the decision to follow my heart, no matter how many stupid ideas it came up with.
It tells the story of how falling in love with your soulmate can change you forever.
It tells the story of how you can survive a broken heart.
It tells the story of how a small, well-timed moment of kindness can redirect the course of a person's life forever.
It tells the story of how I fell in love with Spain, long before I ever touched down in Barcelona.
It tells the story of how I've been a victim of violence.
But more importantly, it tells the story of how I've overcome my circumstances each and every time it happens.
It tells the story of how I became my own "white knight."
It tells the story of how I became a real life super hero. (And even put together a pretty cool costume!)

    Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can't buy the book today, feel free to help out in other ways!  You can share this with your friends, and of course tell them why you want to read the book! Like my fan page on Facebook, and share the things that you like! http://www.facebook.com/jillianratliffcomedy

If you'd like to become an official promoter of the book, there are some special prizes in it for you! Contact me via email: jillian@fearmonster.org 


I'm excited to finally hold the finished product in my hands. Care to join me?

story:
Hello!

My name is Mo Liang and I'm a film student in New York.

"Connie gets hungry" is an interactive book/game  which has great animation and interactive effects.

The goal of the book is to inspire babies/kids to eat nutritive food.

Actually, my niece Connie who is 4  bites everything she gets and we came up with this idea to make the book for her in 2013. 

In this story, Connie tries to eat everything she finds in the big house before she finally has to eat the normal food. So we thinks the kids like Connie will not bites anything when they have this book hopefully. 
Would you  want to see if it works?



What is this all for

We met some technical difficulties and we have to fix the game engine.

Also,some content of the app is not allowed by App Store and we have to make a new version.

To be able to finish the project we need to reach the $2000 goal . 

The funds will be paying for the extra work on illustration, animation and programming. Also we'll pay for the music, voice over and sound effects.

You'll Get

  • Special thanks on  our Facebook page ( https://www.facebook.com/TheUglyStar ) and our website (http://www.theuglystar.com/)
  • PDF of "Connie gets hungry" including original illustrations
  • Postcards and emblem
  • A mantle designed by Connie's Mum
  • Type A

  • Type B

story:
The book " Forgive me outside inside " is a kind of poetry by @suryolho . The book can be found at the marketplace with ISBN: 9781367502345. Next will be made into a comic book by the same author . Make a comic of poetry is an idea that is quite " crazy " but interesting course. Enough doubt whether anyone ever did before. All poetic , which is already quite " something " it will be converted into a cartoon. Poetic language will be set forth in a comic story with one character .

Funding as expected is $ 950 . These funds will support the work of comic and printing . Comic have already started on working even since the campaign was launched . The book will published by "R Comic". The comic will at the marketplace for a later time.

Although the overall goal is not achieved , we make sure the supporters will be awarded in accordance Perk .

Maybe this is the first in creating a comic or graphic novel from a collection of poetry . Supporting this comic will probably be part of the new history of the world of comics .

Actually, maybe the usual cultivation of comics with a deadline less than two months . Only this comic drawing done by one person alone . If the possibility of time is not sufficient , there must be forced to change the story or reduction of the page .

Support by spreading this project will be nice.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I'm Sammie. I'm a working class woman with bipolar disorder. I've been a professional entertainer and dance teacher for over 10 years. I was inspired to try stand-up comedy in 2013 when I was at The Edinburgh Fringe with a play. I love the way it integrates performing with subjects we are passionate about. Anyway, it turns out I'm pretty funny (not always for the right reasons) I made the final of CAN Comedy's New Act of the Year on only my 7th gig and there's these people that keep coming to see me, calling themselves fans.
I'm a feminist and advocate of the Free the Nipple campaign. I believe our bodies should be seen as equal and women should be able to express their sexuality without shame or the risk of being violated. As a rape survivor, the Free the Nipple message resonates with me deeply. Flesh alone, should not be seen as a sexual invitation.
So I'm doing a show about that, with my tits out (for the girls!) I'm also starting a social enterprise with an emphasis on female empowerment. I particularly want to reach out to vulnerable and under privileged women like myself.
I believe the 4th wave of feminism is about allowing ourselves and each other to be whole. Whatever our gender. 
Last year I did my first show as a comic on a shoestring budget. Despite attracting above average and sometimes full audiences, I found the process of writing, producing, performing and marketing a show all by myself extremely overwhelming and only just got through the month with my sanity intact. Your contributions mean I can work with a team and share the responsibilty. Ultimately having more time to work on creating a great experience for the audience.

What We Need & What You Get


About £2000 would cover the following and things I need to buy for perks.
Flyerer : £480
Accommodation & Travel: £800
Technician: £480
My perks include services I will be offering through my social enterprise. Dance classes for women. There's also tickets for the show, T-Shirts, Badges and hand made banners!
If I don't reach my entire goal any funds raised will still go directly into the show. Any additional funds would go towards team costs, I could hire addition help.
The Impact
This isn't just a comedy show, it's an invitation. We are in need of a sexual revolution! 
Kid's are watching porn from as young as 8. This is addictive, hardcore porn affects the brain differently to softcore still images such as playboy and page 3. Research also suggests that 40% of online porn depicts violence against women.
As a woman I used to be terrified of my sexuality. I know I'm not alone, according to research 80% of woman feel like there is something missing in their lives. The virtual world can be all consuming, dividing us from ourselves and each other. 
Campaigns like He for She have inspired men to join the conversation on feminism. Men are are four times more likely to commit suicide. Could this be because hyper masculine stereotypes are leading to emotional repression?
1 in 4 people are affected by mental health issues. Why is this? I want to take about these subjects in my show and invite the audience to do the same.
I love stand up comedy. To me its a form of alchemyl, transforming darkness into light.
Some believe the arts are becoming elitist, grants are harder to come by and people from background's similar to myself are struggling more and more to break into the industry. Its hard enough to find money to live, let alone fund internships and creative projects. Is it coincidental that most successful comedians are middle class white men?
I first visited the fringe in 2013 with a play 'Very Still & Hard to See' this received 4 star reviews. In 2014 I took part in Bobby Murdock's 'Who Dares Grins' Showcase and last year I did my first show 'Consume Shit & Die' which attracted above average, often full audiences. We also had our Free The Nipple Rally on the Royal Mile for International Go Topless Day. This recieved coverage in the national press, was peaceful and enjoyed by all. One protester citing that is was the best protest for inclusion they had ever been on. Our Free the Nipple rally is happening again this year.
Grateful for any contribution big or small, if you can't afford to donate but believe in the campaign please share on social media. Just knowing that other people care about what I'm trying to achieve lifts my spirits and encourages me to work harder.

Risks & Challenges

My bipolar disorder has always posed a risk in my professional life, but thanks to the governments access to work grant I will be working with a support worker to overcome the abilities I lack for the business side of producing a show. With support, I know I can live a full life.
Also having been part of the comedy community for over 2 years now I know I'll have plenty of emotional support from some of the beautiful people I have met along the way.
Having my finances in order will reduce the stress of the experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

I totally understand if you can't contribute finanancially, but if you like the idea of my show, I'll be forever grateful if you could share this page with your friends.

story:
HENNY ON ICE

This is the name of the fourth track on my album. I wanted to combine themes of very heated sexuality, with the brunette on the barstool, one half of the center piece, playing the appearance of the femme fatale. I visualized the characters in a glass of Hennessy  and coca-cola. Hence the figures having bubbles fizz around them as they make their descent to the bottom of the glass.

 

 

GROUNDHOG'S DAY

This is the name of the thirteenth track off my album. This drawing I channeled from my experience of living with my family before, and after I was homeless. The fatigue and endless cycle of same'ol, same 'ol feeling like there was no escape for a period of time. A endless loop.  I even make a reference to the song "Hotel California", a song by the group known as "The Eagles", that has a similar vibe on the subject.

 

 

KNIGHTS IN SHINING DARKNESS

This is the name of the eleventh track from my album. This illustration is a tribute to one of my all time favorite artists, Mike Mignola. Famous for creating "Hell Boy". With the heavy shadows, old world conventional warfare, ancient body armor, and cultures with these minimalist backgrounds. This song is about my high level of empathy and the internal protection I need to safeguard myself. Hence the Knights in the shadows.

 

 

There will be a Japanese translation of the book!

I have the amazing opportunity to have my book translated in Japanese! Below are pictures of my artwork being used on a flyer for a punk rock show thrown by my friend Fran Powers, who lives in Okinawa Japan, which is where these photos are from. The image is from a flyer I designed that I am also offering as one of the perks in this campaign. To see the flyer just scroll past the photos below and you will see. My buddy Fran's wife is doing the translation for the book, once that's done I will have my letterer put that to the version of the book.

These two photos are taken from the streets of Okinawa, In its capital of Naha, on it's main street called Kokusai Dori. Which is like Times Sq, in NYC.

This is the original flyer where the image was taken from.

 

My music live and direct!!

The video below is from birthday show performance, that also celebrated the completion of the drawings to my illustration book, and preview to my graphic novel titled'4' that is in the works. The song being performed is "Knights in shining darkness", sound familiar? This was at Leftfield Bar, in Lower Manhattan, on a Saturday night. I rocked this song over live beatmaking, through a program called "Ableton" provided by P.Cruz, one half of the rap duo known as 'Punskription'.

 
This photo was taken post rehearsals at Funkadelic Studios in Midtown Manhattan, with P.Cruz who is the live beatmaker in the video above during my Bday Artwork Preview show. This was part of the level of preparation I put into to get that show off the ground.

 

Not only do I draw on paper but I am also the canvas for artwork. At all my shows I wear face paint. Most times I do it myself but in the case of this picture I had a face paint artist by the name of Niazja Blessed Rios do the honors.

On one occasion, I even used my talents to win free food at Five Guys in Midtown Manhattan one night. In this pic I'm holding the free burger while pointing to the drawing that I posted on their board. 

This was the drawing I did and of course I had to  do some self promotion. Always get the word out about my work is a must.

I always find a place for my self expression, in this case on the mask I wear right before I hit the stage for all my shows when I reveal the face paint underneath. 

Face paint, guns out! LOL. I truly feel free the less clothes I am wearing on stage.

 

Step by Step process  of how I execute artwork

If you've ever wondered how I conjure up all the drawings I did for the illustration book. I've added videos below of the step by step process of how I did a mural of Marvels Deadpool and other Marvel characters for a friend of mines son. The finish product went on the wall in his room.

 

What I Need & What You Get

  • Production of entire book $1,150 for 500 copies each copy is priced at $2.50
  • Lettering costs- Side lettering( my name and book title on the spine on the book is $100)
  • 18 pages of text. Descriptions, preface, advertising for album. $300.
  • Overseas shipping and delivery to my door $500
  • Japanese translation. 18 pages of text, $80 per page= $1,440
  • My total estimated goal $3,500.
  •  Some of the unique perks I have will include The 11 x 17 Bristol boards that contain the original artwork from the illustration book. Original artwork from my upcoming graphic novel "4" on Bristol art boards and a full color flyer I designed for the preview show I did on my Birthday March 4th, 2017.
  • The campaign is flexible, which means if in the unfortunate event that goal is not met for the campaign, I can take the funds that were earned and still contribute them to the creation of the book. To make up for the difference I can cut costs from promotion so that all the perks are delivered.

 

Ok, so what happens after the book is published???

Glad you asked! Prior to me finishing the book, I spoke with three comic book stores. They were St. Marks comics on St. Marks Place, Forbidden Planet on Union Sq. both in Manhattan, New York, and the newly established Thought Bubble Comics based in New Jersey. They are all open to carrying my book once published. More ambitions I have is..

  • Head to Philadelphia and visit "Amalgam Comics & Coffehouse Inc." Which is the first black woman owned comic book store. I will go there in hopes of getting my book carried by that store as well. 
  • Place my illustration book across public libraries in NYC.
  • Set up a booth at the annual black comic book festival at Harlems Schomburg center for research in Black Culture.
  • I will also pay visit to other small and large comic book conventions on the east coast.
  • Lastly I will be putting my book on Digital comic book platforms for those who prefer e-comics.

What's the timeline for the release?

  • The campaign itself will last 40 days
  • Lettering in English and in Japanese will take a month
  • Shipping will take a month as well. Being that the book will be shipped by sea, from China, have to go through customs, and then finally delivered to my door.
  • 3 months it will be then til I can start mailing/shipping out rewards from perks

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • For those of you who would like to contribute but can't financially, there are other ways you can help out. Share! Tweet, Facebook, email, make signs. Share this indiegogo web page with those who you think would be interested in supporting.
 
  • Social Media
 
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/8thrankrecords

 

​Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/skarmanlives/

 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SuperKingArmor/

 

Twitter: https://twitter.com/SuperKingArmor

 

Tumblr: https://superkingarmor.tumblr.com/

 

Blog: http://8thrankrecords.blogspot.com/

 

Short Summary

My name is Enrae Mercer, but I go by the stage name Super King Armor. I am a hip hop artist from Queens, New York. I started a small indie label named 8th Rank Records, and have put out two music projects. The first being a 7 track Ep titled the "Werewolf Lullabies". The second being my full length album titled "Gone is the illusion". Now I am venturing into new territory by publishing my first illustration book! I have my letterer (That's the person who puts the text with any pictures in the book). I'm doing offset printing, which means I will be printing in bulk. A total of 500 copies are going to press! For those of you who prefer an E-book, there will be one too!  To see my vision come to life take a look at some of the images featured in the book below with links to the music that was inspired by it!

 

NOT A DREAM, BUT REALITY

So why the campaign? Here's the deal. I've been in love with comic books forever. I remember very fondly in my childhood memories my grandmother walking me home from school and stopping by the local bodega and seeing all these comic books on a laundry line and begging her to buy me some. She eventually did and that's where my journey with drawing began. All I wanted to do was draw for Marvel or DC comics back then. So now years later, to be publishing my own book, it still hasn't sunk in what I'm about to accomplish. Very few things catch me off guard and make me feel giddy. This! Is one of those things.

The whole process of getting to this point is also a big deal for me. What started as just doing the front and back cover to my album Gone is the illusion which was a big deal in itself because I had never published any art to the world like that. Especially with my music. It gave me a tremendous surge that spoke to me, and said, if you can get this far...How much farther could you go? And I went farther, and I finished it! Now All I need is the funds to produce it!

 

The Impact

    • It's important for me to release this book to prove not only to myself but to other aspiring artists of any medium that you can create your own world without being hindered by someone else's small perception of it. Especially when you know somebody who's successfully done it. Through that display of strength I also wanted to show balance to it by placing the themes of isolation, and introspection in my art work. Those being  two of the dominant themes you experience when laying the groundwork of your individuality.
    •  Each time I set out to accomplish a goal I've reached it. As a musician I was successful in putting out my album 'Gone Is The Illusion', because I was detail oriented in my approach to it. I obtained copyrights to all the lyrics from my album, I started my own publishing company. I set up distribution on multiple channels. The first and major one was CD Baby which distributed my album to itunes, spotify, amazon, Google play, emusic, and multiple other independent digital music purchase sites. Too further cover my bases I put my music on bandcamp, a site that's not in CDbaby's package of digital and physical distribution. Now I approach this project with the same detail and focus. As obvious as it sounds, I can only put my all into things I care about. This illustration book being an extension of my album gets the same.

     

    Risks & Challenges

    • To reach my goals I will utilize my extensive network of people that are fans of my music as well as those who have previewed my artwork and are anticipating the release of my book. What's important to me is reaching out to people individually and through my email list. I've also made contact with people face to face recently that I've known for years but hadn't seen in awhile and are excited to contribute. I believe that the only true obstacle I face is that there is only one of me, and I can only do so much. As much as I'd like to believe that's not true, having a network, and people sharing the campaign with their friends and family really speeds up the process of completion.
    • Social Media
     
    Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/8thrankrecords

     

    ​Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/skarmanlives/

     

    Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SuperKingArmor/

     

    Twitter: https://twitter.com/SuperKingArmor

     

    Tumblr: https://superkingarmor.tumblr.com/

     

    Blog: http://8thrankrecords.blogspot.com/
story_txt:
HENNY ON ICE
This is the name of the fourth track on my album. I wanted to combine themes of very heated sexuality, with the brunette on the barstool, one half of the center piece, playing the appearance of the femme fatale. I visualized the characters in a glass of Hennessy  and coca-cola. Hence the figures having bubbles fizz around them as they make their descent to the bottom of the glass.
  GROUNDHOG'S DAYThis is the name of the thirteenth track off my album. This drawing I channeled from my experience of living with my family before, and after I was homeless. The fatigue and endless cycle of same'ol, same 'ol feeling like there was no escape for a period of time. A endless loop.  I even make a reference to the song "Hotel California", a song by the group known as "The Eagles", that has a similar vibe on the subject.  KNIGHTS IN SHINING DARKNESSThis is the name of the eleventh track from my album. This illustration is a tribute to one of my all time favorite artists, Mike Mignola. Famous for creating "Hell Boy". With the heavy shadows, old world conventional warfare, ancient body armor, and cultures with these minimalist backgrounds. This song is about my high level of empathy and the internal protection I need to safeguard myself. Hence the Knights in the shadows.  There will be a Japanese translation of the book!I have the amazing opportunity to have my book translated in Japanese! Below are pictures of my artwork being used on a flyer for a punk rock show thrown by my friend Fran Powers, who lives in Okinawa Japan, which is where these photos are from. The image is from a flyer I designed that I am also offering as one of the perks in this campaign. To see the flyer just scroll past the photos below and you will see. My buddy Fran's wife is doing the translation for the book, once that's done I will have my letterer put that to the version of the book.These two photos are taken from the streets of Okinawa, In its capital of Naha, on it's main street called Kokusai Dori. Which is like Times Sq, in NYC.This is the original flyer where the image was taken from. My music live and direct!!The video below is from birthday show performance, that also celebrated the completion of the drawings to my illustration book, and preview to my graphic novel titled'4' that is in the works. The song being performed is "Knights in shining darkness", sound familiar? This was at Leftfield Bar, in Lower Manhattan, on a Saturday night. I rocked this song over live beatmaking, through a program called "Ableton" provided by P.Cruz, one half of the rap duo known as 'Punskription'. This photo was taken post rehearsals at Funkadelic Studios in Midtown Manhattan, with P.Cruz who is the live beatmaker in the video above during my Bday Artwork Preview show. This was part of the level of preparation I put into to get that show off the ground. Not only do I draw on paper but I am also the canvas for artwork. At all my shows I wear face paint. Most times I do it myself but in the case of this picture I had a face paint artist by the name of Niazja Blessed Rios do the honors.On one occasion, I even used my talents to win free food at Five Guys in Midtown Manhattan one night. In this pic I'm holding the free burger while pointing to the drawing that I posted on their board. This was the drawing I did and of course I had to  do some self promotion. Always get the word out about my work is a must.I always find a place for my self expression, in this case on the mask I wear right before I hit the stage for all my shows when I reveal the face paint underneath. Face paint, guns out! LOL. I truly feel free the less clothes I am wearing on stage. Step by Step process  of how I execute artworkIf you've ever wondered how I conjure up all the drawings I did for the illustration book. I've added videos below of the step by step process of how I did a mural of Marvels Deadpool and other Marvel characters for a friend of mines son. The finish product went on the wall in his room.






 
What I Need & What You Get

Production of entire book $1,150 for 500 copies each copy is priced at $2.50

Lettering costs- Side lettering( my name and book title on the spine on the book is $100)

18 pages of text. Descriptions, preface, advertising for album. $300.
Overseas shipping and delivery to my door $500


Japanese translation. 18 pages of text, $80 per page= $1,440

My total estimated goal $3,500.
 Some of the unique perks I have will include The 11 x 17 Bristol boards that contain the original artwork from the illustration book. Original artwork from my upcoming graphic novel "4" on Bristol art boards and a full color flyer I designed for the preview show I did on my Birthday March 4th, 2017.
The campaign is flexible, which means if in the unfortunate event that goal is not met for the campaign, I can take the funds that were earned and still contribute them to the creation of the book. To make up for the difference I can cut costs from promotion so that all the perks are delivered.

 
Ok, so what happens after the book is published???
Glad you asked! Prior to me finishing the book, I spoke with three comic book stores. They were St. Marks comics on St. Marks Place, Forbidden Planet on Union Sq. both in Manhattan, New York, and the newly established Thought Bubble Comics based in New Jersey. They are all open to carrying my book once published. More ambitions I have is..

Head to Philadelphia and visit "Amalgam Comics & Coffehouse Inc." Which is the first black woman owned comic book store. I will go there in hopes of getting my book carried by that store as well. 
Place my illustration book across public libraries in NYC.
Set up a booth at the annual black comic book festival at Harlems Schomburg center for research in Black Culture.

I will also pay visit to other small and large comic book conventions on the east coast.
Lastly I will be putting my book on Digital comic book platforms for those who prefer e-comics.

What's the timeline for the release?

The campaign itself will last 40 days
Lettering in English and in Japanese will take a month
Shipping will take a month as well. Being that the book will be shipped by sea, from China, have to go through customs, and then finally delivered to my door.
3 months it will be then til I can start mailing/shipping out rewards from perks



 
Other Ways You Can Help
For those of you who would like to contribute but can't financially, there are other ways you can help out. Share! Tweet, Facebook, email, make signs. Share this indiegogo web page with those who you think would be interested in supporting.

 
Social Media
 
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/8thrankrecords


 
​Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/skarmanlives/
 
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SuperKingArmor/
 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/SuperKingArmor
 
Tumblr: https://superkingarmor.tumblr.com/
 
Blog: http://8thrankrecords.blogspot.com/

 
Short Summary
My name is Enrae Mercer, but I go by the stage name Super King Armor. I am a hip hop artist from Queens, New York. I started a small indie label named 8th Rank Records, and have put out two music projects. The first being a 7 track Ep titled the "Werewolf Lullabies". The second being my full length album titled "Gone is the illusion". Now I am venturing into new territory by publishing my first illustration book! I have my letterer (That's the person who puts the text with any pictures in the book). I'm doing offset printing, which means I will be printing in bulk. A total of 500 copies are going to press! For those of you who prefer an E-book, there will be one too!  To see my vision come to life take a look at some of the images featured in the book below with links to the music that was inspired by it! NOT A DREAM, BUT REALITYSo why the campaign? Here's the deal. I've been in love with comic books forever. I remember very fondly in my childhood memories my grandmother walking me home from school and stopping by the local bodega and seeing all these comic books on a laundry line and begging her to buy me some. She eventually did and that's where my journey with drawing began. All I wanted to do was draw for Marvel or DC comics back then. So now years later, to be publishing my own book, it still hasn't sunk in what I'm about to accomplish. Very few things catch me off guard and make me feel giddy. This! Is one of those things.The whole process of getting to this point is also a big deal for me. What started as just doing the front and back cover to my album Gone is the illusion which was a big deal in itself because I had never published any art to the world like that. Especially with my music. It gave me a tremendous surge that spoke to me, and said, if you can get this far...How much farther could you go? And I went farther, and I finished it! Now All I need is the funds to produce it!
 
The Impact

It's important for me to release this book to prove not only to myself but to other aspiring artists of any medium that you can create your own world without being hindered by someone else's small perception of it. Especially when you know somebody who's successfully done it. Through that display of strength I also wanted to show balance to it by placing the themes of isolation, and introspection in my art work. Those being  two of the dominant themes you experience when laying the groundwork of your individuality.
 Each time I set out to accomplish a goal I've reached it. As a musician I was successful in putting out my album 'Gone Is The Illusion', because I was detail oriented in my approach to it. I obtained copyrights to all the lyrics from my album, I started my own publishing company. I set up distribution on multiple channels. The first and major one was CD Baby which distributed my album to itunes, spotify, amazon, Google play, emusic, and multiple other independent digital music purchase sites. Too further cover my bases I put my music on bandcamp, a site that's not in CDbaby's package of digital and physical distribution. Now I approach this project with the same detail and focus. As obvious as it sounds, I can only put my all into things I care about. This illustration book being an extension of my album gets the same.

 
Risks & Challenges
To reach my goals I will utilize my extensive network of people that are fans of my music as well as those who have previewed my artwork and are anticipating the release of my book. What's important to me is reaching out to people individually and through my email list. I've also made contact with people face to face recently that I've known for years but hadn't seen in awhile and are excited to contribute. I believe that the only true obstacle I face is that there is only one of me, and I can only do so much. As much as I'd like to believe that's not true, having a network, and people sharing the campaign with their friends and family really speeds up the process of completion.

story:
♥ Help House of Ñ fly from Mexico to GeekGirlCon in Seattle!

 

We’re super excited that GeekGirlCon invited our collective to present this year. We can't wait to share their inclusive space and our passions with other amazing presenters and attendees! 

                                             

Our name is House of Ñ. Most of us are based in Mexico; except for Adriana. She will be doing the hosting in Seattle, while Valeria and Karla do the traveling from Mexico City to present at the convention.

We are a Mexican graphic-narrative translation collective. We translate literary and creative content to and from a few languages and promote quality in comics translation through workshops and presentations.

We are excited to share our collective comics translation approach with the Seattle GeekGirlCon audience, and walk them through our forthcoming Spanish translation of the comic Bound By Law published by Duke University. 

 

♥♥  With your help, we can cover the cost of travel!  ♥♥

story:
Who am I, the team involved, and what Icepick is.

Todd Rayner - The Creator, writer, and artist for Icepick. I have worked on several independent comics as a digital colorist for Enterlight Studios, Arcana, Wave Entertainment, and Bluewater Productions.

Cover artists for this issue:

Todd Rayner - Standard Cover A

Dave Dabila - 3D Retro Cover D

Ben Hansen - Cover B

Ben Jones - Cover C Splash - Colors for Cover C

Mike McMahon - Cover E

Icepick is a character whose story that I have wanted to publish since I was a kid. Over the years I have revised and cleaned up the story to make it something more than just a kid wanting to make a comic book. It started with issue 1 which I painstakingly funded and published myself. 

With your help I can publish issue 2 and also get out there to meet you the fans!

Why Crowd Funding?

There’s no middlemen. It's just you and me. The best thing about Icepick is that most of the creative work on the book is complete. I plan to start shipping the rewards within six-eight weeks of closing this campaign. Without the middleman I can included various reward tiers, such as the multiple variant covers, stickers, trading cards, and more!

 

​With your help I can produce many more covers, issues, and be able to get to a convention near you with all these awesome books. Every penny raised goes towards making Issue 2 of Icepick a reality. That covers everything from the creative side, printing, supplies, taxes, and fees. In other words, everything that it takes to make this happen is where the bulk of the money is going! All profits will go toward funding future stories and making sure I am at shows meeting and greeting you, the fans! 

Think of your pledge as a sneak peek or a pre-purchase. I’ve put together several rewards that I hope you'll love. Plus any of the rewards make a great gift for anyone in your family!

Risks & Challenges

When it comes to shipping on time and reward fulfillment, any project can have obstacles. Most of the perks (including possible Stretch Goal incentives) are standing by to print, as most of the creative is complete. My printers are ready to go as soon as I give them word! I have worked with these printers before and they deliver the top notch books and rewards you’ll be receiving, this you can count on. If there are any hiccups or delays I will be in constant communication with all backers during the entire process and update you in a timely manner.

I want to assure you that making the best and highest quality products possible and having them delivered to you in a timely and undamaged way is my top priority. 

In conclusion, I’d like to thank all the readers, fans, and any collectors who have supported me over the last year. You’re the reason I keep going and you have been AMAZING!

Please pledge now! If you can’t pledge now, please share on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, as every bit helps!

story:
May I introduce you to my 24 year old passion project.

First imagined when I was a Junior in Highschool Trial by Fire featured myself and four friends portrayed as cybernetic superheroes on a space alien slaughtering mission straight out of a 90's comic book. NOW Trial by Fire is the saga of a man who has destroyed the world and crippled the dimensional space through his blind ambition and misguided use of technology.

And here is the crazy hook, the world doesn't get fixed, everything sinks deeper and deeper into oblivion. But, maybe oblivion is a destination? Is all this turmoil the destiny of everything including you and me? Trial by fire is about a team of superheroes struggling to fix what cannot be fixed and failing at every turn.

SO…...what happens when we know our heroes will lose no matter what?
Trial By Fire Primary will begin to explore this question while unlocking an avalanche of others. 

 

The Players

Caesar : A boy genius inventory that creates a corporation, the manufacturer machines that speak to the dead, corrects the debt of any nation, cars that fold space, and synthetic light to later have it all fall apart as all that there is unravels around him. 


MeatBAHL : The body positive enforcer of the TBF team he is loyal to Caesar and loves a good cheese burger.

David S.I.N. ; Synthetic Ion Nanobot 
The TBF Field leader is composed of intelligent light and in effect cannot die unless all of light is extinguished. He is strong as he is precise and is always fast to jump on any grenade in order to complete the mission. 

ANZIO: Adapted Nanobot Zeta Intelligence Officer
The literal brains of the operation when on field mission ANZIO acts as a mobile information hub connected to the actually intelligent light that’s within DavidSIN and blasted throughout time and space.

His body/shell is composed of experimental floating joints that allow him to move though any situation and fit nearly in any space so that he can maintain the strongest signal possibl

PittBull : From parts unknown even Ceaser can't trace where Pitty came from after he crashed to Earth encased in a meteor. What is known is that he is fast, agile, invisible, and strong enough to fight off anything.

IT'S ALL ABOUT THE STORY WITH THIS ONE COVER 

 

Here are the pages 

 

GET READY TO TURN THE BOOK SIDE WAYS 


THE HEROES YOU LOVE IN ACTION


 

 

ABOUT THE PRODUCTION

As the years continued I dedicated my time in completing trial by fire as if it were still 1997 meaning no digital drawing, emulating the computer coloring at the time all this to stay true to my vision at that time. My time as an art director  honed my skills to build consistency in my product while making everything one a kind and unique. The art direction for TBF is simple. Make this comic book as if the 90’s never slowed down.

story:
Tales from the Stacks: Special Collections is the final edition of this 60 page graphic novel, collecting three uncanny tales in the vein of The Twilight Zone or Tales from the Crypt. All stories are written by myself, Michael Critzer (Professor Geek) and each is illustrated by a different artist, including Keung Lee and Illustrator Monk!

As soon as the first campaign wrapped up, people were emailing me weekly to see if there was any chance they could still obtain the book. As I began the fulfillment process, I noticed many promotional art pieces that didn't come in time to make the final edit. These are mind blowing pinups and covers by Keung Lee, Illustrator Monk, and more! So to appease everyone, I decided to launch one final special edition of the book, including these magnificent pinups, character treatments, and with new front and back covers to boot!

Included is the same great art and stories from the original artists:

Illustrator Monk

Keung Lee

Ralph del Mundo and more (for more samples, see the old page for the original campaign here: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/tales-from-the-stacks-vol-1

And here is just a tease of some of the new art included in the Special Collections Edition:

And of course this edition will include the two previous variant covers by Jon Malin/Kyle Ritter, and Keung Lee
